The Republic of Ireland international travelled last night and was not in Celtic’s squad for their 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox.
Idah is expected to finalise his move, with Celtic making continued progress in talks for
Anderlecht
forward
Kasper Dolberg
.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic and Swansea have agreed an initial fee of £6m, plus more than £1m in add-ons.
Idah completed the first part of his medical with Swansea on Friday and agreed personal terms.
He was then called back by Celtic after the Hoops struggled to reach an agreement for Dolberg by close of play that day.
Celtic are looking to sign two strikers before tomorrow’s 11pm deadline in Scotland.

live_updates.title: Birmingham wait on Celtic green light to move for Yang
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Birmingham City
are waiting on
Celtic
to green-light a move for winger
Hyunjun Yang
.
It’s understood negotiations over the weekend have brought the initial fee to around £3m, with add-ons still to be ironed out.
If the move gets sanctioned, Yang could travel to Birmingham on Sunday night to undergo a medical.
The South Korea international was an unused substitute in Celtic's 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox today.

live_updates.title: Celtic target Tounekti playing for Hammarby as talks continue over move
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
target
Sebastian Tounekti
is playing for
Hammarby
today against
Osters IF
.
Sky Sports News
understands the Swedish club knocked back an improved offer worth £4.7m from the Scottish champions.
Celtic’s second offer included an initial fee of £3.9m, with £800,000 in add-ons.
Hammarby are looking for around £5m for the Tunisia international, or they won’t consider selling the player.
Talks are ongoing.

live_updates.title: Rodgers: Hopefully we can get some creativity in the squad in next 24 hours
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Celtic boss Brendan Rodgers to Sky Sports after drawing 0-0 against Rangers:
"I look back to 12 months ago and we were really fast and dynamic and I hope in the next 24 hours we can get the support to the squad that can give us the opportunity to give us that again.
"It's not disrespectful to the guys here because they need it. Any team needs that.
"We have a lot of work to do but we need the competition in the squad and creativity to take the game to the level we want to."
When asked if the club will be busy on Deadline Day, Rodgers said:
"It's clearly the plan to be. We want to pad out the squad with more quality, more speed and more creativity. Hopefully we can do that.
"There's a number of areas we need to freshen up."

live_updates.title: Celtic target Dolberg on Anderlecht bench
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
target
Kasper Dolberg
not named in the
Anderlecht
starting line-up for their game against Union Saint-Gilloise on Sunday.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic are making continued progress in talks for the Denmark international.
Dolberg is Anderlecht’s main striker and has scored five goals in eight games already this season.

live_updates.title: Idah completes medical ahead of Swansea move
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
striker
Adam Idah
has completed the second part of his medical ahead of a £7m move to
Swansea City
.
The Ireland international has also finalised the paperwork on a long-term contract.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic and Swansea have agreed an initial fee of £6m, plus more than £1m in add-ons.

live_updates.title: Old Firm make loan offers for Rak-Sakyi
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Christopher Reidy, Anthony Joseph and Sahil Jaidka:
Celtic
and
Rangers
have made loan offers today for
Crystal Palace
winger
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
.
Sky Sports News
revealed earlier today that
Leicester City
had made a loan bid for the 22-year-old.
But both Glasgow clubs and
Lyon
have entered the race this afternoon.
Rangers’ renewed interest comes after they had a loan offer rejected last month for Rak-Sakyi.
He has two years left on his contract.

live_updates.title: Dessers to leave Rangers before window closes
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Cyriel Dessers
is set to leave
Rangers
after two years at Ibrox.
Head coach
Russell Martin
said his substitute appearance against Celtic was likely to be his “last game for the club”.
The 30-year-old has scored 52 goals in 116 games during his two years at Ibrox.
AEK Athens
had a bid rejected earlier this summer for Dessers, and now face competition from Greek rivals
Panathinaikos
who are in the race to sign the player in a deal worth around £3.7m (€4.3m).

live_updates.title: Rangers close to signing Everton striker Chermiti
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka:
Rangers
are closing in on a deal to sign
Everton
striker
Youssef Chermiti
.
On Thursday,
Sky Sports News
reported Rangers had made contact over a loan move, with Everton boss
David Moyes
confirming the next day that a loan exit was likely.
However, it is understood that the Ibrox club are now hopeful of a permanent deal ahead of Monday’s 11pm deadline for Scottish clubs.
It is thought that Rangers would pay an initial £8m for the player, plus potential add-ons.
Chermiti is well known by Ibrox sporting director Kevin Thelwell, who helped sign him for the Premier League club in 2023 from Sporting Lisbon in a deal worth up to £15m.
The 21-year-old has been impacted by various injuries and made just 24 appearances for Everton, but is yet to score and is on the search for regular game time.
Russell Martin said he is “hopeful of concluding” a deal for the striker.

live_updates.title: Cornelius expected to seal Rangers move
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka & Dharmesh Sheth:
Rangers
are expected to sign
Marseille
defender
Derek
Cornelius
on deadline day
.
Italian side
Cremonese
were also keen on the player, but the Canadian international is edging closer to a loan move to Ibrox ahead of Monday’s 11pm deadline for Scottish clubs.
Cornelius is a left-footed centre-back who can also play as a left-back, with Rangers light on options in that area.

live_updates.title: Hearts add to goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Hearts
have signed
goalkeeper Alexander Schwolow.
The 33-year-old was a free agent and arrives at Tynecastle Park after leaving
Union Berlin
.
He has made more than 200 Bundesliga appearances and has signed a two-year deal at Hearts.
Schwolow will provide competition for Zander Clark, who has started every league game this season, with Craig Gordon and Ryan Fulton both injured.

live_updates.title: Deadline Day deals to look out for!
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Scottish Premiership clubs have until 11pm tonight to get their transfer business done. Here are some deals to keep an eye out for:
Celtic
are progressing with talks for
Anderlecht
striker
Kasper Dolberg
.
Brendan Rodgers insists
Adam Idah
can't leave
Celtic
for
Swansea
unless he is replaced. The striker has passed his medical and agreed terms on a £7m move.
Celtic
have had their latest bid of £4.7m rejected for winger
Sebastian Tounekti
of
Hammarby.
Birmingham City
want
Celtic
winger
Hyunjun Yang
in a deal worth at least £3m, while the likes of
Hayato Inamura
and
Stephen Welsh
could go out on loan.
Celtic
and
Rangers
both want
Crystal
Palace
winger
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi on loan but face
competition from
Leicester
and
Lyon.
Rangers
are set to sign
Everton
striker
Youssef
Chermiti
in a deal worth an initial £8m, plus potential add-ons.
Marseille
defender
Derek
Cornelius
is the other player set to head to Ibrox, despite
Cremonese
also wanting the Canada international.
Russell Martin confirmed to Sky Sports that
Cyriel Dessers
has played his last game for
Rangers
.
AEK Athens
had a bid rejected earlier this summer, and face competition from Greek rivals
Panathinaikos
over a £3.7m deal.
Rangers
midfielder
Nicolas Raskin
is a bit less clear. He was dropped from the squad for Sunday’s Old Firm clash and didn't train with the first team towards the end of last week.
Defenders
Clinton Nsiala
and
Leon King
are among those who have been told by Rangers to find new clubs.
Hibernian
continue to be linked with a move for
Birmingham City
striker
Lyndon Dykes
.
Bottom of the table
Aberdeen
are hoping to add at least two players, with
Fletcher Boyd
set to leave for
Aston Villa
in a £1m move and
Shayden Morris
joining
Luton Town
.
Dundee
are keen on former Aberdeen, Rangers and Scotland midfielder
Ryan
Jack
. However, that hinges on the player securing a release from Turkish club Esenler Erokspor.
A lot could happen on deadline day, with the
Falkirk
boss John McGlynn targeting two more in at the newly promoted side, and
Livingston
also set to be busy.

live_updates.title: More signings for Rangers on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
A total of 11 new players have already joined
Rangers
this summer, and it looks like at least two more arrivals could be incoming.
Everton
striker
Youssef
Chermiti
is set to join on a permanent deal worth an initial £8m, plus potential add-ons. Chermiti is well known by Ibrox sporting director Kevin Thelwell, who helped sign him for the Premier League club in 2023 from Sporting Lisbon in a deal worth up to £15m.
Marseille
's
Derek
Cornelius
is the other. Italian club
Cremonese
were also in for the left-footed centre-back, who can also play as a left-back, providing extra cover in that area for Russell Martin.
We reported earlier in the transfer window that
Crystal Palace
winger
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
was a Rangers target too. Well, they have gone back in with another loan bid, but they face competition from
Celtic
, plus the likes of
Leicester
and
Lyon
.
In terms of outgoings, Russell Martin confirmed to Sky Sports that
Cyriel Dessers
has played his last game for the club.
Greece is his likely destination -
AEK Athens
had a bid rejected earlier this summer, and now face competition from rivals
Panathinaikos
who are in the race to sign the player in a deal worth around £3.7m.
The future of
Nicolas Raskin
is a bit less clear. He was dropped from the squad completely for Sunday’s Old Firm clash and Martin refused to speak about the player afterwards.
He didn't train with the first team towards the end of last week, and it could mean he moves on deadline day.
There will be some others who leave, with defenders
Clinton Nsiala
and
Leon King
among those who have been told to find new clubs.

live_updates.title: What awaits Celtic on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Celtic
are progressing with talks over a deal for
Anderlecht's
Kasper
Dolberg
. The striker featured for the Belgian club as a second-half substitute on Sunday.
Brendan Rodgers will be keen to get that over the line, after insisting
Adam Idah
can't join
Swansea
unless he is replaced.
Idah missed Sunday's Old Firm, as he completed his medical in Wales ahead of a £7m move, having already agreed personal terms.
Celtic are also trying to sign two wingers.
Sebastian
Tounekti
of
Hammarby
is one of them. Celtic’s latest bid of £4.7m was rejected, with the player featuring on Sunday for the Swedish club.
They are also in the race for
Crystal
Palace
winger
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
. There is competition from
Rangers
, plus the likes of
Leicester
and
Lyon
, as various clubs chase a loan deal before the transfer window shuts.
In terms of other outgoings,
Hyunjun Yang
is wanted by
Birmingham City
in a deal worth at least £3m.
Elsewhere, the likes of
Hayato
Inamura
and
Stephen
Welsh
are among those who could depart on loan.

live_updates.title: Morris departs Dons
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Aberdeen
have confirmed winger
Shayden Morris
has left to join
Luton Town
.
Morris started 29 times across his three years at the Dons, making 87 appearances in total and scoring five goals.

live_updates.title: Chermiti arrives ahead of Rangers move
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports' Luke Shanley &
Sahil Jaidka
:
Everton
striker
Youssef Chermiti
has arrived at the
Rangers
training ground ahead of his move to the Scottish Premiership club.
He is set to move to Ibrox in a deal worth an initial £8m, plus add ons.
It will be the biggest fee paid by Rangers for a player since signing Tore Andre Flo in 2000.
Chermiti is well known by Ibrox sporting director Kevin Thelwell, who helped sign him for the Premier League club in 2023 from Sporting Lisbon in a deal worth up to £15m.
The 21-year-old has been impacted by various injuries and made just 24 appearances for Everton, but is yet to score and is on the search for regular game time.

live_updates.title: Cortes set for Rangers exit
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports'
Sahil Jaidka
:
Rangers
winger
Oscar Cortes
is closing in on a move to Spanish second division side
Sporting Gijon
.
The 21-year-old had his second loan spell at Ibrox last season, with an obligation to buy triggered in the summer.
However, he is now set to depart on loan until the end of this season after a lack of action.
Cortes has made 21 appearances for Rangers, scoring one goal and providing two assists.

live_updates.title: Celtic make third Tounekti bid
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'
Anthony Joseph
:
Celtic
have made a third bid for
Hammarby IF
winger
Sebastian Tounekti
.
It’s understood the latest offer is worth up to £5.2m.
Hammarby had always been looking for a deal in the region of £5m before they considered selling the Tunisia international.

live_updates.title: Yang heads for Birmingham
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'
Anthony Joseph
:
Celtic
winger
Hyunjun Yang
is travelling to England ahead of a possible £3m move to
Birmingham City
.
The clubs are close to agreeing an initial fee of £3m, plus add-ons, with Birmingham still waiting for the Hoops to sanction the move.
However, with less than seven hours to go in the English window, the South Korea international is on his way to Birmingham to be ready for when the deal gets the go-ahead.

live_updates.title: Ajax want Celtic target Dolberg
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'
Anthony Joseph
:
Ajax
have made a last-ditch attempt to hijack
Kasper Dolberg
’s move from
Anderlecht
to
Celtic
.
The Dutch club made an enquiry this morning. However, it’s understood they may only be able to do a loan, after exploring the conditions of a permanent deal with Anderlecht.
Celtic have been progressing in talks with the Belgian side over a deal for the Denmark international, with Anderlecht preferring to do a permanent transfer for a significant fee.
Sky Sports News has been told Dolberg is open to joining the Scottish champions, but an emotional return to Ajax would be seen as an attractive option.
If the deal was to fall through, it would leave Celtic scrambling last-minute as they search for two strikers before tonight’s 11pm deadline.
Adam Idah
has already completed a medical and finalised the paperwork ahead of his £7m move to
Swansea City
, with the player and club waiting for
Celtic
to sign the documents at their end.
Ajax
are looking for a forward after agreeing a deal in principle with
Sunderland
over a £26m move for
Brian Bobbey
.
The Dutch deadline is 11.59pm tomorrow.

live_updates.title: Ajax want Celtic target Dolberg
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'
Anthony Joseph
:
Ajax
have made a last-ditch attempt to hijack
Kasper Dolberg
’s move from
Anderlecht
to
Celtic
.
The Dutch club made an enquiry this morning. However, it’s understood they may only be able to do a loan, after exploring the conditions of a permanent deal with Anderlecht.
Celtic have been progressing in talks with the Belgian side over a deal for the Denmark international, with Anderlecht preferring to do a permanent transfer for a significant fee.
Sky Sports News has been told Dolberg is open to joining the Scottish champions, but an emotional return to Ajax would be seen as an attractive option.
If the deal was to fall through, it would leave Celtic scrambling last-minute as they search for two strikers before tonight’s 11pm deadline.
Adam Idah
has already completed a medical and finalised the paperwork ahead of his £7m move to
Swansea City
, with the player and club waiting for
Celtic
to sign the documents at their end.
Ajax
are looking for a forward after agreeing a deal in principle with
Sunderland
over a £26m move for
Brian Bobbey
.
The Dutch deadline is 11.59pm tomorrow.

live_updates.title: Cortes departs Rangers
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Rangers
winger
Oscar Cortes
has joined Spanish second division side
Sporting Gijon
.
The 21-year-old had his second loan spell at Ibrox last season, with an obligation to buy triggered in the summer.
However, he has now left on loan until the end of this season after a lack of action.
Cortes has made 21 appearances for Rangers, scoring one goal and providing two assists.

live_updates.title: Hurzeler '100 per cent sure' Baleba stays at Brighton
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Fabian Hurzeler
has said he is 100 per cent confident
Carlos Baleba
will remain a
Brighton
player beyond the transfer window shutting on September 1.
The midfielder has been the subject of interest from Man Utd this summer, but the Seagulls have remained firm in their stance that Baleba is not for sale.
"If there was a number higher than 100 I would give you that," Hurzeler said in his pre-Man City press conference on Thursday.
He also added that his gut instinct is there won't be any more incomings at Brighton, and reiterated his happiness with the shape of the squad.

live_updates.title: Enciso back at Brighton after injury derails move
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Fabian Hurzeler
says
Julio Enciso
has returned to
Brighton
to continue his rehabilitation amid reports his move to Strasbourg could be off.
Enciso was expected to join the French club for around £20m, with a deal close to being finalised this time last week.
However, the attacking midfielder, who does not feature in Hurzeler's plans, is now back at Brighton with less than five days of the window to go.
Asked to clear up Enciso's situation, Hurzeler said: "It is not a big injury, so he is back in rehab training.
"It is very important that the players now are our plans for the future.
"We have an open conversation with Julio and then we will see what happens in the next days."

live_updates.title: Brighton open to offers for Sarmiento
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Cremonese
are also in talks over the signing of
Brighton
winger
Jeremy Sarmiento
, according to
Sky in Italy
.
Brighton are open to letting him go before the window closes.
Sarmiento has spent the last three seasons on loan at different clubs in the Championship.
The 23-year-old played for Burnley in the previous campaign as they gained automatic promotion to the Premier League.
He has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Leeds advancing in Buonanotte pursuit
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Leeds United
have advanced in their pursuit of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte.
Brighton have been keen for the 20-year-old to go on loan to an English club to gain more experience after his spell at Leicester last season.
Bounanotte fits the profile of player Leeds have been looking for as they try to bolster their creative options in the final third.
The Argentina international, who has been attracting interest from Champions League clubs, can play as a No 10 and on the right wing.
Buonanotte's departure from Brighton would be a straight loan with no obligation involved in the deal.
Sky Germany
reported earlier in the window that Dortmund had made a loan offer for the player.

live_updates.title: Abdallah Sima joins Lens
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Brighton
striker
Abdallah Sima
has joined Ligue 1 club
Lens
in a deal worth £4m plus add-ons.
The forward, who never made a Premier League appearance for the Premier League side after joining in 2021, has had loan spells at Stoke, Angers, Rangers and Stade Brestois.
Brighton are working on trimming their squad ahead of Monday's deadline.
Facundo Buonanotte
could depart to Chelsea with talks ongoing between the west London club and Brighton.
Jeremy Sarmiento
may also leave while Tariq Lamptey is attracting interest.

live_updates.title: Brighton's Enciso edging closer to Strasbourg move
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Chelsea's
owners BlueCo are edging closer to completing a deal with
Brighton
for
Julio Enciso
to join
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old is being offered a five-year contract.
It is expected the transfer will be completed before the window closes on Monday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Thursday that Enciso had returned to Brighton to continue his rehab on a knee injury.
The Paraguay international will initially move to BlueCo-owned Strasbourg.
Enciso is not part of Fabian Hurzeler's plans this season and spent the second half of last season on loan at Ipswich.

live_updates.title: Chelsea close to completing loan signing of Brighton's Buonanotte
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook and Mark McAdam:
Chelsea
are close to completing the loan signing of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte
.
The deal under discussion does not include an option or an obligation to buy - it is a season-long loan.
There was interest in the 20-year-old from other Premier League clubs, including
Leeds United
.
Brighton only wanted to loan the Argentina international to a club in England.
Borussia Dortmund
had made a loan offer for the player with an option, while there was also interest from French outfit
Lyon
.

live_updates.title: Cremonese reach agreement for Sarmiento
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Cremonese
have reached an agreement with
Brighton
for the signing of winger
Jeremy Sarmiento
, according to
Sky in Italy.
The deal is for a loan with an option to buy, which could become an obligation if the Italian club avoid relegation from Serie A.
Sarmiento has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Fiorentina agree Lamptey deal
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'  Mark McAdam and Elliot Cook:
Fiorentina
have agreed a deal with
Brighton
for the signing of
Tariq Lamptey.
The transfer is worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Lamptey still needs to take a medical and finalise terms with the Italian club before the move goes through.

live_updates.title: Hurzeler: Football is not always about tactics
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Brighton
boss
Fabian Hurzeler
claimed "football is not always about tactics" after his side came back to beat Manchester City.
Hurzeler made a quadruple substitution in the 61st minute which saw James Milner cancel out Erling Haaland's opener before Brajan Gruda netted a late winner.
"Football is not always about tactics, it is sometimes about energy and the energy you put on the pitch. We showed it today. In the second half, we had this energy," he said.
"This can win you games. We didn't believe in ourselves [before the substitutes]. I decided to make the four changes. It is always a decision we make together."

live_updates.title: Brighton super subs inflict another defeat on Man City
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text: Manchester City suffered their second defeat from their opening three Premier League games after collapsing to a late 2-1 loss at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set for Marseille medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brighton
’s
Matt O’Riley
is understood to be travelling to France this morning for a medical with
Marseille
.
The midfielder is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to make the deal permanent.
O'Riley was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: Palace close to signing Brighton's Igor
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Crystal Palace
are close to an agreement with
Brighton
over a loan deal for defender
Igor Julio
.
Sky Sports News
has been told the deal includes an option for Palace to buy him at the end of the season.
Plans are in place for Igor to travel to South London for a medical later today.
West Ham
held an interest in the player, but Palace now looks his more likely destination.

live_updates.title: Lamptey joins Fiorentina on permanent deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam and Elliot Cook:
Brighton
have announced right-back
Tariq Lamptey
has joined
Fiorentina
on a permanent deal.
The 24-year-old is moving to Serie A in a deal worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Sky Sports News
reported on Saturday that an agreement had been reached between the two clubs.
Lamptey signed a one-year contract extension at Brighton in June but selling the player now means the Premier League club will receive a fee, instead of losing him for nothing.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set for Marseille medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Matt O'Riley
has arrived in
Marseille
ahead of his loan move from
Brighton
.
The Denmark international has been pictured with fans outside Marseille's training ground.
The midfielder is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to make the deal permanent.
O'Riley was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: More Brighton exits expected
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporter Chris Nightingale:
Brighton
have let a lot of players go this summer and that number is only going to increase throughout Deadline Day with updates on
Julio Enciso, Facundo Buonanotte, Jeremy Sarmiento
and
Matt O’Riley
still to come.
Manager Fabian Hurzeler has spoken about the need to trim his squad throughout this window, but it’s easy to see some areas could become light with injury.

live_updates.title: Wolves bid for £20m-rated Genk striker Arokodare
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Dharmesh Sheth & Adam Bate:
Wolves
have made an official offer for
KRC Genk
striker
Tolu Arokodare
.
Genk value the player, was top scorer in Belgian League last season with 17 goals, at around £20m.

live_updates.title: Wolves' Fabio Silva completing Dortmund medical
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Wolves' Fabio Silva
is now undergoing the second part of his medical with
Borussia Dortmund
.
He must be registered by 3pm today if he is to be included in the squad on Sunday against Union Berlin.
The player flew into Germany yesterday after the clubs agreed a £22.8m deal.

live_updates.title: Wolves also interested in Hackney
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas, Anthony Joseph and Sahil Jaidka:
Wolves
are also among the clubs who hold an interest in
Middlesbrough
midfielder
Hayden Hackney.
It is understood no approach has been made and the club realise it could be a difficult deal to do at this stage.
Middlesbrough have made it clear Hackney is not for sale in the final few days of the window.
West Ham, Fulham
and
Everton
have all shown interest in Hackney this summer – but there have been no formal offers yet from them either.
Boro feel it is too late in the window to sign an adequate replacement, and they have made a strong start to the campaign.
Sky Sports News
understands Hackney has made it clear to the club that if a Premier League club comes in, it is his dream to play in the top flight.
Boro were believed to be open to selling Hackney earlier in the window, but no Premier League offers materialised.
Hackney turned down a potential move to Championship rivals Ipswich earlier in the window.
Rangers’ Nico Raskin
has also been on Wolves’ radar but the club currently don’t have space available for a non-homegrown player.

live_updates.title: Pereira refuses to rule out Strand Larsen move
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Wolves
head coach
Vitor Pereira
has refused to confirm
Jorgen Strand Larsen
will remain at the club beyond the transfer deadline – but hopes he can feature in Saturday’s game with
Everton
.
The 25-year-old has been subject of multiple bids from Newcastle in recent weeks, but the Magpies now appear to have turned their attentions to Stuttgart forward Nick Woltemade, who is close to signing at St James’ Park.
Pereira said of his forward: “It’s important that we know that every person has ambitions in life.
But in this moment, Jorgen is our player. He's working hard because he has a good personality. He's a team player.
“In this moment, he's dealing with small injury problems. I hope we can play tomorrow with him because maybe it's a small problem. But at the end of the day, he's our player, an important player for us.
“Everything that we cannot control is out of our control. We cannot lose energy with that. I understand football, I understand everything.
“But in this moment, it's a moment to think about the team, how to win the game because it's a very important game for us.
On whether Strand Larsen could down tools, after both Alexander Isak and Yoane Wissa were exiled from training at their respective clubs, Pereira said: “This is not the Jorgan I know. The Jorgen I know has a good personality and is a very good player.
“I know that, of course, this is a situation that everybody is talking about the same subject. I believe that the player can think about it.
“But at the end of the day, he cannot control the situation. At the end of the day, he must focus on the team, trying to focus on the team, to do his best to help the club.”
When asked whether he was 100-per-cent certain Strand Larsen would stay, he added: “He's our player.”

live_updates.title: Wolves agree deal for Genk striker
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Wolves
have agreed a £23.4m (€27m) deal with
Genk
for striker
Tolu Arokodare
.
They will pay an initial £22.5m (€26m) plus £900k (€1m) in add-ons.
Sky Sports News
has been told this deal does not have any implications on
Jorgen Strand Larsen's
future at the club amid interest from
Newcastle
.
Wolves maintain that he is not for sale.

live_updates.title: Pereira wants two more signings
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Wolves supporters were left frustrated as their team succumbed to a third consecutive Premier League defeat as they were
beaten 3-2 by Everton
. During the second half, they made their feelings clear. “Back the team or sell the club,” they sang to the owners.
Asked in the press conference about those chants and whether he feels backed, Vitor Pereira said: “They are trying to help the team. I hope until the end of the market they try to add at least two players to help us because we need more solutions. Especially in attack.”
Pereira added that he also wants “solution in midfield because we need competition” and stressed that he empathised with the supporters. “I am suffering with them because, more than the result, I don’t see my team playing the way we are working.”
The Wolves boss did suggest that striker Jorgen Strand Larsen would still be at the club at the conclusion of the transfer window, reiterating that the reason for his omission for his game was the result of an inflamed Achilles tendon suffered against Bournemouth.

live_updates.title: Wolves aim to bring in Brownhill
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and James Savundra:
Wolves
are in talks to sign free agent
Josh Brownhill
after he left
Burnley
.
The midfielder is currently considering a huge offer from
Al Shabab
, who are willing to pay the 29-year-old more than £100,000 per week.
However, Wolves have held discussions with Brownhill’s representatives in regards to a potential deal.
Wolves have held a long-term interest in the former Burnley player who scored 18 goals in the Clarets' successful promotion campaign last season.
Brownhill rejected a fresh contract offer from Burnley this summer.
If Wolves were to beat the Saudi Pro League club to the signature of Brownhill, then the midfielder would link up with Vitor Pereira, who managed Al Shabab until last December.

live_updates.title: Striker Arokodare flying in for Wolves medical
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Striker
Tolu Arokodare
is flying in for a medical with
Wolves
today ahead of his £23.4m (€27m) deal from
Genk
.
Personal terms have also been agreed with the 24-year-old.
Wolves will pay an initial £22.5m (€26m) plus £900k (€1m) in add-ons for the Nigeria international.
Sky Sports News
has been told this deal does not have any implications on
Newcastle
target
Jorgen Strand Larsen's
future at the club.
Wolves maintain that he is not for sale.

live_updates.title: What can we expect from Wolves today?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kirsty Edwards at Wolves' training ground:
"The transfer headlines surrounding Wolves in this window have all centred around a striker.
"The club have stood firm against those Newcastle bids for Jorgen Strand Larson and continue to be adamant he's going nowhere.
"A striker will be the big news here at Molineux today but it's an incoming. Tolo Arokodare had his medical yesterday ahead of a move from Genk for a deal expected to be worth 23.4 million pounds.
"His arrival could signal the departure of Sasa Kalajdzic. He's expected to go out on loan.
"A central midfielder the other target for Vitor Pereira. It may be too late for a deal today but free agents are an option with former Burnley midfielder Josh Brownhill of interest. "

live_updates.title: Saturday's STUNNING free-kicks!
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Here's one from Watford's
Nestory Irankunda
...
Here's one from Oxford's
Cameron Brannagan...
And here's one from Coventry's
Victor Torp
!

live_updates.title: West Brom set for Gilchrist signing

live_updates.text:

West Brom
are set to sign
Chelsea’s Alfie Gilchrist
in an initial £1.2m deal.
Gilchrist is having a medical with Albion today. There are some bonuses agreed in the deal also.
The 21-year-old spent last season on loan at Sheffield United, making 32 appearances.

live_updates.title: Lions complete Taylor signing from West Brom
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Millwall
have completed the signing of centre-back
Caleb Taylor
from
West Brom
.
The Lions are signing Taylor after defender Japhet Tanganga was sold to Sheffield United.

live_updates.title: Andrews close to Watford exit
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni:
Young Boys
are close to agreeing a deal for
Watford
right-back
Ryan Andrews
.
It’s understood a fee of £2.6m, plus add-ons, are being discussed.
Andrews is looking to move for more regular first-team football.

live_updates.title: Essential EFL podcast: Championship predictions
live_updates.author: Simeon Gholam
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports duo Simeon Gholam and David Prutton take a look ahead at Gameweek FOUR of the Sky Bet Championship season.
👉
Give the Sky Sports Essential EFL podcast a follow

live_updates.title: Ipswich sign attacker Egeli in Championship record deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Ipswich
have signed teenage forward
Sindre Walle Egeli
from Danish club
FC Nordsjaelland
for a Championship record fee.
The deal is worth £17.5m, eclipsing the £15.4m
Burnley
paid Genk for
Mike Tresor
last summer.
The 19-year-old has signed a five-year contract at Portman Road.
He scored 11 goals in 40 appearances for FC Nordsjaelland and has already made his international debut for Norway.
“I’m really excited to have signed for this club,” he said.
“This is a club with great history and great plans for the future and this is something I really want to be a part of.
“As soon as I knew Ipswich were interested, I was excited to come and I believe this club is the perfect place for me to progress in my career.
“I have had some great conversations with the manager and now I can’t wait to get started, meet my team-mates and also the supporters.”

live_updates.title: Wrexham in talks for Vyner
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Anthony Joseph:
Wrexham
are in talks to sign
Bristol City’s Zak Vyner.
They have had a £1.75m bid rejected so far.

live_updates.title: Young Boys agree deal for Watford's Andrews
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Luca Bendoni:
Young Boys
have agreed a £2.6m deal for
Watford
right-back
Ryan Andrews
.
It’s understood that Watford have inserted a 50 per cent sell-on clause into the deal.
Andrews is due to fly to Switzerland to undergo a medical and finalise the move.

live_updates.title: Watford close in on Mendy
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Luca Bendoni:
Watford
are closing in on the signing of
Lorient
centre-back
Formose Mendy
.
It’s understood that the clubs have agreed a loan deal with an option to buy.
Mendy watched Watford’s 2-2 draw with Southampton at Vicarage Road on Saturday.
He is due to undergo a medical and finalise the paperwork on his move on Sunday.

live_updates.title: Vardy agrees to join Cremonese after rejecting late Feyenoord interest
live_updates.author: Richard Damerell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Jamie Vardy
has agreed verbally to join Italian side
Cremonese
, turning down the chance to go to
Feyenoord
.
The Dutch club came in with a late offer, which left him with a difficult decision to make, after their boss
Robin Van Persie
phoned Vardy directly last night to try to persuade him to move to the Netherlands.
The ultimate decision came down to whether Vardy wanted to play in the Champions League and Eredivisie, or Serie A, and in the end, Vardy decided he still wanted to challenge himself in one of the top five European leagues and try to keep the newly-promoted Italian side in the top division.
The 38-year-old has agreed a one-year contract with the option of a further year if Cremonese stay up.
The ex-Leicester striker will travel to Milan for a medical tomorrow and agree on the final details of his contract.

live_updates.title: Selles: Sheffield United future out of my hands
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Ruben Selles
admits his future as
Sheffield United
boss is out of his hands as Blades fans called for the Spaniard to be sacked after just four league games in charge.
Selles’ nightmare start to life in charge of United continued as they went down 1-0 at Middlesbrough on Saturday, leaving the Blades rock bottom and without a point going into the first international break.
Selles said: "I cannot control the situation. I will expect to go to my house tonight and then tomorrow go to work and then continue as normal. It’s not in my hands to make a decision.
"And until the very last moment, I will just do my best and try to do my things. When the situation is not in my control, I don’t think too much about what is going to happen in the future. Because realistically, I do as much as I can.
"At least if I go out, whether that’s tomorrow or if it’s in three years, I will always go out with the feeling that I made the decisions that I want to make. Obviously that includes my mistakes, but my decisions were honest and what I thought was the correct thing to do in every single moment.”
Selles, who previously managed Reading during the Royals’ off-the-field struggles and transfer embargoes, added: “I have been in worse situations and I end up just making the things happen and changing totally around the dynamics.
"So I don’t have a doubt about it. I’ve been in situations where I haven’t been paid on time, situations when they get points deductions, situations where we didn’t know if we would be able to train the next day at the training ground.
"And the reality is that we turned things around at the moment of connection. But you need to work hard to go to that moment and you need to go through a couple of critical moments on that journey."

live_updates.title: Leicester want to sign Palace winger Rak-Sakyi on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
want to sign
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
on loan from
Crystal Palace
before the deadline.
Palace are reluctant to let the winger go without a replacement.
The 22-year-old has two years left on his contract at Palace.

live_updates.title: Derby agree deal to sign Brereton Diaz from Saints
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Derby County
have agreed a deal with
Southampton
to take striker
Ben Brereton Diaz
on a season-long loan.
He has passed his medical and should be confirmed as a Derby player in the next 24 hours.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed in talks to sign Man Utd teenager Amass on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vik Varange and Dharmesh Sheth:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with M
anchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a straight season-long loan as Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Bristol City reject Wrexham's £2m bid for Vyner
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Anthony Joseph:
Bristol City
have rejected a second bid of £2m from
Wrexham

Zak Vyner
.
It is understood
Bristol City
deem him as an integral part of their team and someone they cannot lose, despite entering the last 12 months of his contract.
Talks are ongoing between the clubs.

Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Birmingham City
are waiting on
Celtic
to green-light a move for winger
Hyunjun Yang

It’s understood negotiations over the weekend have brought the initial fee to around £3m, with add-ons still to be ironed out.
If the move gets sanctioned, Yang could travel to Birmingham on Sunday night to undergo a medical.
The South Korea international was an unused substitute in Celtic's 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox today.

live_updates.title: Wrexham agree deal to sign Coventry's Sheaf
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett, Anthony Joseph and Zinny Boswell:
Wrexham
have agreed a £6.5m deal to sign
Coventry City
defensive midfielder
Ben Sheaf
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old is due to undergo a medical on Monday.
Sheaf has one year left on his Coventry contract.

live_updates.title: Saints sign Jelert on loan
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Southampton
have completed a deal to sign
Elias Jelert
in a season-long loan from
Galatasaray

The 22-year-old defender, who has three caps for Denmark, featured 35 times in all competitions as he celebrated a league and cup double in Istanbul last season.

live_updates.title: Young Boys sign Andrews
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Young Boys
have completed a deal to sign
Ryan Andrews
from
Watford
in a deal worth £2.6m.
The England U20 international has signed a four-year deal at the Bern club. The deal includes a 50 per cent sell-on clause.

live_updates.title: Stuttgart agree deal to sign El Khannouss
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
have agreed a deal with
Stuttgart
for the transfer of
Bilal El Khannouss
.
The player will travel to Germany on Deadline Day for a medical.
The agreement is for a loan, with an obligation to buy for £26m (€30m).
That is broken down into a loan fee of £4.3m (€5m) and a future transfer fee of £21.6m (€25m).
Crystal Palace
were in regular dialogue with Leicester about the forward, but have since moved on to other targets.
Leicester did not want to sell El Khannouss, but he made clear his desire to leave. He did not feature at all in either of Leicester’s last two games.

live_updates.title: Leicester's El Khannous set for Stuttgart medical amid Carranza interest
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Bilal El Khannouss
is travelling to Germany this morning to undergo a medical with
Stuttgart
ahead of his loan and obligation to buy for £26m.
But Leicester are also in talks with Feyenoord over a possible deal for striker
Julian Carranza
.
Carranza is one of their top targets. The deal being discussed is a loan with an option to buy.
Leicester also retain an interest in
Millwall
striker
Mihailo Ivanovic
, but they are reluctant to meet the Championship club's valuation, which is thought to be £10m up front with £2m of add-ons.

live_updates.title: Cardiff hopeful on Chelsea's Kellyman on loan

live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Cardiff City
are hopeful of signing
Omari Kellyman
on a season-long loan from
Chelsea
.
The clubs are in talks over a Deadline Day deal for the 19-year-old.

live_updates.title: Millwall closing in on Ballo
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:

Millwall
are closing in on the signing of
Wolfsberger AC
winger
Thierno Ballo.
It’s understood the clubs have agreed a loan deal, with an option to buy.
Ballo is due to undergo a medical today.

Cardiff

from

Samuel-Smith joined Strasbourg last month from Chelsea.

live_updates.title: Ipswich agree to send Al-Hamadi on loan to Luton

The total package is worth £4m.

The deal is thought to concern a loan with an option to buy.

live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Middlesbrough
's
Hayden Hackney
has been in demand all summer - but will he make a move away from Teesside today?
Click below to watch all of his goals for Boro so far (plus one from this season against Millwall!)

live_updates.title: Winger set to join Southampton
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Heidenheim
winger
Leo Scienza

Saints have agreed a deal with Heidenheim worth up to £8.6m (€10m).

live_updates.title: Middlesbrough announce Strelec capture

Middlesbrough
have announced the signing of striker
David Strelec
from
Slovan Bratislava

The fee is undisclosed, but
Sky Sports News
understands it’s beaten the previous record for an outgoing transfer from Slovakia which stood at €7m (£6m)
Strelec had interest from other British clubs but we understand he had talks with Middlesbrough in January when Boro were coached by Michael Carrick and that interest was now followed up this summer.

live_updates.title: Sheaf undergoing Wrexham medical

Coventry

Ben Sheaf

Wrexham
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old has agreed terms on a three-year contract, with the club to hold option to extend by a further year.

live_updates.title: Wrexham complete Sheaf deal
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Wrexham
have completed a £6.5m deal for
Coventry
captain Ben Sheaf.
He has agreed a three-year contract with the option of a further year.

live_updates.title: Roberts to join Birmingham
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Patrick Roberts
is set to join Birmingham on loan from
Sunderland
.

live_updates.title: Roberts to join Birmingham
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Patrick Roberts
is set to join Birmingham on loan from
Sunderland
.
The 28-year-old has made just shy of 150 appearances for the Black Cats since arriving from
Man City
in 2022.

live_updates.title: PFA pre-season enters final week
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text: There is no deadline for clubs to sign free agents, but could any of these free agents be on the move today?

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed agree loan for Man Utd teenager
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta:
Sheffield Wednesday
have agreed a loan deal with
Manchester United
for left-back
Harry Amass
.
The teenager's move to the Championship is pending EFL approval.
Season-long loan with no option or obligation to buy.
Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Oxford sign Bulgaria international
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Oxford
have completed the signing of
Filip Krastev
on a season-long loan from
Lommel
.
The midfielder, 23, has 24 caps for Bulgaria and spent time on loan in the MLS at
LA FC
in 2023.
Oxford boss
Gary Rowett
said: “Filip is a player with wonderful ability who can add a lot of energy to the team.
“He will provide a creative spark, with a clear eye for goal and an ability to deliver moments of quality.
“We believe Filip will add something new and exciting to the group and we look forward to working with him over the international break to get him ready as soon as possible.”

live_updates.title: Frank on midfield options
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Spurs head coach Thomas Frank on the midfield options he has at the club:
"I think we’ve got a very good midfield. I like the six midfielders we have – Archie Gray, Lucas Bergvall, Joao Palhinha, Pape Mata Sarr, Rodrigo Bentancur and Yves Bissouma.
"There’s the creativity of Kulu and JM, but of course they are out so that’s a skillset we need to replace either by signing someone or with Wilson Odobert, Mohammed Kudus or Mathys Tel."

live_updates.title: Frank on Champions League deadline
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text:
Spurs head coach Thomas Frank on the looming Champions League player registration deadline:
"We still have a minor challenge there, and of course a decision will be made in due course."

live_updates.title: Tottenham complete Simons signing
live_updates.author: Ron Walker
live_updates.text: Tottenham have completed the signing of Chelsea target Xavi Simons from RB Leipzig in a deal worth just over £51m.

live_updates.title: Simons: I have been dreaming of this moment
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Xavi Simons
has said he has been "dreaming" of joining
Tottenham
for a long time after the club announced his signing on Friday evening.
Spurs completed the signing of Simons from RB Leipzig in a deal worth just over £51m on Friday.
Sky Sports News
understands he has signed a five-year contract that includes an option for a further two years.
Simons is Spurs' seventh signing of the summer and takes their spend to beyond £170m.
"I'm really happy and can't wait to get going. I've been dreaming of this for a long time.
"It's a great club and when I met the head coach I knew straight away that this was the right place for me.
"I will bring flair to the team but also hard work and discipline. I want to do everything I can to win, for the team and also for the fans."

live_updates.title: Frank appears to rule out defender signing
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
boss
Thomas Frank
has appeared to rule out signing a centre-back before the deadline.
Spurs have been among the clubs to show some interest in
Manchester City
defender
Manuel Akanji
.
However, AC Milan are now pushing to agree a deal with City for the centre-back.
Asked if Spurs needed another defender, Frank said: "No, as it stands, no.
“We have right now three centre backs: Micky (van Der Ven), (Cristian) Romero, (Kevin) Danso and Ben (Davies) can play there if necessary.
“We have Kota the young central defender we bought this summer and is running now and training with the team next week. There’s not many left behind.
"And then (Radu) Dragusin is coming back in a couple of months so that should be enough.”
Following the £51m arrival of Xavi Simons
,
Sky Sports News
understands signing a left-winger is still a target for Spurs in the final days of the window.
