Sky Sports' Gary Neville:
"If your goalkeeper is making mistakes, it undermines everything that you do. And at Old Trafford, it’s the most unforgiving ground for goalkeepers.
"The Manchester United goalkeeper spot is the toughest position in English football, bar none. If you give goals away at United as a keeper, you’ll be scrutinised heavily.
"It’s not about never making mistakes - it’s about how you recover from them, your body language, and whether you look authoritative. The two they’ve got right now don’t fill that role.
"They have to get a goalkeeper in. I’ve thought it for months, and every United fan thinks the same.”

live_updates.title: Villa agree deal to sign Man Utd's Sancho
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
have agreed a deal with
Manchester United
for
Jadon Sancho
.
The deal is a straight loan.
Sky Sports News
understands Villa will pay a loan fee and pay 80% of the wages. Bonuses inserted in the deal could cover full wage coverage.
Sancho’s entered the final year of his contract. United have the option to extend for a further 12 months.

live_updates.title: Ten Hag sacked by Bayer Leverkusen
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Bayer Leverkusen
have decided to part ways with
Erik ten Hag
after just two Bundesliga matches.
The ex-Manchester United boss was appointed to replace Xabi Alonso in April.
Training at Bayer Leverkusen was postponed this morning.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m.
The goalkeeper is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
Lammens has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m.
The goalkeeper is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
Lammens has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: Why Man Utd are signing Lammens over Martinez...
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m plus add-ons.
The club looked at other options, including
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, but after much deliberation and negotiation, they feel Lammens is the right choice for the club moving forward.
As it stands, United are expected to move forward with four goalkeepers, adding Lammens to their current group of
Altay Bayindir
,
Andre Onana
and
Tom Heaton
.
However, the windows in Turkey and Saudi Arabia are open until September 11 and 10, respectively.
It is understood that if a suitable offer were to come in for their other goalkeepers, it would be considered.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m.
The goalkeeper is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
Lammens has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: Why Man Utd are signing Lammens over Martinez...
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m plus add-ons.
The club looked at other options, including
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, but after much deliberation and negotiation, they feel Lammens is the right choice for the club moving forward.
As it stands, United are expected to move forward with four goalkeepers, adding Lammens to their current group of
Altay Bayindir
,
Andre Onana
and
Tom Heaton
.
However, the windows in Turkey and Saudi Arabia are open until September 11 and 10, respectively.
It is understood that if a suitable offer were to come in for their other goalkeepers, it would be considered.

live_updates.title: Former Utd defender on the move
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Former Manchester United defender
Victor Lindelof
could be on the move, with Aston Villa boss
Unai Emery
confirming interest in the free agent.
Emery: “Experience and he is a good player. We will see tomorrow how we close the deadline. We are expecting to add some players.”
Lindelof left United at the end of his contract in June after seven years at Old Trafford, making over 250 appearances for the club.

live_updates.title: Lammens arrives in UK and is on his way to Man Utd
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens
has landed in England and on his way to Carrington to undergo his medical.
United
have agreed a deal for the Royal Antwerp goalkeeperfor around £18.2m plus add-ons.
The club looked at other options, including
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, but after much deliberation and negotiation, they feel Lammens is the right choice for the club moving forward.
As it stands, United are expected to move forward with four goalkeepers, adding Lammens to their current group of
Altay Bayindir
,
Andre Onana
and
Tom Heaton
.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed in talks over Man Utd's Amass
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vik Varange:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a straight season-long loan as Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed agree loan deal for Amass
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta:
Sheffield Wednesday
have agreed a season-long loan deal with
Manchester United
for left-back
Harry Amass.
The teenager's move to the Championship is pending EFL approval and contains no option or obligation to buy. Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dan Khan:
Kobbie Mainoo i
s staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game-time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in the first-team.
United are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options of
Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount
and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dan Khan:
Kobbie Mainoo
is staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in the first team.
United are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options of
Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount
and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Paqueta starts for West Ham amid Villa interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
target
Lucas Paqueta
starts for
West Ham
at
Nottingham Forest
.
Sky Sports News
reported this morning that West Ham do not want to sell the Brazil international to Aston Villa, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
The Hammers, however, want to keep the midfielder in their squad after a difficult start to the campaign.

live_updates.title: Olympiakos in talks to sign Bournemouth striker Silcott-Duberry
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Mark McAdam:
Olympiakos
are in talks with
Bournemouth
over a possible deal for
Zain Silcott-Duberry
.
The deal under discussion is a permanent move for the striker who joined Bournemouth in January this year.
The 20-year-old made one Premier League appearance last season.
Other teams from Europe have shown an interest in the player as well.

live_updates.title: Akanji and Ederson on Man City bench amid transfer interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manuel Akanji
is on the bench for
Manchester City
against Brighton, live on
Sky Sports
.
The defender has been the subject of interest from
Galatasaray
and
AC Milan
.
Sky in Italy
are reporting that Milan received little encouragement that he wanted to join and appear to have moved on.
The Switzerland international was not in the squad for the defeat to Spurs last weekend.
Goalkeeper
James Trafford
retains his starting spot ahead of
Ederson
, who is on the bench and is a
Galatasaray
target.

live_updates.title: 'Chelsea not playing poker with Bayern over Jackson'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Talks are going on right now between
Chelsea
and
Bayern Munich
about
Nicolas Jackson
.
Chelsea’s position is clear: Jackson is a Chelsea player, so if you want him, then buy him.
This is not a bluff; Chelsea are not playing poker.
Even if Bayern were to agree to sign Jackson, Chelsea would still have to sign a replacement - but there are hardly any strikers available on loan anymore.
Chelsea believe the loan agreement has now been totally revoked.
If Bayern believe in Jackson, they have to buy him.

live_updates.title: Leverkusen defender Hincapie travelling to London for Arsenal medical
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayer Leverkusen
defender
Piero Hincapie
is travelling to London ahead of undergoing a medical with
Arsenal
.
The two clubs have agreed a season-long loan deal which includes an option to buy.
Including the loan fee, the total package is worth £45m if Arsenal sign the 23-year-old permanently.
The Ecuador international has agreed a five-year contract at Arsenal if the option is triggered.

live_updates.title: Fulham remain in talks for AC Milan winger Chukwueze
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
still want to sign a second winger after
Kevin
and remain in talks for AC Milan’s
Samuel Chukwueze
.
The 26-year-old is a long-term target, and Fulham made offers for the Nigeria international in January.
Fulham also admire
Dilane Bakwa
– a player
Nottingham Forest
are in talks for – but Chukwueze is thought to be the priority.
Fulham have also been interested in
Arsenal
winger
Reiss Nelson
, who also remains a target for
Crystal Palace
, and potentially
Chelsea
forward
Raheem Sterling
on loan.

live_updates.title: Paris FC join race to sign Forest's Jota Silva
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni:
Newly-promoted Ligue 1 side
Paris FC
have also joined the race for
Nottingham Forest
winger
Jota Silva
.
Sporting
also remain in talks, and the clubs are looking for a loan with an option to buy.
Forest, however, would prefer to sell Jota outright.

live_updates.title: Forest set for busy Deadline Day
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui from the City Ground:
It’ll be a busy day of departures at
Nottingham Forest
on Deadline Day tomorrow.
Jota Silva
and
Taiwo Anwoniyi
are not included in the matchday squad against West Ham, with Silva in talks with two clubs about a move away.
Omar Richards, Josh Bowler, Eric da Silva Moreira
and
Zach Abbott
are also expected to leave either temporarily or permanently.
As for
West Ham
,
Maxwel Cornet
is not in the squad at the City Ground and is the only senior player who could leave despite interest in playmaker
Lucas Paqueta
, who starts against Forest.

live_updates.title: Ex-Man Utd boss Ten Hag's Leverkusen future already under threat
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
There is a chance ex-
Manchester United
boss
Erik ten Hag
could lose his job already at
Bayer Leverkusen
.
Sky in Germany
are reporting that Leverkusen’s management are meeting to discuss whether Ten Hag will be able to build a team following their transfer business.
Sky in Germany
report that a decision is not expected before Deadline Day, but a quick parting of the ways is quite possible at the beginning of the new week.
The Dutchman has been accused internally of lacking a clear, game-planning approach and of bringing too little structure to his game.
Furthermore, the team is reporting that his pre-match communication and presentations are poor. For example, he didn't even give a proper motivational speech before the home defeat to Hoffenheim – much to the team's surprise.
If Ten Hag was to be sacked by Bayer Leverkusen, he would become the third ex-Man Utd boss to lose his job recently, following the dismissals of
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
– who lost his job at Besiktas three days ago – and
Jose Mourinho
, who left Fenerbahce on Friday.

live_updates.title: Man Utd attacker Williams joins Falkirk on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Scottish Premiership side
Falkirk
have completed the season-long loan signing of attacker
Ethan Williams
from
Manchester United.

live_updates.title: Leicester want to sign Palace winger Rak-Sakyi on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
want to sign
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
on loan from
Crystal Palace
before the deadline.
Palace are reluctant to let the winger go without a replacement.
The 22-year-old has two years left on his contract at Palace.

live_updates.title: Celtic striker Idah in Wales as he closes in on £7m move to Swansea
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
striker
Adam Idah
is in Wales under going the second part of his medical ahead of a £7m move to
Swansea City
.
The Republic of Ireland international travelled last night and was not in Celtic’s squad for their 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox.
Idah is expected to finalise his move, with Celtic making continued progress in talks for
Anderlecht
forward
Kasper Dolberg
.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic and Swansea have agreed an initial fee of £6m, plus more than £1m in add-ons.
Idah completed the first part of his medical with Swansea on Friday and agreed personal terms.
He was then called back by Celtic after the Hoops struggled to reach an agreement for Dolberg by close of play that day.
Celtic are looking to sign two strikers before tomorrow’s 11pm deadline in Scotland.

live_updates.title: Hojlund completes Napoli medical ahead of move from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Sky in Italy:
Rasmus Hojlund
has completed his medical ahead of his move from
Manchester United
to
Napoli
.
The deal is a loan plus a conditional obligation worth £43m (€50m).

live_updates.title: Talks still open between Betis and Man Utd over Antony deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Real Betis
and
Manchester United
over the signing of
Antony
.
A deal was agreed on Friday – only for Betis to pull out, stating they could not afford it on the current terms.
Willingness from all parties to complete the move and still a cautious optimism that a deal can be struck.
The impasse centres on how Antony’s compensation for the remaining two years of his contract is paid.
The move might also require Antony to compromise on his personal terms, something United feel he should be able to do given he has rebuffed a number of offers in favour of a return to Betis.

live_updates.title: Lammens and Martinez keen on joining Man Utd as club weigh up goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Rob Dorsett:
Internal discussions continue at
Manchester United
over their next steps regarding signing a goalkeeper.
It is understood
Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
and
Aston Villa’s
Emiliano Martinez
are both keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez has had offers but is thought he is waiting on United.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that United have explored the conditions of a deal for the World Cup winner.
Talks continue with Royal Antwerp over Lammens.
Galatasaray are also pushing, and United will not get drawn into a bidding war.
Both potential deals are thought to be complicated given the time left in the window, and there is still a chance United will not sign a keeper before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Mainz make improved £3m offer for Sturm Graz's Boving
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Mainz
have made an improved offer of £3m for
Sturm Graz
forward
William Boving
.
It is understood negotiations are progressing well, but they could face late competition from Girona and other Bundesliga clubs.
A number of English Championship clubs have been interested in Boving but are yet to make an offer.

live_updates.title: Martin confirms likely Dessers departure
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Rangers boss Russell Martin to Sky Sports on transfers after
drawing with Celtic in the Old Firm:
"We're close to a couple [of new players].
"I also think Cyriel [Dessers] has probably played his last game for the club and he's been great the whole time he's been here so he goes with everyone's best wishes.
"It's good business for us and for him, with the stage he's at in his career.
"Things can change, but it looks likely and we'll have two new guys in the building so let's see what happens outside of that."
On Nico Raskin:
"I don't know what's going to happen over the next 24 hours with the rest of our guys. I just want to focus on the team."

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed in talks to sign Man Utd teenager Amass on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vik Varange and Dharmesh Sheth:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with M
anchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a straight season-long loan as Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Lammens and Martinez keen on joining Man Utd as club weigh up goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Rob Dorsett:
Internal discussions continue at
Manchester United
over their next steps regarding signing a goalkeeper.
It is understood
Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
and
Aston Villa’s
Emiliano Martinez
are both keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez has had offers but it is thought he is waiting on United.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that United have explored the conditions of a deal for the World Cup winner.
Talks continue with Royal Antwerp over Lammens.
Galatasaray are also pushing, and United will not get drawn into a bidding war.
Both potential deals are thought to be complicated given the time left in the window, and there is still a chance United will not sign a keeper before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Derby agree deal to sign Brereton Diaz from Saints
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Derby County
have agreed a deal with
Southampton
to take striker
Ben Brereton Diaz
on a season-long loan.
He has passed his medical and should be confirmed as a Derby player in the next 24 hours.

live_updates.title: Aberdeen teen Boyd completes Aston Villa medical ahead of £1m move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Aberdeen
attacking midfielder
Fletcher Boyd
has completed a medical ahead of a £1m move to
Aston Villa
.
It is understood that the 17-year-old has agreed terms on a three-year contract with the Premier League club.
Sky Sports News
revealed earlier today that the clubs had agreed a £1m deal, plus add-ons – including a significant sell-on clause.

live_updates.title: Bristol City reject Wrexham's £2m bid for Vyner
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Anthony Joseph:
Bristol City
have rejected a second bid of £2m from
Wrexham
for centre-back
Zak Vyner
.
It is understood
Bristol City
deem him as an integral part of their team and someone they cannot lose, despite entering the last 12 months of his contract.
Talks are ongoing between the clubs.

live_updates.title: Rangers close to signing Everton striker Chermiti
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka:
Rangers
are closing in on a deal to sign
Everton
striker
Youssef Chermiti
.
On Thursday,
Sky Sports News
reported Rangers had made contact over a loan move, with Everton boss
David Moyes
confirming the next day that a loan exit was likely.
However, it is understood that the Ibrox club are now hopeful of a permanent deal ahead of Monday’s 11pm deadline for Scottish clubs.
It is thought that Rangers would pay an initial £8m for the player, plus potential add-ons.
Chermiti is well known by Ibrox sporting director Kevin Thelwell, who helped sign him for the Premier League club in 2023 from Sporting Lisbon in a deal worth up to £15m.
The 21-year-old has been impacted by various injuries and made just 24 appearances for Everton, but is yet to score and is on the search for regular game time.
Russell Martin said he is “hopeful of concluding” a deal for the striker.

live_updates.title: Dessers to leave Rangers before window closes
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Cyriel Dessers
is set to leave
Rangers
after two years at Ibrox.
Head coach
Russell Martin
said his substitute appearance against Celtic was likely to be his “last game for the club”.
The 30-year-old has scored 52 goals in 116 games during his two years at Ibrox.
AEK
Athens
had a bid rejected earlier this summer for Dessers, with Greek rivals
Panathinaikos
now leading the race to sign the player in a deal worth around £4.3m.

live_updates.title: Dessers to leave Rangers before window closes
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Cyriel Dessers
is set to leave
Rangers
after two years at Ibrox.
Head coach
Russell Martin
said his substitute appearance against Celtic was likely to be his “last game for the club”.
The 30-year-old has scored 52 goals in 116 games during his two years at Ibrox.
AEK Athens had a bid rejected earlier this summer for Dessers, and now face competition from Greek rivals Panathinaikos who are in the race to sign the player in a deal worth around £3.7m (€4.3m).

live_updates.title: Rodgers: Hopefully we can get some creativity in the squad in next 24 hours
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Celtic boss Brendan Rodgers to Sky Sports after drawing 0-0 against Rangers:
"I look back to 12 months ago and we were really fast and dynamic and I hope in the next 24 hours we can get the support to the squad that can give us the opportunity to give us that again.
"It's not disrespectful to the guys here because they need it. Any team needs that.
"We have a lot of work to do but we need the competition in the squad and creativity to take the game to the level we want to."
When asked if the club will be busy on Deadline Day, Rodgers said:
"It's clearly the plan to be. We want to pad out the squad with more quality, more speed and more creativity. Hopefully we can do that.
"There's a number of areas we need to freshen up."

live_updates.title: Celtic target Tounekti playing for Hammarby as talks continue over move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
target
Sebastian Tounekti
is playing for
Hammarby
today against
Osters IF
.
Sky Sports News
understands the Swedish club knocked back an improved offer worth £4.7m from the Scottish champions.
Celtic’s second offer included an initial fee of £3.9m, with £800,000 in add-ons.
Hammarby are looking for around £5m for the Tunisia international, or they won’t consider selling the player.
Talks are ongoing.

live_updates.title: West Ham's Paqueta silences transfer talk with goal celebration
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Lucas Paqueta
appeared to end speculation over his future at West Ham with his goal celebration against Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
After scoring a penalty to make it 2-0, Paqueta mimicked throwing away a phone before pointing to and kissing the West Ham badge on his shirt.
Before the match,
Sky Sports News
reported that
West Ham
do not want to sell
Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
Paqueta played the entire match against Forest.

live_updates.title: Birmingham wait on Celtic green light to move for Yang
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Birmingham City
are waiting on
Celtic
to green-light a move for winger
Hyunjun Yang
.
It’s understood negotiations over the weekend have brought the initial fee to around £3m, with add-ons still to be ironed out.
If the move gets sanctioned, Yang could travel to Birmingham on Sunday night to undergo a medical.
The South Korea international was an unused substitute in Celtic's 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox today.

live_updates.title: DOWNLOAD THE SKY SPORTS APP
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:

Sky Sports app
to make sure you don't miss a thing!
The
Sky Sports app
is your home for all the latest breaking news as well as:
FREE Premier League highlights
Plus free highlights from the EFL, F1, Golf and more
Expert opinions from the likes of Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher

Live scores, the ability to follow your favourite teams and sports and filter breaking news to your phone
And the best thing is, it's absolutely free and you don't need to be a Sky Sports subscriber to use it.
Click this link to download the Sky Sports app right now.

live_updates.title: Celtic target Dolberg on Anderlecht bench
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
target
Kasper Dolberg
not named in the
Anderlecht
starting line-up for their game against Union Saint-Gilloise on Sunday.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic are making continued progress in talks for the Denmark international.
Dolberg is Anderlecht’s main striker and has scored five goals in eight games already this season.

live_updates.title: Wrexham agree deal to sign Coventry's Sheaf
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett, Anthony Joseph and Zinny Boswell:
Wrexham
have agreed a £6.5m deal to sign
Coventry City
defensive midfielder
Ben Sheaf
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old is due to undergo a medical on Monday.
Sheaf has one year left on his Coventry contract.

live_updates.title: Potter provides latest on Paqueta future
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Graham Potter
was asked about the latest on reported
Aston Villa
target
Lucas Paqueta
's future at
West Ham
, after he scored in the 3-0 win over Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
"It's external noise, that's what it is," he said.
"You can see from his performance today how committed he is, how much he cares for the team, how much he cares for his team-mates, how much he's fighting and I'm delighted for him.
"You have to deal with a lot of nonsense in this league and that's the case for every team, especially at this time of the year.
"But we're looking forward to the window shutting and everything going away a little bit."
Asked if he could see Paqueta staying at the club beyond Deadline Day, Potter said: "Yes, absolutely."

live_updates.title: Wrexham agree deal to sign Coventry's Sheaf
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett, Anthony Joseph and Zinny Boswell:
Wrexham
have agreed a £6.5m deal to sign
Coventry City
defensive midfielder
Ben Sheaf
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old is due to undergo a medical on Monday.
Sheaf has one year left on his Coventry contract.

live_updates.title: Martinez left out of Villa squad amid Man Utd transfer links
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Goalkeeper
Emi Martínez
has been left out of
Aston Villa
's squad to take on
Crystal Palace
, live on Sky Sports Super Sunday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Sunday that the 32-year-old is keen on a move to Manchester United and is thought to be waiting on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez started Villa's last game in the Premier League, a 1-0 defeat to Brentford. Marco Bizot replaced Martinez in the starting line-up.
Aston Villa team in full:
Bizot, Cash, Konsa, Mings, Maatsen, McGinn, Tielemans, Malen, Guessand, Rogers, Watkins.
Subs:
Proctor, Digne, Buendia, Torres, Bogarde, Rowe, Jimoh-Aloba.
Follow live updates as Villa host Palace on
Super Sunday
.

live_updates.title: DOWNLOAD THE SKY SPORTS APP
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Can't live without Deadline Day? Then download the

to make sure you don't miss a thing!

live_updates.title: Spurs to sign a forward on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
chairman
Daniel Levy
loves a Deadline Day deal and Spurs fans will be hoping for a late rabbit out of the hat.
Sky Sports News
have reported that signing a left-winger is still a target for Tottenham.
There have been reports this morning that Spurs have enquired over a move for
Paris Saint-Germain
forward
Randal Kolo Muani
.
Atalanta
winger
Ademola Lookman
has been another name linked with a move to the north London club.
Spurs are sure to be a club to watch today.

live_updates.title: Newcastle remain in talks with Brentford over Wissa deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Newcastle
and
Brentford
over
Yoane Wissa
.
That has been the case for a number of weeks, but as it stands, the forward looks to be staying.
That is because Brentford have been adamant throughout this saga that they need to replace him before letting him go.
They have been unable to agree a deal with
Borussia Dortmund
for
Max Beier,
and the club are assessing other targets on Deadline Day.
The Bees also need his valuation to be met. Newcastle are aware of one, but Sky Sports News understands it is not the £65m reported elsewhere.
Wissa released a bullish statement yesterday demanding to leave.

live_updates.title: Vieira and Lokonga likely to join Hamburg
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Green:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira
is now likely to join
Hamburg
on a season-long loan.
There have been talks involving Vieira with
Stuttgart
throughout the window, but they moved to a different target.
Negotiations between the two clubs continue today.
Albert Sambi Lokonga
is also likely to head to
Hamburg
, but on a permanent basis.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set to join Marseille on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Matt O’Riley
is understood to be travelling to France this morning for a medical with
Marseille
.
The 24-year-old is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to buy.
The Denmark international was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: Burnley set to sign midfielder Luis from Benfica
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Florentino Luis
is having medical in Manchester this morning ahead of loan move from
Benfica to Burnley.
All the other details on the move have been agreed for the Portugal midfielder.
Burnley are now focusing on outgoings this Deadline Day.

live_updates.title: Could Guehi remain at Crystal Palace?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News'
Mark McAdam analyses whether
Marc Guehi
could stay at
Crystal Palace
amid interest from
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Leicester in talks to sign Feyenoord's Carranza with El Khannouss set for Stuttgart move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester City
are in talks with
Feyenoord
over a possible deal for striker
Julian Carranza
.
With
Bilal El Khannouss
travelling to Germany this morning to undergo a medical with Stuttgart ahead of his loan and obligation to buy for £26m, Leicester have the funds to improve the squad elsewhere, with a striker their priority.
Carranza is one of their top targets and the deal being discussed is a loan with an option to buy.
Leicester also retain an interest in
Millwall
striker
Mihailo Ivanovic
, but they are reluctant to meet Millwall’s valuation, which is thought to be £10m up front with £2m of add-ons.

live_updates.title: Cresswell in, Aguerd out at West Ham?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy and Lyall Thomas:
West Ham
are looking to bring in
Toulouse
defender
Charlie Cresswell
on
Deadline Day
.
That is because Hammers centre-back
Nayef Aguerd
has been given permission to speak to
Marseille
and undergo a medical.
The deal for Aguerd is understood to be a permanent deal.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree £21.7m deal to sell Antony to Real Betis
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan and Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
forward
Antony
is expected to travel to Spain for a medical with
Real Betis
.
An agreement has been reached between the clubs for his permanent sale for a total of £21.7m (€25m).
The figure is broken up into an initial £19m (€22m) payment plus £4.3m in add-ons.
There is also a 50 per cent net sell-on in the deal.
There are not expected to be any further issues regarding player compensation and personal terms.
A slight restructure from Friday’s initial agreement has been made.
Antony is understood to be taking a pay cut to join the LaLiga side.
Antony cost Manchester United £86m from Ajax in 2022, so it will be a £64.3m loss on the winger.

live_updates.title: Man City reach agreement to sign Donnarumma - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Sky in Italy
are reporting that
Manchester City
have reached an agreement to sign
Paris Saint-Germain
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
.
It is claimed all parties are now finalising a deal for the 26-year-old to join Pep Guardiola's side.

live_updates.title: Jimenez completes Bournemouth medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
AC Milan
defender
Alex Jimenez
has completed his
Bournemouth
medical.
The defender is joining on an initial loan with an obligation to buy him.
The Premier League are expected to announce the full-back's transfer this morning.

live_updates.title: Man City reach agreement to sign Donnarumma - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Sky in Italy
are reporting that
Manchester City
have reached an agreement to sign
Paris Saint-Germain
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
.
It is claimed all parties are now finalising a deal for the 26-year-old to join Pep Guardiola's side.
Sky Sports News
reported earlier this morning that talks are ongoing between Man City and
Fenerbahce
over Ederson joining the Turkish side.
The Brazil international can only leave the club if Man City manage to complete a deal for Donnarumma.

live_updates.title: Getafe's Uche arrives in UK for Premier League move
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Getafe
forward
Christantus Uche
has arrived in the UK to secure a Premier League move.
Three Premier League clubs remain interested: they are understood to be
Aston Villa, Crystal Palace
and
Sunderland
.
Leeds
and
Wolves
were interested earlier in the window but moved onto other targets.
The 22-year-old Nigeria international has already scored and assisted in three LaLiga games this season.

live_updates.title: Sunderland agree deals for Geertruida and Brobbey
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Sunderland
have agreed a deal with
RB Leipzig
for right-back
Lutsharel Geertruida
.
It is a loan with an option to buy him permanently.
Geertruida is landing in the UK imminently.
Sunderland are also in talks with
Ajax
over striker
Brian Brobbey
.
Sunderland need a striker after
Marc Guiu
was recalled by Chelsea.

live_updates.title: Sunderland agree deals for Geertruida and Brobbey
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Sunderland
have agreed a deal with
RB Leipzig
for right-back
Lutsharel Geertruida
.
It is a loan with an option to buy him permanently.
Geertruida is landing in the UK imminently.
Sunderland are also in talks with
Ajax
over striker
Brian Brobbey
.
Sunderland need a striker after
Marc Guiu
was recalled by
Chelsea
.

live_updates.title: Cardiff hopeful of signing Kellyman on loan from Chelsea
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Cardiff City
are hopeful of signing
Omari Kellyman
on a season-long loan from
Chelsea
.
The clubs are in talks over a Deadline Day deal for the 19-year-old.

live_updates.title: West Ham's Palmieri close to Marseille move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
West Ham
full-back
Emerson Palmieri
is close to completing a permanent move to
Marseille
.
The Italy international is scheduled to have a medical this morning after the clubs agreed a deal.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa in Sancho loan talks
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of
Jadon Sancho
.
The discussions over a loan deal.
Villa are also in dialogue with Sancho's camp over personal terms.
There is no agreement yet on either, but Villa are working to get a deal struck before tonight's 7pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa in Sancho loan talks
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of
Jadon Sancho
.
The discussions are over a loan deal for the winger.
Villa are also in dialogue with Sancho's camp over personal terms.
There is no agreement yet on either, but Villa are working to get a deal struck before tonight's 7pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Man City closing in on signing PSG goalkeeper Donnarumma
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth, Lyall Thomas and Kaveh Solhekol:
Manchester City
are closing in on the signing of
Paris Saint-Germain
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
.
City are increasingly confident of agreeing a deal with the 26-year-old.
Sources have told us the framework of a deal between the clubs has been agreed in principle.
There is still work to do, however, and anything can happen on Deadline Day.
Meanwhile,
Fenerbahce
are getting closer to agreeing a deal to sign City goalkeeper
Ederson
.
Only if City secure Donnarumma will they allow Ederson to leave.

live_updates.title: Man Utd in talks over potential goalkeeper signing with Martinez and Lammens targets
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
are in talks over two goalkeepers on Deadline Day.
They are keeping potential deals with
Aston Villa
shot-stopper
Emiliano Martinez
and
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens
warm before deciding which one to go for - if they end up signing one at all.
There is still a chance United will have the same goalkeeping department as they do now.
Both Martinez and Lammens want to join Ruben Amorim's side, but any deal would have to be right.
Both goalkeepers were left out of their respective squads over the weekend.

live_updates.title: Man Utd defender Malacia faces race to depart
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
left-back
Tyrell Malacia
faces a race against time to seal a Deadline Day move.
Elche
remain interested, with United waiting for a suitable offer from the LaLiga side.
Other clubs are interested in the 26-year-old.

live_updates.title: Millwall closing in on signing winger Ballo
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Peter Smith:
Millwall
are closing in on the signing of
Wolfsberger AC
winger
Thierno Ballo
.
It is understood that the clubs have agreed a loan deal, with an option to buy.
Ballo is due to undergo a medical today.

live_updates.title: Man Utd in talks over potential goalkeeper signing with Martinez and Lammens targets
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:

Manchester United
are in talks over two goalkeepers on Deadline Day.
They are keeping potential deals with
Aston Villa
shot-stopper
Emiliano Martinez
and
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens
warm before deciding which one to go for - if they end up signing one at all.
There is still a chance United will have the same goalkeeping department as they do now.
Both Martinez and Lammens want to join Ruben Amorim's side, but any deal would have to be right.
Both goalkeepers were left out of their respective squads over the weekend.

live_updates.title: Edouard told to find another club
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lawrie-Anne Brown and James Savundra:
Crystal Palace
striker
Odsonne Edouard
is believed to be heading to French club
Lens
.
He was not in the Palace squad at Aston Villa on Sunday and has been told he can find another club.

live_updates.title: Sunderland win race for Geetruidam
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Sunderland
have won the race for RB Leipzig's
Lutsharel Geetruidam,
despite competition from Marseille.
The French club are playing in the Champions League this season.
The deal is a loan with an option to buy permanently.
Geertruida is currently landing in the UK to complete the move.

live_updates.title: Sunderland win race for Geertruida
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Sunderland
have won the race for RB Leipzig's
Lutsharel Geertruida,
despite competition from Marseille.
The French club are playing in the Champions League this season.
The deal is a loan with an option to buy permanently.
Geertruida is currently landing in the UK to complete the move.

live_updates.title: Palace close to deal for Igor
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
are close to an agreement with
Brighton
over a loan deal for defender
Igor Julio
.
Sky Sports News
has been told the deal includes an option for Palace to buy him at the end of the season.
Plans are in place for Igor to travel to South London for a medical later today.
West Ham held an interest in the player, but Palace now looks his more likely destination.

live_updates.title: Palace close to deal for Igor
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
are close to an agreement with
Brighton
over a loan deal for defender
Igor Julio
.
Sky Sports News
has been told the deal includes an option for Palace to buy him at the end of the season.
Plans are in place for Igor to travel to south London for a medical later today.
West Ham held an interest in the player, but Palace now looks his more likely destination.

live_updates.title: Guehi -  stay or go?
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News'
Mark McAdam analyses whether
Marc Guehi
could stay at
Crystal Palace
amid interest from
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Sunderland agree deal for Brobbey
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Sunderland
are understood to have now agreed a deal in principle with
Ajax
for
Brian Brobbey
.
The fee is thought to be £21.7m (€25m) plus £4.3m (€5m).
He is expected to undergo a medical in Holland.

live_updates.title: Sunderland agree deal for Brobbey
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Sunderland
are understood to have now agreed a £26m deal in principle with
Ajax
for
Brian Brobbey
.
The fee is thought to be £21.7m (€25m) plus £4.3m (€5m).
The forward is expected to undergo a medical in Holland.

live_updates.title: Lamptey joins Fiorentina
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Brighton
have announced right-back
Tariq Lamptey
has joined Fiorentina on a permanent deal.
The 24-year-old is moving to Serie A in a deal worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Sky Sports News
reported on Saturday that an agreement had been reached between the two clubs.
Lamptey signed a one-year contract extension at Brighton in June but selling the player now means the Premier League club will receive a fee, instead of losing him for nothing.

live_updates.title: Gyabi to leave Leeds for Hull
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Richard Smith and Zinny Boswell:
Darko Gyabi
is set to join
Hull
on permanent deal from Leeds.
The 21-year-old central midfielder spent last season on loan at Plymouth.

live_updates.title: Lamptey joins Fiorentina
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Brighton
have announced right-back
Tariq Lamptey
has joined Fiorentina on a permanent deal.
The 24-year-old is moving to Serie A in a deal worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Sky Sports News
reported on Saturday that an agreement had been reached between the two clubs.
Lamptey signed a one-year contract extension at Brighton in June but selling the player now means the Premier League club will receive a fee, instead of losing him for nothing.

live_updates.title: Morris joins Luton
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Shayden Morris
has joined
Luton
from
Aberdeen
for an undisclosed fee.
The 23-year-old made 87 appearances across three years for the Dons, having made the move from Fleetwood Town in 2022.

live_updates.title: Florentino Luis undergoing medical ahead of Burnley move
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Florentino Luis
has begun his medical in Manchester this morning ahead of a loan move from
Benfica
to
Burnley
.
All other details have already been agreed for the Portugal midfielder
Burnley are now focusing on outs.

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Crystal Palace
are close to an agreement with
Brighton
over a loan deal for defender
Igor Julio
.
Sky Sports News
has been told the deal includes an option for Palace to buy him at the end of the season.
Plans are in place for Igor to travel to south London for a medical later today.
West Ham held an interest in the player, but Palace now looks his more likely destination.

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter

Brighton

has joined Fiorentina on a permanent deal.
The 24-year-old is moving to Serie A in a deal worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Sky Sports News

Lamptey signed a one-year contract extension at Brighton in June but selling the player now means the Premier League club will receive a fee, instead of losing him for nothing.

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Sunderland
are understood to have now agreed a £26m deal in principle with
Ajax
for
Brian Brobbey
.
The fee is thought to be £21.7m (€25m) plus £4.3m (€5m).

live_updates.title: Cardiff confirm Kellyman
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Cardiff
have confirmed the loan signing of teenager
Omari Kellyman
from Chelsea.

live_updates.title: Cardiff confirm Kellyman
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Cardiff
have confirmed the loan signing of Chelsea teenager
Omari Kellyman.

live_updates.title: Bournemouth sign Jimenez
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Bournemouth
have signed
Alex Jimenez
from AC Milan.
The full-back joins on an initial loan with an obligation to buy.
The Cherries have lost three of last year's starting back four in this summer's transfer window.

live_updates.title: 'Newcastle agree £55m deal to sign Brentford's Wissa'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a £55m deal to sign
Brentford
forward
Yoane Wissa
, according to
Fabrizio Romano.
It is claimed Wissa is now set for his Magpies medical.
The reported breakthrough comes after Newcastle agreed to sell
Alexander Isak
to
Liverpool
in a British-record £125m.

live_updates.title: Everton working on deal to sign Freiburg's Rohl
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Alan Myers:
Everton
are working on the signing of Freiburg attacking midfielder
Merlin Rohl
.
Sky Sports News
understands the 23-year-old may already be on Merseyside.

live_updates.title: 'Donnarumma leaving PSG with best wishes'
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol:
PSG
are sticking to their word to make sure
Gianluigi Donnarumma
gets the move he wants to leave the club in a respectful way - even though they were unable to agree a new contract with him.
He is leaving with the best wishes of everyone at PSG and he recently had an emotional goodbye meeting with club president Naser Al-Khelaifi.
Manchester City is the best option for him and it has just been a matter of negotiating a deal and waiting for Ederson’s future to be resolved.
Donnarumma’s departure will mark the end of the so-called Galactico era. PSG now have a policy of signing younger players on lower base wages.
Donnarumma, like
Milan Skriniar
and
Marco Asensio
, arrived at PSG as free agents.
PSG are making profit on all three this summer.

live_updates.title: Winterburn joins Barnet on loan
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Bournemouth's
Ben Winterburn
has joined Barnet on a season-long loan.
The League Two side won the race for his signature as they could offer first-team opportunities.
Other fourth-tier sides were interested along with a club from the Scottish Premiership.

live_updates.title: Newcastle increasingly optimistic of signing Wissa from Brentford
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
are growing increasingly optimistic of signing
Brentford
forward
Yoane Wissa
today.
The two clubs are now locked in talks and getting closer to an agreement.
The discussions are centring around a fee in the region of £50m, with the final details being discussed.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree £55m deal with Brentford for Wissa
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a £55m deal with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree deal with Brentford for Wissa
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
The agreement is understood to be initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.
Brentford were adamant throughout this window that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected this summer, before Wissa released a
bombshell statement
on Sunday demanding to be sold before Monday's deadline.

live_updates.title: Villa agree deal for Sancho
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
have agreed a deal with
Manchester United
for
Jadon Sancho
.
The agreement is a straight loan.
It’s understood Villa will pay a loan fee, and pay 80 per cent of the player's wages.
Sancho’s has entered the final year of his Old Trafford contract.
United have the option to extend for a further 12 months.

live_updates.title: Villa agree deal for Sancho
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
have agreed a deal with
Manchester United
for
Jadon Sancho
.
The agreement is a straight loan.
It’s understood Villa will pay a loan fee, and pay 80 per cent of the player's wages.
Sancho has entered the final year of his Old Trafford contract.
United have the option to extend for a further 12 months.

live_updates.title: Ten Hag sacked by Bayer Leverkusen
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Erik ten Hag
has been sacked by
Bayer Leverkusen
after just two Bundesliga matches.
The ex-Manchester United boss was appointed to replace Xabi Alonso in April.
Training at Bayer Leverkusen was postponed this morning.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree deal with Brentford for Wissa
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
The agreement is understood to be an initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.
Brentford were adamant throughout this window that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected this summer, before Wissa released a
bombshell statement
on Sunday demanding to be sold before Monday's deadline.
Wissa and his representatives are in London awaiting final permission to travel to the North East for a medical.
Personal terms have been agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Ten Hag sacked by Bayer Leverkusen
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Bayer Leverkusen
have decided to part ways with
Erik ten Hag
after just two Bundesliga matches in charge.
The ex-Manchester United boss was appointed to replace Xabi Alonso in April.
Training at Bayer Leverkusen was postponed this morning.

live_updates.title: Ex-Man Utd boss Ten Hag sacked by Bayer Leverkusen
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Bayer Leverkusen
have decided to part ways with
Erik ten Hag
after just two Bundesliga matches in charge.
The ex-Manchester United boss was appointed to replace Xabi Alonso in April.

live_updates.title: Swansea take Samuels-Smith on loan
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Swansea City
are closing in on the signing of
Strasbourg
left-back
Ishe Samuels-Smith
.
It’s understood the clubs have agreed a season-long loan deal for the 19-year-old.
Samuel-Smith joined Strasbourg last month from Chelsea.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree deal with Brentford for Wissa
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
Full story:

live_updates.title: Ogbene to undergo medical at Sheffield Utd
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Sheffield United
have agreed a deal with
Ipswich
to sign winger
Chiedozie Ogbene
on loan.
Ogbene has left the Republic of Ireland camp to undergo a medical.

live_updates.title: Ogbene to undergo medical at Sheffield Utd
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Sheffield United
have agreed a deal with
Ipswich
to sign winger
Chiedozie Ogbene
on loan.
Ogbene has left the Republic of Ireland camp to undergo a medical.

live_updates.title: Ex-Man Utd boss Ten Hag sacked by Bayer Leverkusen
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Bayer Leverkusen
have decided to part ways with
Erik ten Hag
after just two Bundesliga matches in charge.
The ex-Manchester United boss was appointed to replace Xabi Alonso following the Spaniard's move to Real Madrid.
Training at Bayer Leverkusen was postponed this morning.

live_updates.title: Huddersfield complete Alves loan deal
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Leicester
have confirmed the season-long loan of winger
Will Alves
to
Huddersfield Town
.
The 20-year-old academy graduate is highly-rated, but has struggled to get near Marti Cifuentes's starting XI so far this season.

live_updates.title: Wissa in Newcastle ahead of medical
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie, Dharmesh Sheth, Mark McAdam, and Lyall Thomas:
Yoane Wissa
is already in the North East ahead of a £55m move to
Newcastle
.
The forward will have his medical this afternoon.
Personal terms have already been agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Ramsey, Obafemi likely to leave Burnley
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Burnley
duo
Aaron Ramsey
and
Michael Obafemi
are likely to leave on loan today.
Ramsey is set to join Leicester, while Obafemi is expected to sign for German side VFL Bochum.

live_updates.title: Isak begins medical at Liverpool
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor:
Alexander Isak
has arrived at
Liverpool’s
Melwood training ground and a medical is under way.

live_updates.title: Villa exploring deal for Elliot
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
have had informal conversations with
Liverpool
over attacker
Harvey Elliott
.
Everything is on the table at the moment in terms of loan or permanent deal.
The arrival of Isak at Liverpool has opened up a potential departure for Elliott.
Elliott has been linked with RB Leipzig this summer but they are way off on their valuation of the player.

live_updates.title: Bayer Leverkusen confirm Ten Hag departure
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Bayer Leverkusen
have now confirmed the sacking of
Erik ten Hag
.
He was in charge of two Bundesliga matches before losing his job.
In an official statement, the German club said: "Bayer 04 has parted ways with head coach Erik ten Hag with immediate effect.
"The assistant coaching staff will temporarily take over training duties."

live_updates.title: Rohl remains in talks with Everton
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Alan Myers:
Freiburg midfielder
Merlin Rohl
flew into Liverpoolairport this morning and is in talks with
Everton
.
Manager David Moyes wants a central-midfielder and interest in Rohl has been ongoing since last January.
There is still work to do to make it happen before the 7pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Bayern back in talks over Chelsea's Jackson
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayern Munich
are back in talks with
Chelsea
to try and sign
Nicolas Jackson
.
Jackson and his representatives are still in Munich and the player has not given up on a move to Bayern.
Talks are understood to be ongoing between all parties over resurrecting the deal.
Jackson has his heart set on the move and his camp are doing all they can to make it happen.
He does not have to come back to the UK as things stand as he is due to link up with Senegal this week for international duty.

live_updates.title: Gomez to AC Milan riding on potential Guehi deal
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Exclusive from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Vinny O'Connor:
Liverpool
have received an offer from
AC Milan
for
Joe Gomez
in what would be a substantive move to Serie A - but it now looks unlikely the deal can be completed in time for tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Liverpool will categorically not allow Gomez to leave, unless they have
Marc Guehi
or another top level centre back in.
Arne Slot
is keen to to have BOTH Guehi and Gomez in his ranks once the deadline passes.
Milan’s owners, Red Bird Capital, also have a stake in Fenway Sports Group, who own Liverpool, and the two sides talked late into last night before thrashing out terms on Gomez moving to Italy.
Separately, we are told Milan held talks with Gomez’s representatives and were close to agreeing a deal before the plug was pulled.
The deal was entirely dependent on Liverpool completing a deal for Guehi to move to Anfield from Crystal Palace - and whilst that transfer is still active, both sides feel there isn’t enough time to complete the necessary logistics to do the Gomez move after Guehi.
Gomez was poised to fly to Italy, but Liverpool haven’t given him permission to do so.

live_updates.title: West Ham working to sign Arrey-Mbi
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Germany:
West Ham
are working on a Deadline Day deal to sign Germany U21 defender
Bright Arrey-Mbi
from Braga.
The 22-year-old was on the books at Chelsea and Bayern Munich as a youth player.

live_updates.title: Forest close to completing £34.7m deal for Strasbourg winger Bakwa
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Nottingham Forest
are close to completing a deal for
Strasbourg
winger
Dilane Bakwa
, who has been a long-term target.
The fee being discussed is worth over £34.7m (€40m) and S
ky Sports News
has been told Forest are confident of getting the transfer over the line before tonight's 7pm deadline.
Bakwa’s performances in Ligue 1 have attracted the attention of a number of clubs in the Premier League and Europe, but Forest look to have beaten off the competition for a player who has been a priority target.
The 23-year-old scored six goals and contributed nine assists last season, in helping Strasbourg qualify for Europe.

live_updates.title: Donnarumma in, Ederson out?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala:
"Well, what a move this would be for Manchester City. On the surface, bringing in one of the best goalkeepers in the world would be a boost for any club.
"At City, though, it raises several questions. We understand it would allow Ederson to move on, with Fenerbahçe emerging as a strong possibility. But what would this mean for James Trafford?
"Learning from Donnarumma would benefit any goalkeeper. At just 26, the Italian already has a decade of first-team experience, and still has many years ahead of him.
"Trafford, who returned to City for £31m in the summer, could make his England debut during the international break. However, he has endured a mixed start, with costly mistakes in the defeat to Spurs and in the loss at Brighton on Sunday.
"Ederson, now in his ninth season at the club, looks likely to leave. But how would Donnarumma fit into Pep Guardiola’s system? We saw with Joe Hart’s replacement by Claudio Bravo that Guardiola prefers ball-playing goalkeepers. Donnarumma doesn’t quite fit that mould. He has also faced criticism for struggling with crosses and set pieces. On those fronts, could Trafford be the better option?
Still, it would be hard for City to turn down the chance to sign a Champions League winner, no matter what the repercussions might be."

We saw with Joe Hart’s replacement by Claudio Bravo that Guardiola prefers ball-playing goalkeepers. Donnarumma doesn’t quite fit that mould. He has also faced criticism for struggling with crosses and set pieces. On those fronts, could Trafford be the better option?
Still, it would be hard for City to turn down the chance to sign a Champions League winner, no matter what the repercussions might be."

live_updates.title: Isak to join up with Sweden camp once Liverpool medical complete
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Gary Cotterill in Sweden:
Sweden head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed
Alexander Isak
is in the UK to complete his transfer to
Liverpool
, but will link up with the national team later today.
“I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today. He is extremely professional and has a good mentality."
Asked whether the forward's head is in the right place to play, he added: "He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries
“He’s not able to play for 90 minutes, but he can be a game-changer.”
Tomasson says Isak won’t arrive in time for training this afternoon.
It’s likely he will arrive this evening.

live_updates.title: Ipswich agree to send Al-Hamadi on loan to Luton
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Ipswich
have an agreement in principle to send
Ali Al-Hamadi
on loan to
Luton
in a deal which includes an obligation to buy.
The total package is worth £3m.
The 23-year-old forward is travelling to Luton for a medical.

live_updates.title: WATCH: Newcastle close to ending Wissa saga
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Newcastle have agreed a deal worth up to £55m to sign Brentford forward
Yoane Wissa
.

live_updates.title: Chermiti in Scotland to complete Rangers move
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Everton
striker
Youssef Chermiti
has arrived in Glasgow ahead of his move to
Rangers
.
He is set to move to Ibrox in a deal worth an initial £8m, plus add ons.
It will be the biggest fee paid by Rangers for a player since signing Tore Andre Flo in 2000.

live_updates.title: Chermiti in Scotland to complete Rangers move
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Luke Shanley and Sahil Jaidka:
Everton
striker
Youssef Chermiti
has arrived in Glasgow ahead of his move to
Rangers
.
He is set to move to Ibrox in a deal worth an initial £8m, plus add ons.
It will be the biggest fee paid by Rangers for a player since signing Tore Andre Flo in 2000.
The 21-year-old has been impacted by various injuries and made just 24 appearances for Everton, but is yet to score and is on the search for regular game time.

live_updates.title: O'Riley in France ahead of Marseille loan
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Midfielder
Matt O'Riley
has arrived in
Marseille
ahead of his loan move from
Brighton
.
The Denmark international has been pictured with fans outside Marseille's training ground.

Sweden
head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed
Alexander Isak
is in the UK to complete his British-record transfer to
Liverpool,
but will link up with the national team later today, saying: "I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today.
"He is extremely professional and has a good mentality. He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries [his head is in right place to play]
"He’s not able to play for 90 minutes, but he can be a game changer.
Tomasson says Isak won’t arrive in time for training this afternoon, with the player likely to now arrive this evening.

live_updates.title: Guehi's Palace future hanging in balance
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra:
Marc Guehi's
Crystal Palace
future hangs in the balance heading into the final hours of the window.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that it’s “50/50” whether the England defender moves to Liverpool or not.
The club are currently tying up deals to bring central defenders
Jaydee Canvot
and
Igor Jesus
on Deadline Day.
However, signing the pair does not mean that Guehi will definitely depart Palace today.
Palace are reluctant to sell their club captain but losing Guehi for free would be a bitter pill to swallow.
He has entered the final year of his deal at Selhurst Park.

live_updates.title: Woolfenden set for Coventry
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Ipswich
defender
Luke Woolfenden
is set to arrive at Coventry today ahead of a permanent move.
He has been given permission to have a medical.

live_updates.title: Palace beat PL competition to Uche signing
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra and Rob Dorsett:
Crystal Palace
look to have beaten competition from a number of other Premier League clubs - including Aston Villa and Sunderland - to land the highly rated Getafe forward
Christantus Uche
.
Sky Sports News
has been told there is broad agreement over a fee between the two clubs, believed to be worth over £17.3m (€20m).
Uche has now arrived at Palace’s training ground, where he is currently undergoing a medical.
The Nigeria international forward was a target for a number of clubs in England and Europe, but Palace have made him a transfer priority as they look to replace
Eberechi Eze
who moved to Arsenal.
Uche is a versatile forward who can play anywhere across the front three, and even a little deeper in an attacking midfield role.

live_updates.title: Woolfenden set for Coventry
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Ipswich
defender
Luke Woolfenden
is set to arrive at Coventry today ahead of a permanent move.
He has been given permission to have a medical.
The total package is worth £4m.

live_updates.title: Carranza is Leicester for medical
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Julian Carranza
is currently undergoing a medical in
Leicester
.
The striker was one of their top targets this summer.
The deal is thought to concern a loan with an option to buy.

live_updates.title: Cuibano passes medical at Forest
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui:
Prospective
Nottingham Forest
signing
Cuibano
has completed his medical at the club's training ground.
The signing will be confirmed later today.
Forest are also trying to complete a deal for
Dilane Bakwa
from Strasbourg for around £35m.
