live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
The deal is worth £18.2m plus add-ons.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.
United had been in talks with Aston Villa to sign
Emi Martinez
.
However, it is understood that United viewed Lammens as the right choice for them.

live_updates.title: 'Spurs in talks to sign PSG forward Kolo Muani'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
are looking to sign
Paris Saint-Germain
forward
Randal Kolo Muani
on Deadline Day, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
It is claimed Spurs have almost agreed personal terms with the France international.
Negotiations are reportedly ongoing with PSG over a loan deal, but the Champions League holders are insisting on an obligation to buy in the deal.
The 26-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan at Juventus, where he scored 10 goals in 22 games across all competitions.

live_updates.title: Leicester trump Wrexham for James
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
look to have trumped their Championship promotion rivals
Wrexham
to the signing of young Wales international midfielder
Jordan James
.
Leicester are progressing in their talks with Rennes over a loan deal for the 21-year-old, who has three years left on his contract in France.
James is thought to be keen on the idea of a move to King Power Stadium, and there is optimism an agreement can be reached in time before tonight's deadline.

live_updates.title: Leicester trump Wrexham for James
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
look to have trumped their Championship promotion rivals
Wrexham
to the signing of young Wales international midfielder
Jordan James
.
The Foxes are progressing in their talks with Rennes over a loan deal for the 21-year-old, who has three years left on his contract in France.
James is thought to be keen on the idea of a move to King Power Stadium, and there is optimism an agreement can be reached in time before tonight's deadline.

live_updates.title: Rangers loan Cortes to Sporting Gijon
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Rangers
winger
Oscar Cortes
is closing in on a move to Spanish second division side
Sporting Gijon
.
The 21-year-old had his second loan spell at Ibrox last season, with an obligation to buy triggered in the summer.
However, he is now set to depart on loan until the end of this season after a lack of action.
Cortes has made 21 appearances for Rangers, scoring one goal and providing two assists.

live_updates.title: Celtic pushing to sign Tounekti
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
have made a third bid for
Hammarby IF
winger
Sebastian Tounekti
.
It’s understood the latest offer is worth up to £5.2m.
Hammarby had always been looking for a deal in the region of £5m before they considered selling the Tunisia international.

live_updates.title: Kamara leaves Pompey
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Portsmouth
have announced
Abdoulaye Kamara
has left the club by mutual consent.
The 20-year-old former
Borussia Dortmund II
midfielder has joined German third-tier side
FC Saarbrucken
.

live_updates.title: Vardy undergoing medical in Italy
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Jamie Vardy
is currently undergoing a medical in Milan ahead of completing a move to
Cremonese
.
He is expected to sign his contract later today.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
The deal is worth £18.2m plus add-ons.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.
United had been in talks with Aston Villa to sign
Emi Martinez
.
However, it is understood that United viewed Lammens as the right choice for them.

live_updates.title: 'Slim to no chance of Gallagher leaving Atletico'
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra and Lyall Thomas:
Currently, there is slim to no chance of
Conor Gallagher
leaving
Atletico Madrid
today.
Crystal Palace
have been hoping to bring him back to Selhurst Park but Atletico have no interest in selling or loaning him.
Sky Sports News
understand Atletico are not even looking for a replacement in the event that a tempting offer arrives.
Palace signed four players on Deadline Day last summer.
There is a realistic possibility they could sign a number of new players today too.

live_updates.title: Yang poised to leave Celtic for Birmingham
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
winger
Hyunjun Yang
is travelling to England ahead of a possible £3m move to
Birmingham City
.
The clubs are close to agreeing an initial fee of £3m, plus add-ons, with Birmingham still waiting for the Hoops to sanction the move.
However, with less than seven hours to go in the English window, the South Korea international is on his way to Birmingham to be ready for when the deal gets the green light.

live_updates.title: Watch ALL of Hackney's goals for Middlesbrough!
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Middlesbrough
's
Hayden Hackney
has been in demand all summer - but will he make a move away from Teesside today?
Click below to watch all of his goals for Boro so far (plus one from this season against Millwall!)

live_updates.title: Winger set to join Southampton
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Heidenheim
winger
Leo Scienza
is set to join
Southampton
.
Saints have agreed a deal with Heidenheim worth up to £8.6m (€10m).

live_updates.title: Wrexham and Birmingham told Vyner not for sale
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Wrexham
and
Birmingham
have been told
Zak Vyner
is not for sale by
Bristol City
at any price – even £5m.
The player is relaxed about the situation and is enjoying his football under
Gerhard Struber
.
He is already in the final year of his contract and could be an attractive free agent next summer.

live_updates.title: Hincapie's Arsenal position
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News:
“Hincapie is left-footed and can also play at left-back. Arsenal are already well covered in those areas with Gabriel and Calafiori, so I’m not sure where he would fit in. It’s a lot of money to pay when you’ve already got those positions covered.”

live_updates.title: Wrexham and Birmingham told Vyner not for sale
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Wrexham
and
Birmingham
have been told
Zak Vyner
is not for sale by
Bristol City
at any price – even £5m.
The player is relaxed about the situation and is enjoying his football under
Gerhard Struber
.
He is already in the final year of his contract and could be an attractive free agent next summer.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks for Liverpool's Elliot
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy and the package under discussion is worth £35m.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
The 22-year-old is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Brentford negotiating Nelson deal
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are close to agreeing an initial loan deal with Arsenal for
Reiss Nelson
.
They are also discussing an option to buy him permanently as part of the deal.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks for Liverpool's Elliot
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy and the package under discussion is worth £35m.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
The 22-year-old is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Ajax out to hijack Celtic's move for Dolberg
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Ajax
have made a last-ditch attempt to hijack
Kasper Dolberg’s
move from
Anderlecht
to
Celtic
.
The Dutch club made an enquiry this morning.
However, it’s understood they may only be able to do a loan, after exploring the conditions of a permanent deal with Anderlecht.
Celtic have been progressing in talks with the Belgian side over a deal for the Denmark international, with Anderlecht preferring to do a permanent transfer for a significant fee.
Sky Sports News
has been told Dolberg is open to joining the Scottish champions, but an emotional return to Ajax would be seen as an attractive option.

live_updates.title: West Ham youngster headed for Scotland
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
21-year-old
West Ham
defender
Junior Robinson
is in talks over a loan move to
Livingston
.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks for Liverpool's Elliot
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy and the package under discussion is worth £35m.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
The 22-year-old is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Cortes joins Sporting Gijon
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Rangers
winger
Oscar Cortes
has completed a season-long loan move to Spanish second division side
Sporting Gijon
.

live_updates.title: Spurs reach agreement for Kolo Muani
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have reached an agreement with
PSG
for the transfer of
Randal Kolo Muani
on loan.
The deal is for a straight loan with no option or obligation, as of yet.
The player is on the way to London to complete a medical.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa confirm Lindelof deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa have confirmed the signing of former Manchester United centre-back Victor Lindelof.
The Sweden international left Old Trafford in June after seven years at the club, making more than 250 appearances and winning both the Carabao Cup and Europa League.
Lindelof now links up with Unai Emery’s side as a free agent.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa confirm Lindelof deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa have confirmed the signing of former Manchester United centre-back Victor Lindelof.
The Sweden international left Old Trafford in June after seven years at the club, making more than 250 appearances and winning both the Carabao Cup and Europa League.
Lindelof now links up with Unai Emery’s side as a free agent.

live_updates.title: Spurs reach agreement for Kolo Muani
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have reached an agreement with
PSG
for the transfer of
Randal Kolo Muani
on loan.
The deal contains no option or obligation, as of yet.
The player is on his way to London to complete a medical.
The France international has been out of favour with the European champions.
He spent the second half of last season on loan at Juventus.

live_updates.title: Bakwa having Forest medical
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Strasbourg
winger
Dilane Bakwa
is undergoing a medical ahead of his £34.7m move to
Nottingham Forest.

live_updates.title: Wrexham close to signing Man City defender
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala and Anthony Joseph:
Wrexham
are close to agreeing a deal to sign
Manchester City
right-back
Issa Kabore.
It’s understood the clubs are discussing a season-long loan deal for the Burkina Faso international.
Kabore, 24, is undergoing a medical in preparation for the move being sanctioned.

live_updates.title: Sheaf undergoing medical at Wrexham
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Coventry
defensive midfielder
Ben Sheaf
is undergoing a medical ahead of his £6.5m move to
Wrexham
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old has agreed terms on a three-year contract.
The club will also hold option to extend by a further year.

live_updates.title: Liverpool preparing for Guehi medical
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Mark McAdam, Vinny O’Connor & Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
are preparing for
Marc Guehi
to have a medical in London knowing that any deal with
Crystal Palace
to sign him could go close to tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Any agreement between the two clubs will hinge on Palace being able to bolster their defensive ranks before they sign off a move for Guehi, but talks with Liverpool’s bosses remain very much alive.
To that end, the Brighton defender
Igor Julio
is currently undergoing a medical before sealing a move to Selhurst Park - although the Eagles have concerns that
West Ham
may make a late move to try to persuade Igor to join them.
Until Igor is confirmed, Palace are adamant they will not let Guehi leave.
Sky Sports News
has been told Liverpool want to make sure they have all the medical provisions in place and ready, should a deal be struck, and Guehi would then be given permission to travel to try to complete a move.
The Palace captain is understood to be “in the area” and awaiting  further developments.

live_updates.title: Boro sign Strelec
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Middlesbrough
have announced the signing of striker
David Strelec
from Slovan Bratislava on a five-year deal.
The fee is undisclosed but
Sky Sports News
understands it’s beaten the previous record for an outgoing transfer from Slovakia which stood at £6m (€7m).
Strelec had interest from other British clubs but we understand he had talks with Middlesbrough in January when Boro were coached by Michael Carrick and that interest was now followed up this summer.

live_updates.title: Spurs reach agreement for Kolo Muani
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have reached an agreement with
PSG
for the transfer of
Randal Kolo Muani
on loan.
The deal contains no option or obligation, as of yet.
The player is on his way to London to complete a medical.
The France international has been out of favour with the European champions.
He spent the second half of last season on loan at Juventus.

live_updates.title: Boro sign Strelec
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Middlesbrough
have announced the signing of striker
David Strelec
from
Slovan Bratislava
on a five-year deal.
The fee is undisclosed but
Sky Sports News
understands it’s beaten the previous record for an outgoing transfer from Slovakia which stood at £6m (€7m).
Strelec had interest from other British clubs and had talks with Middlesbrough in January when Boro were coached by Michael Carrick - that interest has been followed up this summer.

live_updates.title: Liverpool preparing for Guehi medical
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Mark McAdam, Vinny O’Connor & Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
are preparing for
Marc Guehi
to have a medical in London knowing that any deal with
Crystal Palace
to sign him could go close to tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Any agreement between the two clubs will hinge on Palace being able to bolster their defensive ranks before they sign off a move for Guehi, but talks with Liverpool’s bosses remain very much alive.
To that end, the Brighton defender
Igor Julio
is currently undergoing a medical before sealing a move to Selhurst Park - although the Eagles have concerns that
West Ham
may make a late move to try to persuade Igor to join them.
Until Igor is confirmed, Palace are adamant they will not let Guehi leave.
Sky Sports News
has been told Liverpool want to make sure they have all the medical provisions in place and ready, should a deal be struck, and Guehi would then be given permission to travel to try to complete a move.
The Palace captain is understood to be “in the area” and awaiting  further developments.

live_updates.title: Roberts to join Birmingham
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Patrick Roberts
is set to join Birmingham on loan from
Sunderland
.

live_updates.title: Vieira having medical at Hamburg
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira's
medical with Hamburg is under way, according to
Sky in Germany
.
He is expected to join on a season-long loan.

live_updates.title: Palace pursuing three defenders amid Guehi move
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Crystal Palace
are currently pursuing possible deals for THREE defenders, as they look to strengthen at centre-back - and how successful they are will dictate whether or not they sanction
Marc Guehi's
move to
Liverpool
.
Brighton
defender
Igor Julio
is undergoing a medical at Palace, as they look to complete a loan deal with an option to buy. This deal is crucial if Palace are to allow Guehi to leave for Liverpool.
There are concerns
West Ham
may yet come in with a late offer to try to pinch Igor from Palace.
Jaydee Canvot
, the 19-year-old
Toulouse
centre back, has now completed his Palace medical and his signing is expected to be confirmed shortly - a deal worth £20.8m.
Oliver Glasner is keen for the club to complete a deal for the Serbia international defender
Strahinja Pavlovic
, although the latest we have been told is that negotiations are not currently progressing.
Forward
Christantus Uche
, meanwhile, is undergoing a medical at Palace ahead of a possible €20m move from Getafe. He is seen as a replacement for Ebe Eze.

live_updates.title: Wissa agrees Newcastle contract
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Yoane Wissa
has agreed a four-year contract with
Newcastle
.
The deal to take Wissa from Brentford to the North East is worth £55m.
Full story:

live_updates.title: Merse shocked that Guehi hasn't attracted more attention
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Paul Merson
heaps praise on
Crystal Palace
's captain
Marc Guehi
as the defender is heavily linked with a move to Premier League champions Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Lammens on way for Man Utd medical
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan:
Senne Lammens
has landed in England and is on his way to Carrington to undergo his
Manchester United
medical ahead of signing for £18.2m.

live_updates.title: More Brighton exits expected
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporter Chris Nightingale:
Brighton
have let a lot of players go this summer and that number is only going to increase throughout Deadline Day with updates on
Julio Enciso, Facundo Buonanotte, Jeremy Sarmiento
and
Matt O’Riley
still to come.
Manager Fabian Hurzeler has spoken about the need to trim his squad throughout this window, but it’s easy to see some areas could become light with injury.

live_updates.title: WATCH: Merse shocked Guehi hasn't attracted more attention
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Paul Merson
heaps praise on
Crystal Palace
's captain
Marc Guehi
as the defender is heavily linked with a move to Premier League champions Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
"For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai?
"All of a sudden, Wirtz is in there, a £100m player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: Wrexham sign Sheaf
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Wrexham
have completed a £6.5m deal for
Coventry
captain
Ben Sheaf
.
He has agreed a three-year contract with the option of a further year.

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
"For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai?
"All of a sudden, Wirtz is in there, a £100m player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: 'Isak move will only work if chemistry is right'
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"I like him [Alexander Isak]. He’s a good player, but I don’t think it’s all over just because he’s signed. I don’t see it like that. The problem is Liverpool haven’t played well, yet they’ve beaten Newcastle and Arsenal. That’s the issue: they’ve not been at their best, but they’ve still got those results.
"It all depends on whether it works. You can have the best players in the world, but if it doesn’t gel, you don’t have the chemistry. When Liverpool were at their best, it was Mane, Salah and Firmino. Firmino would drop off, Salah would make those runs in, and Mane too, there was chemistry.
"For me, Firmino wasn’t a £125m player, but he made it all tick. Unless this new set-up gels, time will tell. What Slot has now is a lot of head-scratching, because he’s got big decisions to make with very good players."

live_updates.title: Sheff Wednesday in talks for Man Utd full-back
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vikash Varange and Dharmesh Sheth:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a season-long loan as the 18-year-old is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Enciso joins Strasbourg
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Julio Enciso
has completed his move to French club
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old has joined on a permanent deal for a fee understood to be £10m.
Brighton have a sell-on clause as part of the deal.
Enciso is the second player who has left the club today after
Tariq Lamptey
joined Fiorentina.

live_updates.title: PFA pre-season enters final week
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text: There is no deadline for clubs to sign free agents, but could any of these free agents be on the move today?

live_updates.title: Spurs to sell Gil to Girona
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have agreed a deal with Girona to sell
Bryan Gil
for around £8.65m.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wednesday agree loan for Man Utd full-back
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta:
Sheffield Wednesday
have agreed a loan deal with
Manchester United
for left-back
Harry Amass
.
The teenager's move to the Championship is pending EFL approval.
The season-long loan deal has no option to buy as the 18-year-old is still seen as one for the future at Man Utd.

live_updates.title: Spurs to sell Gil to Girona
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have agreed a deal with Girona to sell
Bryan Gil
for around £8.65m.
The forward spent last season on loan at the LaLiga side, scoring three times in 21 starts.

live_updates.title: Oxford sign Bulgaria international
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Oxford
have completed the signing of
Filip Krastev
on a season-long loan from
Lommel
.
The midfielder, 23, has 24 caps for Bulgaria and spent time on loan in the MLS at
LA FC
in 2023.
Oxford boss
Gary Rowett
said: “Filip is a player with wonderful ability who can add a lot of energy to the team.
“He will provide a creative spark, with a clear eye for goal and an ability to deliver moments of quality.
“We believe Filip will add something new and exciting to the group and we look forward to working with him over the international break to get him ready as soon as possible.”

live_updates.title: Oxford sign Bulgaria international
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Oxford
have completed the signing of
Filip Krastev
on a season-long loan from
Lommel
.
The midfielder, 23, has 24 caps for Bulgaria and spent time on loan in the MLS at
LA FC
in 2023.

live_updates.title: Spurs agree to sell Gil to Girona
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have agreed a deal with Girona to sell
Bryan Gil
for around £8.65m.
The forward spent last season on loan at the LaLiga side, scoring three times in 21 starts.

live_updates.title: Osula attracting attention before deadline
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie and Rob Jones:
Eintracht Frankfurt
have made a bid for Newcastle striker
William Osula
.
The package under discussion is £28.5m.
Aston Villa
have also enquired over Osula’s availability in the last 48 hours.
The 22-year-old scored on Monday against Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd despite asking to leave
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Kobbie Mainoo
is staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in Ruben Amorim's first team.
The club are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options, which include Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd despite asking to leave
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan:
Kobbie Mainoo
is staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in Ruben Amorim's first team.
The club are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options, which include Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Robinson joins Livingston
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have confirmed young defender
Junior Robinson
has joined
Livingston
on a season-long loan.

live_updates.title: Ajax hijacking Celtic move for Dolberg
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Ajax
are now pressing ahead in their bid to hijack
Kasper Dolberg’s
move to
Celtic
after seeking assurance from the player that he would prefer a return to the club.
Sky Sports News
revealed earlier today that the Eredivisie club made an enquiry this morning over a permanent deal, but were not satisfied with the conditions set out by
Anderlecht
.
Ajax came back in with a loan approach, but Anderlecht are not keen to loan their star striker – and are only open to selling for a significant fee.
It’s understood the Dutch club are now in talks again over a permanent deal after Dolberg confirmed that he would prefer to join them.
This could leave Celtic scrambling as they search for two strikers before tonight’s 11pm deadline.
Adam Idah
has already completed a medical and finalised the paperwork ahead of his £7m move to
Swansea City
, with the player and club waiting for Celtic to sign the documents at their end.

live_updates.title: Enciso joins Strasbourg
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Julio Enciso
has completed his move to French club
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old has joined on a permanent deal for a fee understood to be £10m.
Brighton have a sell-on clause as part of the deal.
Enciso is the second player who has left the club today after
Tariq Lamptey
joined Fiorentina.

live_updates.title: Kolo Muani in London for Spurs medical
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Randal Kolo Muani
is in London and set to undergo a medical at
Tottenham Hotspur
.
The agreement is a straight loan, with no option to buy the forward from PSG.

live_updates.title: Why have Newcastle left it so late on Isak?
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Former Aston Villa chief executive Christian Purslow:
"I can only look from the outside and apply my own experience. When you go into a summer window, you have your strategic plans – your outs and your ins.
"If Isak was a strategic plan out, it would have happened earlier and they would’ve identified the ins to replace him.
"By leaving it so late, it suggests to me that right up until recently that they might be able to persuade the player to stay, which is what I had to do with Jack Grealish.
"By leaving it this long, I think they missed out on their primary targets. They got a bit more out of Liverpool but the issue is the replacements.
"I’m not sure they’re at the level they really wanted."

live_updates.title: Merson: Guehi absolute bargain defender
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports Paul Merson:
“I think he’s a brilliant player. I really do think he’s a top centre-half - absolute class. It blows my mind that he’s still at Liverpool. He gets into everybody’s team, in my opinion.
"People might say he doesn’t get in at Arsenal at the moment because of their two centre-halves, but he’d be a great replacement. I know he’ll want to play, but in this day and age, when we’re throwing about money, £60m, £80m, £125m, he’s an absolute bargain for a top, top centre-half."

live_updates.title: West Ham in talks to sign Victor - transfer shortlist also revealed
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
West Ham
are back in talks to sign
Botafogo
goalkeeper
John Victor
,
Sky Sports News
understands.
They are understood to be discussing an initial loan that could become permanent if he manages to establish himself as their No 1.
The fee for the permanent aspect could be £6m, as West Ham look for more competition in goal following a disastrous start.
Victor is understood to be willing to make the move, despite being left
disappointed
that West Ham opted to sign
Mads Hermansen
from Leicester instead earlier in the window, and he fancies his chances of becoming their first-choice goalkeeper.
Hermansen conceded eight goals in his first two Premier League games, while
Alphonse Areola
shipped in three in the EFL Cup defeat at Wolves last night.
West Ham are looking to sign multiple players before the deadline, including more than one midfielder.
Soungoutou Magassa
was scheduled to arrive in the UK on Wednesday to undergo a medical with West Ham ahead of a £17.3m move from
Monaco
.
West Ham have also approached
Nottingham Forest
about initially loaning
Ibrahim Sangare
.
Other midfielders of interest include
Strasbourg's Junior Mwanga, Middlesbrough’s Hayden Hackney, Southampton’s Mateus Fernandes
and
Bayer Leverkusen’s Aleix Garcia.
West Ham are one of three London clubs interested in
Raheem Sterling
on loan along with
Fulham
and
Crystal Palace.
Reports claim
Everton
have bid for
Tomas Soucek,
while there could be late interest in
Lucas Paqueta
.
Marseille
are in talks over the signing of West Ham left-back
Emerson.

live_updates.title: Botafogo want higher price for Victor
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Botafogo
currently want to agree a much higher fee than the £6m
West Ham
are prepared to pay for goalkeeper
John Victor
, if the loan becomes permanent.
The discussions at the start of the month, before the Hammers signed Mads Hermansen, centred around a bigger number.
Victor has no concerns about taking the loan option, believing he will be able to establish himself as the first-choice goalkeeper. He is very motivated by the idea of a move to the Premier League.
He was the Brazilian footballer of the year last season, and was one of only two goalkeepers to keep a clean sheet against Paris Saint-Germain.
West Ham are understood to be discussing an initial loan that could become permanent if he manages to establish himself as their No 1.

live_updates.title: West Ham agree Fernandes deal
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have agreed a £42m deal with
Southampton
for
Mateus Fernandes
.
The fee is broken up into a £38m guaranteed payment plus £4m in add-ons.
A medical is already under way.
The 21-year-old Portugal youth international will be West Ham’s sixth signing of the summer.
Fernandes joined Southampton in the summer of 2024 from Sporting CP and has since made 46 appearances.

live_updates.title: Two midfielders undergoing West Ham medicals
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
Soungouto Magassa
is currently undergoing his
West Ham United
medical.
West Ham have agreed a £17.3m deal with
Monaco
fore France U21 midfielder.
Mateus Fernandes
has also been undergoing a medical today.
West Ham agreed a deal worth £42m deal with
Southampton
for the midfielder.

live_updates.title: Potter: Fernandes gives us a different dimension
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
West Ham
boss
Graham Potter
has outlined how delighted the club are to secure the services of
Mateus Fernandes
.
The Hammers will pay an initial fee of £38m plus £4m in add-ons for the 21-year-old, who has signed a five-year deal at the club.
"Mateus is a young player who has made impressive progress in the early part of his career, and we are delighted to have secured his signing," said Potter in a statement from the club.
"He gained valuable experience in the Premier League last year with Southampton and is someone we really feel can help improve us and fit into what we are trying to build and develop at the club.
"We believe that his attributes and strengths will bring a different dimension to the squad and, from speaking to him, I know that he can't wait to get started here.
"He has shown great maturity and character for someone so young, and we look forward to seeing his continued progress and impact at West Ham United."

live_updates.title: West Ham confirm Fernandes signing
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have confirmed the signing of
Mateus Fernandes
from
Southampton.
The Hammers will pay an initial fee of £38m plus £4m in add-ons for the 21-year-old, who will be available to face Nottingham Forest on Sunday, live on Sky Sports.
Speaking in a statement released by the club, Fernandes said: “I'm very happy to be here. I'm very excited to play for West Ham. I think it's a big step for me.
“It's a big club, a massive club. The project, the stadium, the city, everything.
“I want to try to play football, enjoy football, not just run and try to score, but try to play good football.
“I think the most important thing is to try to give everything every day.”

live_updates.title: West Ham's biggest problem?
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
The Radar
column this week includes stats showing the glaring lack of pace undermining
Graham Potter
at
West Ham
.

live_updates.title: West Ham sign midfielder Magassa from Monaco
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have signed midfielder
Soungoutou Magassa
from
Monaco
in a £17.3m deal.
The France U21 international, who can also play at centre-back, has joined the Hammers on a long-term contract.
He said: “West Ham is a very big club, it has a long-standing history in England, with many supporters and a very big stadium. It wasn’t complicated to say ‘yes’.
“It's a dream to play for West Ham in the Premier League. It's the best league in the world. I'm going to do everything I can to show that I'm up to the task.
“It gives me great pride to play for this club. I’m really motivated, I hope to bring freshness and youth and I'm going to give my all on the pitch.”
Magassa's arrival follows the signing of fellow midfielder Mateus Fernandes from Southampton in a £42m deal.
West Ham boss Graham Potter said: “Like Mateus Fernandes, he is a young player who has made very impressive progress right at the start of his senior career.
“He has played regularly for Monaco over the past two seasons, including in the Champions League last year, and stood up really well to that test.
“Again, he has a range of attributes and qualities that we feel will complement what we already have at the club and also help to improve us.
“Soungoutou is a determined, hungry and focused young man – we are looking forward to working with him and excited to see him continue his development with us.”

live_updates.title: West Ham do not want to sell Paqueta amid Aston Villa interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
West Ham
do not want to sell
Lucas Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline, as the midfielder started for the Hammers at Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
West Ham, however, want to keep Paqueta in their squad after a difficult start to the campaign.

live_updates.title: Paqueta silences transfer talk with goal celebration
live_updates.author: Will Denny
live_updates.text:
Lucas Paqueta appeared to end speculation over his future at West Ham with his goal celebration against Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
After scoring a penalty to make it 2-0, Paqueta mimicked throwing away a phone before pointing to and kissing the West Ham badge on his shirt.
Before the match,
Sky Sports News
reported that
West Ham
do not want to sell
Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
Paqueta played the entire match against Forest.

live_updates.title: Paqueta silences transfer talk with goal celebration
live_updates.author: Will Denny
live_updates.text:
Lucas Paqueta
appeared to end speculation over his future at West Ham with his goal celebration against Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
After scoring a penalty to make it 2-0, Paqueta mimicked throwing away a phone before pointing to and kissing the West Ham badge on his shirt.
Before the match,
Sky Sports News
reported that
West Ham
do not want to sell
Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
Paqueta played the entire match against Forest.

live_updates.title: Paqueta appears to silence talk over future
live_updates.author: Will Denny
live_updates.text:
Lucas Paqueta
appeared to end speculation over his future at West Ham with his goal celebration against Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
After scoring a penalty to make it 2-0, Paqueta mimicked throwing away a phone before pointing to and kissing the West Ham badge on his shirt.
Before the match,
Sky Sports News
reported that
West Ham
do not want to sell
Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
Paqueta played the entire match against Forest.

live_updates.title: REPORT: West Ham put torrid start behind them with incredible late show at Forest
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
West Ham stunned Nottingham Forest with three goals in seven minutes to win 3-0 at the City Ground and collect their first Premier League win of the season on
Super Sunday
.

live_updates.title: Wilson: We've stuck with the manager and he's stuck with us
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
West Ham forward Callum Wilson on Sky Sports:
"I've come here knowing that I'd have to work to get into the team.
"If you keep doing the right things and trust in the process, eventually you will get the opportunities. Then it's about taking it, and thankfully me and Summerville did that today and help the team get three points.
"I'm delighted for the boys at the back to get a clean sheet as they've had it tough for the last few weeks.
"Results determine the flak the manager has gotten, but he's been professional about it. He's been so professional about it.
"He's stuck with us, we've stuck with him. We've spoken about it internally - about if we keep doing the right things eventually, like today, we've got our rewards.
"The change of shape as well has probably given us a platform to go and attack, and today it's given us three goals."

live_updates.title: Bowen: Football is very simple when you play like that
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
West Ham captain Jarrod Bowen speaking to Sky Sports:
"It means everything. It's been a disappointing start to the season, but as I've said, it doesn't define our season.
"Just like today, we're going to enjoy it, but we don't get ahead of ourselves. So for us, we knew we could come here and do that.
"We had a feeling about us that the lads' application, the effort, every day in training. I see it every day.
"There are only so many times that you do the right things on the pitch and you get your due rewards. Today is the perfect example of that.
"We had a stat that we conceded 11 shots and conceded 11 goals [in the first three in all competitions]. That shouldn't happen.
"When that happens, we have to look at ourselves and keep the ball out of the back of the net.
"Football is very simple: keep the ball out of your net and put it in the back of the other. That's what we did today."

live_updates.title: Paqueta appears to silence talk over future
live_updates.author: Will Denny
live_updates.text:
Lucas Paqueta
appeared to end speculation over his future at West Ham with his goal celebration against Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
After scoring a penalty to make it 2-0, Paqueta mimicked throwing away a phone before pointing to and kissing the West Ham badge on his shirt.
Before the match,
Sky Sports News
reported that
West Ham
do not want to sell
Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
Paqueta played the entire match against Forest.

live_updates.title: Potter provides latest on Paqueta future
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Graham Potter
was asked about the latest on reported
Aston Villa
target
Lucas Paqueta
's future at
West Ham
, after he scored in the 3-0 win over Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
"It's external noise, that's what it is," he said.
"You can see from his performance today how committed he is, how much he cares for the team, how much he cares for his team-mates, how much he's fighting and I'm delighted for him.
"You have to deal with a lot of nonsense in this league and that's the case for every team, especially at this time of the year.
"But we're looking forward to the window shutting and everything going away a little bit."
Asked if he could see Paqueta staying at the club beyond Deadline Day, Potter said: "Yes, absolutely."

live_updates.title: Potter: We face a lot of nonsense - but quality has always been there
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
West Ham manager Graham Potter talking to Sky Sports:
"It was really pleasing for the players. You face a lot of criticism, of course, and lack of trust, lack of confidence and all that stuff, so it's nice for them to show the quality and togetherness we believe has always been there.
"There's no doubt we've had a tough couple of weeks because of results and goals have affected us too much, and then you understand where the criticism and the negativity comes from. All you can do is work and keep going, and I think the players deserve that win today.
"I can't remember Nottingham Forest having too much, to be honest. I thought we carried a threat; we weren't fantastic, but we were certainly together and compact and resilient defensively. Our substitutions helped us.
"The whole team has been together. You face a lot of nonsense because that's the world we're in, but the team has been fantastic to work with; great togetherness, great connection and I'm delighted they get the three points."

live_updates.title: Potter: We face a lot of nonsense - but quality has always been there
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
West Ham manager Graham Potter talking to Sky Sports:
"It was really pleasing for the players. You face a lot of criticism, of course, and lack of trust, lack of confidence and all that stuff, so it's nice for them to show the quality and togetherness we believe has always been there.
"Before the game there was negativity everywhere. You only have to look at the results and the easy conclusion is we're all bad and it isn't quite as simple as that. But we have to prove it and we have to show it.
"There's no doubt we've had a tough couple of weeks because of results and goals have affected us too much, and then you understand where the criticism and the negativity comes from. All you can do is work and keep going, and I think the players deserve that win today.
"I can't remember Nottingham Forest having too much, to be honest. I thought we carried a threat; we weren't fantastic, but we were certainly together and compact and resilient defensively. Our substitutions helped us.
"The whole team has been together. You face a lot of nonsense because that's the world we're in, but the team has been fantastic to work with; great togetherness, great connection and I'm delighted they get the three points."

live_updates.title: West Ham express interest in Cresswell
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Christopher Reidy:
West Ham
have expressed interest in
Toulouse
defender
Charlie Cresswell.
No offer yet for the centre-back but he is being lined up as a potential signing if
Nayef Aguerd
leaves the club.

live_updates.title: Cresswell in, Aguerd out at West Ham?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy and Lyall Thomas:
West Ham
are looking to bring in
Toulouse
defender
Charlie Cresswell
on
Deadline Day
.
That is because Hammers centre-back
Nayef Aguerd
has been given permission to speak to
Marseille
and undergo a medical.
The deal for Aguerd is understood to be a permanent deal.

live_updates.title: Emerson set for Marseille deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
West Ham
full-back
Emerson Palmieri
is close to completing a permanent a move to
Marseille
on Deadline Day.
Palmieri is scheduled to have a medical this morning after the clubs agreed a deal.

live_updates.title: West Ham working to sign Arrey-Mbi
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Germany:
West Ham
are working on a Deadline Day deal to sign Germany U21 defender
Bright Arrey-Mbi
from
Braga
.
The 22-year-old was on the books at Chelsea and Bayern Munich as a youth player.

live_updates.title: Robinson in talks to join Livingston
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
West Ham's
21-year-old defender
Junior Robinson
is in talks to complete a loan move to
Livingston
.

live_updates.title: Paqueta starts for West Ham amid Villa interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
target
Lucas Paqueta
starts for
West Ham
at
Nottingham Forest
.
Sky Sports News
reported this morning that West Ham do not want to sell the Brazil international to Aston Villa, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
The Hammers, however, want to keep the midfielder in their squad after a difficult start to the campaign.

live_updates.title: Olympiakos in talks to sign Bournemouth striker Silcott-Duberry
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Mark McAdam:
Olympiakos
are in talks with
Bournemouth
over a possible deal for
Zain Silcott-Duberry
.
The deal under discussion is a permanent move for the striker who joined Bournemouth in January this year.
The 20-year-old made one Premier League appearance last season.
Other teams from Europe have shown an interest in the player as well.

live_updates.title: Akanji and Ederson on Man City bench amid transfer interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manuel Akanji
is on the bench for
Manchester City
against Brighton, live on
Sky Sports
.
The defender has been the subject of interest from
Galatasaray
and
AC Milan
.
Sky in Italy
are reporting that Milan received little encouragement that he wanted to join and appear to have moved on.
The Switzerland international was not in the squad for the defeat to Spurs last weekend.
Goalkeeper
James Trafford
retains his starting spot ahead of
Ederson
, who is on the bench and is a
Galatasaray
target.

live_updates.title: 'Chelsea not playing poker with Bayern over Jackson'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Talks are going on right now between
Chelsea
and
Bayern Munich
about
Nicolas Jackson
.
Chelsea’s position is clear: Jackson is a Chelsea player, so if you want him, then buy him.
This is not a bluff; Chelsea are not playing poker.
Even if Bayern were to agree to sign Jackson, Chelsea would still have to sign a replacement - but there are hardly any strikers available on loan anymore.
Chelsea believe the loan agreement has now been totally revoked.
If Bayern believe in Jackson, they have to buy him.

live_updates.title: Leverkusen defender Hincapie travelling to London for Arsenal medical
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayer Leverkusen
defender
Piero Hincapie
is travelling to London ahead of undergoing a medical with
Arsenal
.
The two clubs have agreed a season-long loan deal which includes an option to buy.
Including the loan fee, the total package is worth £45m if Arsenal sign the 23-year-old permanently.
The Ecuador international has agreed a five-year contract at Arsenal if the option is triggered.

live_updates.title: Fulham remain in talks for AC Milan winger Chukwueze
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
still want to sign a second winger after
Kevin
and remain in talks for AC Milan’s
Samuel Chukwueze
.
The 26-year-old is a long-term target, and Fulham made offers for the Nigeria international in January.
Fulham also admire
Dilane Bakwa
– a player
Nottingham Forest
are in talks for – but Chukwueze is thought to be the priority.
Fulham have also been interested in
Arsenal
winger
Reiss Nelson
, who also remains a target for
Crystal Palace
, and potentially
Chelsea
forward
Raheem Sterling
on loan.

live_updates.title: Paris FC join race to sign Forest's Jota Silva
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Italy's Luca Bendoni:
Newly-promoted Ligue 1 side
Paris FC
have also joined the race for
Nottingham Forest
winger
Jota Silva
.
Sporting
also remain in talks, and the clubs are looking for a loan with an option to buy.
Forest, however, would prefer to sell Jota outright.

live_updates.title: Forest set for busy Deadline Day
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui from the City Ground:
It’ll be a busy day of departures at
Nottingham Forest
on Deadline Day tomorrow.
Jota Silva
and
Taiwo Anwoniyi
are not included in the matchday squad against West Ham, with Silva in talks with two clubs about a move away.
Omar Richards, Josh Bowler, Eric da Silva Moreira
and
Zach Abbott
are also expected to leave either temporarily or permanently.
As for
West Ham
,
Maxwel Cornet
is not in the squad at the City Ground and is the only senior player who could leave despite interest in playmaker
Lucas Paqueta
, who starts against Forest.

live_updates.title: Ex-Man Utd boss Ten Hag's Leverkusen future already under threat
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
There is a chance ex-
Manchester United
boss
Erik ten Hag
could lose his job already at
Bayer Leverkusen
.
Sky in Germany
are reporting that Leverkusen’s management are meeting to discuss whether Ten Hag will be able to build a team following their transfer business.
Sky in Germany
report that a decision is not expected before Deadline Day, but a quick parting of the ways is quite possible at the beginning of the new week.
The Dutchman has been accused internally of lacking a clear, game-planning approach and of bringing too little structure to his game.
Furthermore, the team is reporting that his pre-match communication and presentations are poor. For example, he didn't even give a proper motivational speech before the home defeat to Hoffenheim – much to the team's surprise.
If Ten Hag was to be sacked by Bayer Leverkusen, he would become the third ex-Man Utd boss to lose his job recently, following the dismissals of
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
– who lost his job at Besiktas three days ago – and
Jose Mourinho
, who left Fenerbahce on Friday.

live_updates.title: Man Utd attacker Williams joins Falkirk on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Scottish Premiership side
Falkirk
have completed the season-long loan signing of attacker
Ethan Williams
from
Manchester United.

live_updates.title: Leicester want to sign Palace winger Rak-Sakyi on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
want to sign
Jesurun Rak-Sakyi
on loan from
Crystal Palace
before the deadline.
Palace are reluctant to let the winger go without a replacement.
The 22-year-old has two years left on his contract at Palace.

live_updates.title: Celtic striker Idah in Wales as he closes in on £7m move to Swansea
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
striker
Adam Idah
is in Wales under going the second part of his medical ahead of a £7m move to
Swansea City
.
The Republic of Ireland international travelled last night and was not in Celtic’s squad for their 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox.
Idah is expected to finalise his move, with Celtic making continued progress in talks for
Anderlecht
forward
Kasper Dolberg
.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic and Swansea have agreed an initial fee of £6m, plus more than £1m in add-ons.
Idah completed the first part of his medical with Swansea on Friday and agreed personal terms.
He was then called back by Celtic after the Hoops struggled to reach an agreement for Dolberg by close of play that day.
Celtic are looking to sign two strikers before tomorrow’s 11pm deadline in Scotland.

live_updates.title: Hojlund completes Napoli medical ahead of move from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Sky in Italy:
Rasmus Hojlund
has completed his medical ahead of his move from
Manchester United
to
Napoli
.
The deal is a loan plus a conditional obligation worth £43m (€50m).

live_updates.title: Talks still open between Betis and Man Utd over Antony deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Real Betis
and
Manchester United
over the signing of
Antony
.
A deal was agreed on Friday – only for Betis to pull out, stating they could not afford it on the current terms.
Willingness from all parties to complete the move and still a cautious optimism that a deal can be struck.
The impasse centres on how Antony’s compensation for the remaining two years of his contract is paid.
The move might also require Antony to compromise on his personal terms, something United feel he should be able to do given he has rebuffed a number of offers in favour of a return to Betis.

live_updates.title: Lammens and Martinez keen on joining Man Utd as club weigh up goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Rob Dorsett:
Internal discussions continue at
Manchester United
over their next steps regarding signing a goalkeeper.
It is understood
Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
and
Aston Villa’s
Emiliano Martinez
are both keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez has had offers but is thought he is waiting on United.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that United have explored the conditions of a deal for the World Cup winner.
Talks continue with Royal Antwerp over Lammens.
Galatasaray are also pushing, and United will not get drawn into a bidding war.
Both potential deals are thought to be complicated given the time left in the window, and there is still a chance United will not sign a keeper before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Mainz make improved £3m offer for Sturm Graz's Boving
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Mainz
have made an improved offer of £3m for
Sturm Graz
forward
William Boving
.
It is understood negotiations are progressing well, but they could face late competition from Girona and other Bundesliga clubs.
A number of English Championship clubs have been interested in Boving but are yet to make an offer.

live_updates.title: Martin confirms likely Dessers departure
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Rangers boss Russell Martin to Sky Sports on transfers after
drawing with Celtic in the Old Firm:
"We're close to a couple [of new players].
"I also think Cyriel [Dessers] has probably played his last game for the club and he's been great the whole time he's been here so he goes with everyone's best wishes.
"It's good business for us and for him, with the stage he's at in his career.
"Things can change, but it looks likely and we'll have two new guys in the building so let's see what happens outside of that."
On Nico Raskin:
"I don't know what's going to happen over the next 24 hours with the rest of our guys. I just want to focus on the team."

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed in talks to sign Man Utd teenager Amass on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vik Varange and Dharmesh Sheth:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with M
anchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a straight season-long loan as Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Lammens and Martinez keen on joining Man Utd as club weigh up goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Rob Dorsett:
Internal discussions continue at
Manchester United
over their next steps regarding signing a goalkeeper.
It is understood
Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
and
Aston Villa’s
Emiliano Martinez
are both keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez has had offers but it is thought he is waiting on United.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that United have explored the conditions of a deal for the World Cup winner.
Talks continue with Royal Antwerp over Lammens.
Galatasaray are also pushing, and United will not get drawn into a bidding war.
Both potential deals are thought to be complicated given the time left in the window, and there is still a chance United will not sign a keeper before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Derby agree deal to sign Brereton Diaz from Saints
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Derby County
have agreed a deal with
Southampton
to take striker
Ben Brereton Diaz
on a season-long loan.
He has passed his medical and should be confirmed as a Derby player in the next 24 hours.

live_updates.title: Aberdeen teen Boyd completes Aston Villa medical ahead of £1m move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Aberdeen
attacking midfielder
Fletcher Boyd
has completed a medical ahead of a £1m move to
Aston Villa
.
It is understood that the 17-year-old has agreed terms on a three-year contract with the Premier League club.
Sky Sports News
revealed earlier today that the clubs had agreed a £1m deal, plus add-ons – including a significant sell-on clause.

live_updates.title: Bristol City reject Wrexham's £2m bid for Vyner
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Anthony Joseph:
Bristol City
have rejected a second bid of £2m from
Wrexham
for centre-back
Zak Vyner
.
It is understood
Bristol City
deem him as an integral part of their team and someone they cannot lose, despite entering the last 12 months of his contract.
Talks are ongoing between the clubs.

live_updates.title: Rangers close to signing Everton striker Chermiti
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sahil Jaidka:
Rangers
are closing in on a deal to sign
Everton
striker
Youssef Chermiti
.
On Thursday,
Sky Sports News
reported Rangers had made contact over a loan move, with Everton boss
David Moyes
confirming the next day that a loan exit was likely.
However, it is understood that the Ibrox club are now hopeful of a permanent deal ahead of Monday’s 11pm deadline for Scottish clubs.
It is thought that Rangers would pay an initial £8m for the player, plus potential add-ons.
Chermiti is well known by Ibrox sporting director Kevin Thelwell, who helped sign him for the Premier League club in 2023 from Sporting Lisbon in a deal worth up to £15m.
The 21-year-old has been impacted by various injuries and made just 24 appearances for Everton, but is yet to score and is on the search for regular game time.
Russell Martin said he is “hopeful of concluding” a deal for the striker.

live_updates.title: Dessers to leave Rangers before window closes
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Cyriel Dessers
is set to leave
Rangers
after two years at Ibrox.
Head coach
Russell Martin
said his substitute appearance against Celtic was likely to be his “last game for the club”.
The 30-year-old has scored 52 goals in 116 games during his two years at Ibrox.
AEK
Athens
had a bid rejected earlier this summer for Dessers, with Greek rivals
Panathinaikos
now leading the race to sign the player in a deal worth around £4.3m.

live_updates.title: Dessers to leave Rangers before window closes
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Cyriel Dessers
is set to leave
Rangers
after two years at Ibrox.
Head coach
Russell Martin
said his substitute appearance against Celtic was likely to be his “last game for the club”.
The 30-year-old has scored 52 goals in 116 games during his two years at Ibrox.
AEK Athens had a bid rejected earlier this summer for Dessers, and now face competition from Greek rivals Panathinaikos who are in the race to sign the player in a deal worth around £3.7m (€4.3m).

live_updates.title: Rodgers: Hopefully we can get some creativity in the squad in next 24 hours
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Celtic boss Brendan Rodgers to Sky Sports after drawing 0-0 against Rangers:
"I look back to 12 months ago and we were really fast and dynamic and I hope in the next 24 hours we can get the support to the squad that can give us the opportunity to give us that again.
"It's not disrespectful to the guys here because they need it. Any team needs that.
"We have a lot of work to do but we need the competition in the squad and creativity to take the game to the level we want to."
When asked if the club will be busy on Deadline Day, Rodgers said:
"It's clearly the plan to be. We want to pad out the squad with more quality, more speed and more creativity. Hopefully we can do that.
"There's a number of areas we need to freshen up."

live_updates.title: Celtic target Tounekti playing for Hammarby as talks continue over move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
target
Sebastian Tounekti
is playing for
Hammarby
today against
Osters IF
.
Sky Sports News
understands the Swedish club knocked back an improved offer worth £4.7m from the Scottish champions.
Celtic’s second offer included an initial fee of £3.9m, with £800,000 in add-ons.
Hammarby are looking for around £5m for the Tunisia international, or they won’t consider selling the player.
Talks are ongoing.

live_updates.title: West Ham's Paqueta silences transfer talk with goal celebration
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Lucas Paqueta
appeared to end speculation over his future at West Ham with his goal celebration against Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
After scoring a penalty to make it 2-0, Paqueta mimicked throwing away a phone before pointing to and kissing the West Ham badge on his shirt.
Before the match,
Sky Sports News
reported that
West Ham
do not want to sell
Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
Paqueta played the entire match against Forest.

live_updates.title: Birmingham wait on Celtic green light to move for Yang
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Birmingham City
are waiting on
Celtic
to green-light a move for winger
Hyunjun Yang
.
It’s understood negotiations over the weekend have brought the initial fee to around £3m, with add-ons still to be ironed out.
If the move gets sanctioned, Yang could travel to Birmingham on Sunday night to undergo a medical.
The South Korea international was an unused substitute in Celtic's 0-0 draw with Rangers at Ibrox today.

live_updates.title: Celtic target Dolberg on Anderlecht bench
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
target
Kasper Dolberg
not named in the
Anderlecht
starting line-up for their game against Union Saint-Gilloise on Sunday.
Sky Sports News
understands Celtic are making continued progress in talks for the Denmark international.
Dolberg is Anderlecht’s main striker and has scored five goals in eight games already this season.

live_updates.title: Wrexham agree deal to sign Coventry's Sheaf
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett, Anthony Joseph and Zinny Boswell:
Wrexham
have agreed a £6.5m deal to sign
Coventry City
defensive midfielder
Ben Sheaf
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old is due to undergo a medical on Monday.
Sheaf has one year left on his Coventry contract.

live_updates.title: Potter provides latest on Paqueta future
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Graham Potter
was asked about the latest on reported
Aston Villa
target
Lucas Paqueta
's future at
West Ham
, after he scored in the 3-0 win over Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
"It's external noise, that's what it is," he said.
"You can see from his performance today how committed he is, how much he cares for the team, how much he cares for his team-mates, how much he's fighting and I'm delighted for him.
"You have to deal with a lot of nonsense in this league and that's the case for every team, especially at this time of the year.
"But we're looking forward to the window shutting and everything going away a little bit."
Asked if he could see Paqueta staying at the club beyond Deadline Day, Potter said: "Yes, absolutely."

live_updates.title: Wrexham agree deal to sign Coventry's Sheaf
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett, Anthony Joseph and Zinny Boswell:
Wrexham
have agreed a £6.5m deal to sign
Coventry City
defensive midfielder
Ben Sheaf
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old is due to undergo a medical on Monday.
Sheaf has one year left on his Coventry contract.

live_updates.title: Martinez left out of Villa squad amid Man Utd transfer links
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Goalkeeper
Emi Martínez
has been left out of
Aston Villa
's squad to take on
Crystal Palace
, live on Sky Sports Super Sunday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Sunday that the 32-year-old is keen on a move to Manchester United and is thought to be waiting on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez started Villa's last game in the Premier League, a 1-0 defeat to Brentford. Marco Bizot replaced Martinez in the starting line-up.
Aston Villa team in full:
Bizot, Cash, Konsa, Mings, Maatsen, McGinn, Tielemans, Malen, Guessand, Rogers, Watkins.
Subs:
Proctor, Digne, Buendia, Torres, Bogarde, Rowe, Jimoh-Aloba.
Follow live updates as Villa host Palace on
Super Sunday
.

live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:

Sky Sports app
to make sure you don't miss a thing!
