live_updates.title: Spurs to sign a forward on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
chairman
Daniel Levy
loves a Deadline Day deal and Spurs fans will be hoping for a late rabbit out of the hat.
Sky Sports News
have reported that signing a left-winger is still a target for Tottenham.
There have been reports this morning that Spurs have enquired over a move for
Paris Saint-Germain
forward
Randal Kolo Muani
.
Atalanta
winger
Ademola Lookman
has been another name linked with a move to the north London club.
Spurs are sure to be a club to watch today.

live_updates.title: Newcastle remain in talks with Brentford over Wissa deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Newcastle
and
Brentford
over
Yoane Wissa
.
That has been the case for a number of weeks, but as it stands, the forward looks to be staying.
That is because Brentford have been adamant throughout this saga that they need to replace him before letting him go.
They have been unable to agree a deal with
Borussia Dortmund
for
Max Beier,
and the club are assessing other targets on Deadline Day.
The Bees also need his valuation to be met. Newcastle are aware of one, but Sky Sports News understands it is not the £65m reported elsewhere.
Wissa released a bullish statement yesterday demanding to leave.

live_updates.title: Vieira and Lokonga likely to join Hamburg
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Green:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira
is now likely to join
Hamburg
on a season-long loan.
There have been talks involving Vieira with
Stuttgart
throughout the window, but they moved to a different target.
Negotiations between the two clubs continue today.
Albert Sambi Lokonga
is also likely to head to
Hamburg
, but on a permanent basis.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set to join Marseille on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Matt O’Riley
is understood to be travelling to France this morning for a medical with
Marseille
.
The 24-year-old is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to buy.
The Denmark international was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: Burnley set to sign midfielder Luis from Benfica
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Florentino Luis
is having medical in Manchester this morning ahead of loan move from
Benfica to Burnley.
All the other details on the move have been agreed for the Portugal midfielder.
Burnley are now focusing on outgoings this Deadline Day.

live_updates.title: Could Guehi remain at Crystal Palace?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News'
Mark McAdam analyses whether
Marc Guehi
could stay at
Crystal Palace
amid interest from
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Leicester in talks to sign Feyenoord's Carranza with El Khannouss set for Stuttgart move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester City
are in talks with
Feyenoord
over a possible deal for striker
Julian Carranza
.
With
Bilal El Khannouss
travelling to Germany this morning to undergo a medical with Stuttgart ahead of his loan and obligation to buy for £26m, Leicester have the funds to improve the squad elsewhere, with a striker their priority.
Carranza is one of their top targets and the deal being discussed is a loan with an option to buy.
Leicester also retain an interest in
Millwall
striker
Mihailo Ivanovic
, but they are reluctant to meet Millwall’s valuation, which is thought to be £10m up front with £2m of add-ons.

live_updates.title: Cresswell in, Aguerd out at West Ham?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy and Lyall Thomas:
West Ham
are looking to bring in
Toulouse
defender
Charlie Cresswell
on
Deadline Day
.
That is because Hammers centre-back
Nayef Aguerd
has been given permission to speak to
Marseille
and undergo a medical.
The deal for Aguerd is understood to be a permanent deal.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree £21.7m deal to sell Antony to Real Betis
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan and Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
forward
Antony
is expected to travel to Spain for a medical with
Real Betis
.
An agreement has been reached between the clubs for his permanent sale for a total of £21.7m (€25m).
The figure is broken up into an initial £19m (€22m) payment plus £4.3m in add-ons.
There is also a 50 per cent net sell-on in the deal.
There are not expected to be any further issues regarding player compensation and personal terms.
A slight restructure from Friday’s initial agreement has been made.
Antony is understood to be taking a pay cut to join the LaLiga side.
Antony cost Manchester United £86m from Ajax in 2022, so it will be a £64.3m loss on the winger.

live_updates.title: Man City reach agreement to sign Donnarumma - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Sky in Italy
are reporting that
Manchester City
have reached an agreement to sign
Paris Saint-Germain
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
.
It is claimed all parties are now finalising a deal for the 26-year-old to join Pep Guardiola's side.

live_updates.title: Jimenez completes Bournemouth medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
AC Milan
defender
Alex Jimenez
has completed his
Bournemouth
medical.
The defender is joining on an initial loan with an obligation to buy him.
The Premier League are expected to announce the full-back's transfer this morning.

live_updates.title: Man City reach agreement to sign Donnarumma - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Sky in Italy
are reporting that
Manchester City
have reached an agreement to sign
Paris Saint-Germain
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
.
It is claimed all parties are now finalising a deal for the 26-year-old to join Pep Guardiola's side.
Sky Sports News
reported earlier this morning that talks are ongoing between Man City and
Fenerbahce
over Ederson joining the Turkish side.
The Brazil international can only leave the club if Man City manage to complete a deal for Donnarumma.

live_updates.title: Getafe's Uche arrives in UK for Premier League move
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Getafe
forward
Christantus Uche
has arrived in the UK to secure a Premier League move.
Three Premier League clubs remain interested: they are understood to be
Aston Villa, Crystal Palace
and
Sunderland
.
Leeds
and
Wolves
were interested earlier in the window but moved onto other targets.
The 22-year-old Nigeria international has already scored and assisted in three LaLiga games this season.

live_updates.title: Sunderland agree deals for Geertruida and Brobbey
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Sunderland
have agreed a deal with
RB Leipzig
for right-back
Lutsharel Geertruida
.
It is a loan with an option to buy him permanently.
Geertruida is landing in the UK imminently.
Sunderland are also in talks with
Ajax
over striker
Brian Brobbey
.
Sunderland need a striker after
Marc Guiu
was recalled by Chelsea.

live_updates.title: Sunderland agree deals for Geertruida and Brobbey
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Sunderland
have agreed a deal with
RB Leipzig
for right-back
Lutsharel Geertruida
.
It is a loan with an option to buy him permanently.
Geertruida is landing in the UK imminently.
Sunderland are also in talks with
Ajax
over striker
Brian Brobbey
.
Sunderland need a striker after
Marc Guiu
was recalled by
Chelsea
.

live_updates.title: Cardiff hopeful of signing Kellyman on loan from Chelsea
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Cardiff City
are hopeful of signing
Omari Kellyman
on a season-long loan from
Chelsea
.
The clubs are in talks over a Deadline Day deal for the 19-year-old.

live_updates.title: West Ham's Palmieri close to Marseille move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
West Ham
full-back
Emerson Palmieri
is close to completing a permanent move to
Marseille
.
The Italy international is scheduled to have a medical this morning after the clubs agreed a deal.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa in Sancho loan talks
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of
Jadon Sancho
.
The discussions over a loan deal.
Villa are also in dialogue with Sancho's camp over personal terms.
There is no agreement yet on either, but Villa are working to get a deal struck before tonight's 7pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa in Sancho loan talks
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of
Jadon Sancho
.
The discussions are over a loan deal for the winger.
Villa are also in dialogue with Sancho's camp over personal terms.
There is no agreement yet on either, but Villa are working to get a deal struck before tonight's 7pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Man City closing in on signing PSG goalkeeper Donnarumma
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth, Lyall Thomas and Kaveh Solhekol:
Manchester City
are closing in on the signing of
Paris Saint-Germain
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
.
City are increasingly confident of agreeing a deal with the 26-year-old.
Sources have told us the framework of a deal between the clubs has been agreed in principle.
There is still work to do, however, and anything can happen on Deadline Day.
Meanwhile,
Fenerbahce
are getting closer to agreeing a deal to sign City goalkeeper
Ederson
.
Only if City secure Donnarumma will they allow Ederson to leave.

live_updates.title: Man Utd in talks over potential goalkeeper signing with Martinez and Lammens targets
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
are in talks over two goalkeepers on Deadline Day.
They are keeping potential deals with
Aston Villa
shot-stopper
Emiliano Martinez
and
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens
warm before deciding which one to go for - if they end up signing one at all.
There is still a chance United will have the same goalkeeping department as they do now.
Both Martinez and Lammens want to join Ruben Amorim's side, but any deal would have to be right.
Both goalkeepers were left out of their respective squads over the weekend.

live_updates.title: Man Utd defender Malacia faces race to depart
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
left-back
Tyrell Malacia
faces a race against time to seal a Deadline Day move.
Elche
remain interested, with United waiting for a suitable offer from the LaLiga side.
Other clubs are interested in the 26-year-old.

live_updates.title: Millwall closing in on signing winger Ballo
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Peter Smith:
Millwall
are closing in on the signing of
Wolfsberger AC
winger
Thierno Ballo
.
It is understood that the clubs have agreed a loan deal, with an option to buy.
Ballo is due to undergo a medical today.

live_updates.title: Man Utd in talks over potential goalkeeper signing with Martinez and Lammens targets
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
are in talks over two goalkeepers on Deadline Day.
They are keeping potential deals with
Aston Villa
shot-stopper
Emiliano Martinez
and
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens
warm before deciding which one to go for - if they end up signing one at all.
There is still a chance United will have the same goalkeeping department as they do now.
Both Martinez and Lammens want to join Ruben Amorim's side, but any deal would have to be right.
Both goalkeepers were left out of their respective squads over the weekend.

live_updates.title: Edouard told to find another club
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lawrie-Anne Brown and James Savundra:
Crystal Palace
striker
Odsonne Edouard
is believed to be heading to French club
Lens
.
He was not in the Palace squad at Aston Villa on Sunday and has been told he can find another club.

live_updates.title: Sunderland win race for Geetruidam
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Sunderland
have won the race for RB Leipzig's
Lutsharel Geetruidam,
despite competition from Marseille.
The French club are playing in the Champions League this season.
The deal is a loan with an option to buy permanently.
Geertruida is currently landing in the UK to complete the move.

live_updates.title: Sunderland win race for Geertruida
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Sunderland
have won the race for RB Leipzig's
Lutsharel Geertruida,

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Brighton
have announced right-back
Tariq Lamptey
has joined Fiorentina on a permanent deal.
The 24-year-old is moving to Serie A in a deal worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Sky Sports News
reported on Saturday that an agreement had been reached between the two clubs.
Lamptey signed a one-year contract extension at Brighton in June but selling the player now means the Premier League club will receive a fee, instead of losing him for nothing.

to

.

Alex Jimenez

The full-back joins on an initial loan with an obligation to buy.
The Cherries have lost three of last year's starting back four in this summer's transfer window.

live_updates.title: 'Newcastle agree £55m deal to sign Brentford's Wissa'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a £55m deal to sign
Brentford
forward
Yoane Wissa

Fabrizio Romano.
It is claimed Wissa is now set for his Magpies medical.
The reported breakthrough comes after Newcastle agreed to sell
Alexander Isak
to
Liverpool
in a British-record £125m.

live_updates.text:

Everton
are working on the signing of Freiburg attacking midfielder
Merlin Rohl
.
Sky Sports News

live_updates.title: 'Donnarumma leaving PSG with best wishes'
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol:
PSG
are sticking to their word to make sure
Gianluigi Donnarumma
gets the move he wants to leave the club in a respectful way - even though they were unable to agree a new contract with him.
He is leaving with the best wishes of everyone at PSG and he recently had an emotional goodbye meeting with club president Naser Al-Khelaifi.
Manchester City is the best option for him and it has just been a matter of negotiating a deal and waiting for Ederson’s future to be resolved.
Donnarumma’s departure will mark the end of the so-called Galactico era. PSG now have a policy of signing younger players on lower base wages.
Donnarumma, like
Milan Skriniar
and
Marco Asensio
, arrived at PSG as free agents.
PSG are making profit on all three this summer.

live_updates.title: Winterburn joins Barnet on loan
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Bournemouth's
Ben Winterburn
has joined Barnet on a season-long loan.
The League Two side won the race for his signature as they could offer first-team opportunities.
Other fourth-tier sides were interested along with a club from the Scottish Premiership.

live_updates.text:

are growing increasingly optimistic of signing
Brentford
forward
Yoane Wissa
today.
The two clubs are now locked in talks and getting closer to an agreement.
The discussions are centring around a fee in the region of £50m, with the final details being discussed.

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter

have agreed a £55m deal with
Brentford
for forward

.

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
The agreement is understood to be initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.
Brentford were adamant throughout this window that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected this summer, before Wissa released a
bombshell statement
on Sunday demanding to be sold before Monday's deadline.

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter

have agreed a deal with

for

The agreement is a straight loan.
It’s understood Villa will pay a loan fee, and pay 80 per cent of the player's wages.
Sancho’s has entered the final year of his Old Trafford contract.
United have the option to extend for a further 12 months.

The agreement is understood to be an initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.

Wissa and his representatives are in London awaiting final permission to travel to the North East for a medical.

Personal terms have already been agreed in principle.

The arrival of Isak at Liverpool has opened up a potential departure for Elliott.
Elliott has been linked with RB Leipzig this summer but they are way off on their valuation of the player.

live_updates.title: Bayer Leverkusen confirm Ten Hag departure
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Bayer Leverkusen

Erik ten Hag
.
He was in charge of two Bundesliga matches before losing his job.
In an official statement, the German club said: "Bayer 04 has parted ways with head coach Erik ten Hag with immediate effect.
"The assistant coaching staff will temporarily take over training duties."

live_updates.title: Rohl remains in talks with Everton
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Alan Myers:
Freiburg midfielder
Merlin Rohl
flew into Liverpoolairport this morning and is in talks with
Everton
.
Manager David Moyes wants a central-midfielder and interest in Rohl has been ongoing since last January.
There is still work to do to make it happen before the 7pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Bayern back in talks over Chelsea's Jackson
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayern Munich
are back in talks with
Chelsea
to try and sign
Nicolas Jackson
.
Jackson and his representatives are still in Munich and the player has not given up on a move to Bayern.
Talks are understood to be ongoing between all parties over resurrecting the deal.
Jackson has his heart set on the move and his camp are doing all they can to make it happen.
He does not have to come back to the UK as things stand as he is due to link up with Senegal this week for international duty.

live_updates.title: Gomez to AC Milan riding on potential Guehi deal
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Exclusive from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Vinny O'Connor:
Liverpool
have received an offer from
AC Milan
for
Joe Gomez
in what would be a substantive move to Serie A - but it now looks unlikely the deal can be completed in time for tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Liverpool will categorically not allow Gomez to leave, unless they have
Marc Guehi
or another top level centre back in.
Arne Slot
is keen to to have BOTH Guehi and Gomez in his ranks once the deadline passes.
Milan’s owners, Red Bird Capital, also have a stake in Fenway Sports Group, who own Liverpool, and the two sides talked late into last night before thrashing out terms on Gomez moving to Italy.
Separately, we are told Milan held talks with Gomez’s representatives and were close to agreeing a deal before the plug was pulled.
The deal was entirely dependent on Liverpool completing a deal for Guehi to move to Anfield from Crystal Palace - and whilst that transfer is still active, both sides feel there isn’t enough time to complete the necessary logistics to do the Gomez move after Guehi.
Gomez was poised to fly to Italy, but Liverpool haven’t given him permission to do so.

live_updates.title: West Ham working to sign Arrey-Mbi
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Germany:
West Ham
are working on a Deadline Day deal to sign Germany U21 defender
Bright Arrey-Mbi
from Braga.
The 22-year-old was on the books at Chelsea and Bayern Munich as a youth player.

live_updates.title: Forest close to completing £34.7m deal for Strasbourg winger Bakwa
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Nottingham Forest
are close to completing a deal for
Strasbourg
winger
Dilane Bakwa
, who has been a long-term target.
The fee being discussed is worth over £34.7m (€40m) and S
ky Sports News
has been told Forest are confident of getting the transfer over the line before tonight's 7pm deadline.
Bakwa’s performances in Ligue 1 have attracted the attention of a number of clubs in the Premier League and Europe, but Forest look to have beaten off the competition for a player who has been a priority target.
The 23-year-old scored six goals and contributed nine assists last season, in helping Strasbourg qualify for Europe.

live_updates.title: Donnarumma in, Ederson out?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala:
"Well, what a move this would be for Manchester City. On the surface, bringing in one of the best goalkeepers in the world would be a boost for any club.
"At City, though, it raises several questions. We understand it would allow Ederson to move on, with Fenerbahçe emerging as a strong possibility. But what would this mean for James Trafford?
"Learning from Donnarumma would benefit any goalkeeper. At just 26, the Italian already has a decade of first-team experience, and still has many years ahead of him.
"Trafford, who returned to City for £31m in the summer, could make his England debut during the international break. However, he has endured a mixed start, with costly mistakes in the defeat to Spurs and in the loss at Brighton on Sunday.
"Ederson, now in his ninth season at the club, looks likely to leave. But how would Donnarumma fit into Pep Guardiola’s system? We saw with Joe Hart’s replacement by Claudio Bravo that Guardiola prefers ball-playing goalkeepers. Donnarumma doesn’t quite fit that mould. He has also faced criticism for struggling with crosses and set pieces. On those fronts, could Trafford be the better option?
Still, it would be hard for City to turn down the chance to sign a Champions League winner, no matter what the repercussions might be."

live_updates.title: Donnarumma In, Ederson Out?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala:
"Well, what a move this would be for Manchester City. On the surface, bringing in one of the best goalkeepers in the world would be a boost for any club.
"At City, though, it raises several questions. We understand it would allow Ederson to move on, with Fenerbahçe emerging as a strong possibility. But what would this mean for James Trafford?
"Learning from Donnarumma would benefit any goalkeeper. At just 26, the Italian already has a decade of first-team experience, and still has many years ahead of him.
"Trafford, who returned to City for £31m in the summer, could make his England debut during the international break. However, he has endured a mixed start, with costly mistakes in the defeat to Spurs and in the loss at Brighton on Sunday.
"Ederson, now in his ninth season at the club, looks likely to leave. But how would Donnarumma fit into Pep Guardiola’s system? We saw with Joe Hart’s replacement by Claudio Bravo that Guardiola prefers ball-playing goalkeepers. Donnarumma doesn’t quite fit that mould. He has also faced criticism for struggling with crosses and set pieces. On those fronts, could Trafford be the better option?
Still, it would be hard for City to turn down the chance to sign a Champions League winner, no matter what the repercussions might be."

live_updates.title: Isak to join up with Sweden camp once Liverpool medical complete
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Gary Cotterill in Sweden:
Sweden head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed
Alexander Isak
is in the UK to complete his transfer to
Liverpool
, but will link up with the national team later today.
“I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today. He is extremely professional and has a good mentality."
Asked whether the forward's head is in the right place to play, he added: "He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries
“He’s not able to play for 90 minutes, but he can be a game-changer.”
Tomasson says Isak won’t arrive in time for training this afternoon.
It’s likely he will arrive this evening.

have an agreement in principle to send

The 23-year-old forward is travelling to Luton for a medical.

Newcastle have agreed a deal worth up to £55m to sign Brentford forward

Everton
striker

live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra:

Crystal Palace

One source has told

The club are currently tying up deals to bring central defenders
Jaydee Canvot
and
Igor Jesus

However, signing the pair does not mean that Guehi will definitely depart Palace today.
Palace are reluctant to sell their club captain but losing Guehi for free would be a bitter pill to swallow.
He has entered the final year of his deal at Selhurst Park.

He has been given permission to have a medical.

live_updates.title: Palace beat PL competition to Uche signing
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra and Rob Dorsett:
Crystal Palace
look to have beaten competition from a number of other Premier League clubs - including Aston Villa and Sunderland - to land the highly rated Getafe forward
Christantus Uche
.
Sky Sports News
has been told there is broad agreement over a fee between the two clubs, believed to be worth over £17.3m (€20m).
Uche has now arrived at Palace’s training ground, where he is currently undergoing a medical.
The Nigeria international forward was a target for a number of clubs in England and Europe, but Palace have made him a transfer priority as they look to replace
Eberechi Eze
who moved to Arsenal.
Uche is a versatile forward who can play anywhere across the front three, and even a little deeper in an attacking midfield role.

live_updates.title: Woolfenden set for Coventry
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Ipswich
defender
Luke Woolfenden
is set to arrive at Coventry today ahead of a permanent move.
He has been given permission to have a medical.
The total package is worth £4m.

live_updates.title: Carranza is Leicester for medical
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Julian Carranza
is currently undergoing a medical in
Leicester
.
The striker was one of their top targets this summer.
The deal is thought to concern a loan with an option to buy.

live_updates.title: Cuibano passes medical at Forest
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anton Toloui:
Prospective
Nottingham Forest
signing
Cuibano
has completed his medical at the club's training ground.
The signing will be confirmed later today.
Forest are also trying to complete a deal for
Dilane Bakwa
from Strasbourg for around £35m.

live_updates.title: Guehi's Palace future hanging in balance
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra:
Marc Guehi's
Crystal Palace
future hangs in the balance heading into the final hours of the window.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that it’s “50/50” whether the England defender moves to Liverpool or not.
The club are currently tying up deals to bring central defenders
Jaydee Canvot
and
Igor Juilo
on Deadline Day.
However, signing the pair does not mean that Guehi will definitely depart Palace today.
Palace are reluctant to sell their club captain but losing Guehi for free would be a bitter pill to swallow.
He has entered the final year of his deal at Selhurst Park.

live_updates.title: Carranza in Leicester for medical
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Julian Carranza
is currently undergoing a medical in
Leicester
.
The striker was one of their top targets this summer.
The deal is thought to concern a loan with an option to buy.

live_updates.title: Deadline Day latest!
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
It's been a very busy day so far and here are your main headlines...
Liverpool
have agreed a British-record deal to sign
Newcastle
striker
Alexander Isak
.
Newcastle
agree deal worth up to £55m to sign
Brentford
forward
Yoane Wissa
.
Man City
are closing in on the signing of PSG goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
with
Fenerbahce
in talks to sign
Ederson
.
Man Utd
are in talks over two goalkeepers - Aston Villa's
Emiliano Martinez
and Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
.
Aston Villa
agree deal to sign
Man Utd
winger
Jadon Sancho
on loan.
Crystal Palace
are close to signing
Brighton
defender
Igor Julio
potentially impacting on
Liverpool
target
Marc Guehi's
future.
Liverpool
have received an offer from
AC Milan
for
Joe Gomez
.
Sunderland
have agreed a £26m deal for
Ajax
striker
Brian Brobbey
as they also close in on signing
RB Leipzig
defender
Lutsharel Geertruida
.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
The deal is worth £18.2m.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
He has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
The deal is worth £18.2m.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
It's been a very busy day so far and here are your main headlines...
Liverpool
have agreed a British-record deal to sign
Newcastle

.
Newcastle
agree deal worth up to £55m to sign

forward

.
Man City
are closing in on the signing of PSG goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
with
Fenerbahce
in talks to sign
Ederson
.
Man Utd
are poised to sign Royal Antwerp goalkeeper
Senne Lammens
.
Aston Villa
agree deal to sign
Man Utd
winger
Jadon Sancho
on loan.
Crystal Palace
are close to signing
Brighton
defender
Igor Julio
potentially impacting on
Liverpool
target
Marc Guehi's
future.
Liverpool
have received an offer from
AC Milan
for
Joe Gomez
.
Sunderland
have agreed a £26m deal for
Ajax
striker
Brian Brobbey
as they also close in on signing
RB Leipzig
defender
Lutsharel Geertruida
.

live_updates.title: Tomasson: Isak is 'extremely professional'
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Sweden head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has called
Alexander Isak
'extremely professional' and confirmed the Liverpool-bound forward will link up with the national team later today.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
The deal is worth £18.2m plus add-ons.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: DOWNLOAD THE SKY SPORTS APP
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Can't live without transfers? Then download the
Sky Sports app
to make sure you don't miss a thing!
The

is your home for all the latest breaking news as well as:
FREE Premier League highlights
Plus free highlights from the EFL, F1, Golf and more
Expert opinions from the likes of Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher

Live scores, the ability to follow your favourite teams and sports and filter breaking news to your phone
And the best thing is, it's absolutely free and you don't need to be a Sky Sports subscriber to use it.
Click this link to download the Sky Sports app right now.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
The deal is worth £18.2m plus add-ons.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.
United had been in talks with Aston Villa to sign
Emi Martinez
.
However, it is understood that United viewed Lammens as the right choice for them.

live_updates.title: 'Spurs in talks to sign PSG forward Kolo Muani'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
are looking to sign
Paris Saint-Germain
forward
Randal Kolo Muani
on Deadline Day, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
It is claimed Spurs have almost agreed personal terms with the France international.
Negotiations are reportedly ongoing with PSG over a loan deal, but the Champions League holders are insisting on an obligation to buy in the deal.
The 26-year-old spent the second half of last season on loan at Juventus, where he scored 10 goals in 22 games across all competitions.

live_updates.title: Leicester trump Wrexham for James
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
look to have trumped their Championship promotion rivals
Wrexham
to the signing of young Wales international midfielder
Jordan James
.
Leicester are progressing in their talks with Rennes over a loan deal for the 21-year-old, who has three years left on his contract in France.
James is thought to be keen on the idea of a move to King Power Stadium, and there is optimism an agreement can be reached in time before tonight's deadline.

live_updates.title: Leicester trump Wrexham for James
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Leicester
look to have trumped their Championship promotion rivals
Wrexham
to the signing of young Wales international midfielder
Jordan James
.
The Foxes are progressing in their talks with Rennes over a loan deal for the 21-year-old, who has three years left on his contract in France.
James is thought to be keen on the idea of a move to King Power Stadium, and there is optimism an agreement can be reached in time before tonight's deadline.

live_updates.title: Rangers loan Cortes to Sporting Gijon
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Rangers
winger
Oscar Cortes
is closing in on a move to Spanish second division side
Sporting Gijon
.
The 21-year-old had his second loan spell at Ibrox last season, with an obligation to buy triggered in the summer.
However, he is now set to depart on loan until the end of this season after a lack of action.
Cortes has made 21 appearances for Rangers, scoring one goal and providing two assists.

live_updates.title: Celtic pushing to sign Tounekti
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
have made a third bid for
Hammarby IF
winger
Sebastian Tounekti
.
It’s understood the latest offer is worth up to £5.2m.
Hammarby had always been looking for a deal in the region of £5m before they considered selling the Tunisia international.

live_updates.title: Kamara leaves Pompey
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Portsmouth
have announced
Abdoulaye Kamara
has left the club by mutual consent.
The 20-year-old former
Borussia Dortmund II
midfielder has joined German third-tier side
FC Saarbrucken
.

live_updates.title: Vardy undergoing medical in Italy
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Jamie Vardy
is currently undergoing a medical in Milan ahead of completing a move to
Cremonese
.
He is expected to sign his contract later today.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
The deal is worth £18.2m plus add-ons.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.
United had been in talks with Aston Villa to sign
Emi Martinez
.
However, it is understood that United viewed Lammens as the right choice for them.

live_updates.title: 'Slim to no chance of Gallagher leaving Atletico'
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra and Lyall Thomas:
Currently, there is slim to no chance of
Conor Gallagher
leaving
Atletico Madrid
today.
Crystal Palace
have been hoping to bring him back to Selhurst Park but Atletico have no interest in selling or loaning him.
Sky Sports News
understand Atletico are not even looking for a replacement in the event that a tempting offer arrives.
Palace signed four players on Deadline Day last summer.
There is a realistic possibility they could sign a number of new players today too.

live_updates.title: Yang poised to leave Celtic for Birmingham
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Celtic
winger
Hyunjun Yang
is travelling to England ahead of a possible £3m move to
Birmingham City
.
The clubs are close to agreeing an initial fee of £3m, plus add-ons, with Birmingham still waiting for the Hoops to sanction the move.
However, with less than seven hours to go in the English window, the South Korea international is on his way to Birmingham to be ready for when the deal gets the green light.

live_updates.title: Watch ALL of Hackney's goals for Middlesbrough!
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Middlesbrough
's
Hayden Hackney
has been in demand all summer - but will he make a move away from Teesside today?
Click below to watch all of his goals for Boro so far (plus one from this season against Millwall!)

live_updates.title: Winger set to join Southampton
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Heidenheim
winger
Leo Scienza
is set to join
Southampton
.
Saints have agreed a deal with Heidenheim worth up to £8.6m (€10m).

live_updates.title: Wrexham and Birmingham told Vyner not for sale
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Wrexham
and
Birmingham
have been told
Zak Vyner
is not for sale by
Bristol City
at any price – even £5m.
The player is relaxed about the situation and is enjoying his football under
Gerhard Struber
.
He is already in the final year of his contract and could be an attractive free agent next summer.

live_updates.title: Hincapie's Arsenal position
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News:
“Hincapie is left-footed and can also play at left-back. Arsenal are already well covered in those areas with Gabriel and Calafiori, so I’m not sure where he would fit in. It’s a lot of money to pay when you’ve already got those positions covered.”

live_updates.title: Wrexham and Birmingham told Vyner not for sale
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Wrexham
and
Birmingham
have been told
Zak Vyner
is not for sale by
Bristol City
at any price – even £5m.
The player is relaxed about the situation and is enjoying his football under
Gerhard Struber
.
He is already in the final year of his contract and could be an attractive free agent next summer.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks for Liverpool's Elliot
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy and the package under discussion is worth £35m.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
The 22-year-old is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Brentford negotiating Nelson deal
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are close to agreeing an initial loan deal with Arsenal for
Reiss Nelson
.
They are also discussing an option to buy him permanently as part of the deal.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks for Liverpool's Elliot
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy and the package under discussion is worth £35m.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
The 22-year-old is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Ajax out to hijack Celtic's move for Dolberg
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Ajax
have made a last-ditch attempt to hijack
Kasper Dolberg’s
move from
Anderlecht
to
Celtic
.
The Dutch club made an enquiry this morning.
However, it’s understood they may only be able to do a loan, after exploring the conditions of a permanent deal with Anderlecht.
Celtic have been progressing in talks with the Belgian side over a deal for the Denmark international, with Anderlecht preferring to do a permanent transfer for a significant fee.
Sky Sports News
has been told Dolberg is open to joining the Scottish champions, but an emotional return to Ajax would be seen as an attractive option.

live_updates.title: West Ham youngster headed for Scotland
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Chris Reidy:
21-year-old
West Ham
defender
Junior Robinson
is in talks over a loan move to
Livingston
.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks for Liverpool's Elliot
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy and the package under discussion is worth £35m.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
The 22-year-old is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Cortes joins Sporting Gijon
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Rangers
winger
Oscar Cortes
has completed a season-long loan move to Spanish second division side
Sporting Gijon
.

live_updates.title: Spurs reach agreement for Kolo Muani
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have reached an agreement with
PSG
for the transfer of
Randal Kolo Muani
on loan.
The deal is for a straight loan with no option or obligation, as of yet.
The player is on the way to London to complete a medical.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa confirm Lindelof deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa have confirmed the signing of former Manchester United centre-back Victor Lindelof.
The Sweden international left Old Trafford in June after seven years at the club, making more than 250 appearances and winning both the Carabao Cup and Europa League.
Lindelof now links up with Unai Emery’s side as a free agent.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa confirm Lindelof deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa have confirmed the signing of former Manchester United centre-back Victor Lindelof.
The Sweden international left Old Trafford in June after seven years at the club, making more than 250 appearances and winning both the Carabao Cup and Europa League.
Lindelof now links up with Unai Emery’s side as a free agent.

live_updates.title: Spurs reach agreement for Kolo Muani
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have reached an agreement with
PSG
for the transfer of
Randal Kolo Muani
on loan.
The deal contains no option or obligation, as of yet.
The player is on his way to London to complete a medical.
The France international has been out of favour with the European champions.
He spent the second half of last season on loan at Juventus.

live_updates.title: Bakwa having Forest medical
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Strasbourg
winger
Dilane Bakwa
is undergoing a medical ahead of his £34.7m move to
Nottingham Forest.

live_updates.title: Wrexham close to signing Man City defender
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala and Anthony Joseph:
Wrexham
are close to agreeing a deal to sign
Manchester City
right-back
Issa Kabore.
It’s understood the clubs are discussing a season-long loan deal for the Burkina Faso international.
Kabore, 24, is undergoing a medical in preparation for the move being sanctioned.

live_updates.title: Sheaf undergoing medical at Wrexham
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Coventry
defensive midfielder
Ben Sheaf
is undergoing a medical ahead of his £6.5m move to
Wrexham
.
It’s understood the 27-year-old has agreed terms on a three-year contract.
The club will also hold option to extend by a further year.

live_updates.title: Liverpool preparing for Guehi medical
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Mark McAdam, Vinny O’Connor & Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
are preparing for
Marc Guehi
to have a medical in London knowing that any deal with
Crystal Palace
to sign him could go close to tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Any agreement between the two clubs will hinge on Palace being able to bolster their defensive ranks before they sign off a move for Guehi, but talks with Liverpool’s bosses remain very much alive.
To that end, the Brighton defender
Igor Julio
is currently undergoing a medical before sealing a move to Selhurst Park - although the Eagles have concerns that
West Ham
may make a late move to try to persuade Igor to join them.
Until Igor is confirmed, Palace are adamant they will not let Guehi leave.
Sky Sports News
has been told Liverpool want to make sure they have all the medical provisions in place and ready, should a deal be struck, and Guehi would then be given permission to travel to try to complete a move.
The Palace captain is understood to be “in the area” and awaiting  further developments.

live_updates.title: Boro sign Strelec
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Middlesbrough
have announced the signing of striker
David Strelec
from Slovan Bratislava on a five-year deal.
The fee is undisclosed but
Sky Sports News
understands it’s beaten the previous record for an outgoing transfer from Slovakia which stood at £6m (€7m).
Strelec had interest from other British clubs but we understand he had talks with Middlesbrough in January when Boro were coached by Michael Carrick and that interest was now followed up this summer.

live_updates.title: Spurs reach agreement for Kolo Muani
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have reached an agreement with
PSG
for the transfer of
Randal Kolo Muani
on loan.
The deal contains no option or obligation, as of yet.
The player is on his way to London to complete a medical.
The France international has been out of favour with the European champions.
He spent the second half of last season on loan at Juventus.

live_updates.title: Boro sign Strelec
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Middlesbrough
have announced the signing of striker
David Strelec
from
Slovan Bratislava
on a five-year deal.
The fee is undisclosed but
Sky Sports News
understands it’s beaten the previous record for an outgoing transfer from Slovakia which stood at £6m (€7m).
Strelec had interest from other British clubs and had talks with Middlesbrough in January when Boro were coached by Michael Carrick - that interest has been followed up this summer.

live_updates.title: Liverpool preparing for Guehi medical
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Mark McAdam, Vinny O’Connor & Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
are preparing for
Marc Guehi
to have a medical in London knowing that any deal with
Crystal Palace
to sign him could go close to tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Any agreement between the two clubs will hinge on Palace being able to bolster their defensive ranks before they sign off a move for Guehi, but talks with Liverpool’s bosses remain very much alive.
To that end, the Brighton defender
Igor Julio
is currently undergoing a medical before sealing a move to Selhurst Park - although the Eagles have concerns that
West Ham
may make a late move to try to persuade Igor to join them.
Until Igor is confirmed, Palace are adamant they will not let Guehi leave.
Sky Sports News
has been told Liverpool want to make sure they have all the medical provisions in place and ready, should a deal be struck, and Guehi would then be given permission to travel to try to complete a move.
The Palace captain is understood to be “in the area” and awaiting  further developments.

live_updates.title: Roberts to join Birmingham
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Patrick Roberts
is set to join Birmingham on loan from
Sunderland
.

live_updates.title: Vieira having medical at Hamburg
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira's
medical with Hamburg is under way, according to
Sky in Germany
.
He is expected to join on a season-long loan.

live_updates.title: Palace pursuing three defenders amid Guehi move
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Crystal Palace
are currently pursuing possible deals for THREE defenders, as they look to strengthen at centre-back - and how successful they are will dictate whether or not they sanction
Marc Guehi's
move to
Liverpool
.
Brighton
defender
Igor Julio
is undergoing a medical at Palace, as they look to complete a loan deal with an option to buy. This deal is crucial if Palace are to allow Guehi to leave for Liverpool.
There are concerns
West Ham
may yet come in with a late offer to try to pinch Igor from Palace.
Jaydee Canvot
, the 19-year-old
Toulouse
centre back, has now completed his Palace medical and his signing is expected to be confirmed shortly - a deal worth £20.8m.
Oliver Glasner is keen for the club to complete a deal for the Serbia international defender
Strahinja Pavlovic
, although the latest we have been told is that negotiations are not currently progressing.
Forward
Christantus Uche
, meanwhile, is undergoing a medical at Palace ahead of a possible €20m move from Getafe. He is seen as a replacement for Ebe Eze.

live_updates.title: Wissa agrees Newcastle contract
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Yoane Wissa
has agreed a four-year contract with
Newcastle
.
The deal to take Wissa from Brentford to the North East is worth £55m.
Full story:

live_updates.title: Merse shocked that Guehi hasn't attracted more attention
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Paul Merson
heaps praise on
Crystal Palace
's captain
Marc Guehi
as the defender is heavily linked with a move to Premier League champions Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Lammens on way for Man Utd medical
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan:
Senne Lammens
has landed in England and is on his way to Carrington to undergo his
Manchester United
medical ahead of signing for £18.2m.

live_updates.title: More Brighton exits expected
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporter Chris Nightingale:
Brighton
have let a lot of players go this summer and that number is only going to increase throughout Deadline Day with updates on
Julio Enciso, Facundo Buonanotte, Jeremy Sarmiento
and
Matt O’Riley
still to come.
Manager Fabian Hurzeler has spoken about the need to trim his squad throughout this window, but it’s easy to see some areas could become light with injury.

live_updates.title: WATCH: Merse shocked Guehi hasn't attracted more attention
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Paul Merson
heaps praise on
Crystal Palace
's captain
Marc Guehi
as the defender is heavily linked with a move to Premier League champions Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
"For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai?
"All of a sudden, Wirtz is in there, a £100m player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: Wrexham sign Sheaf
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Wrexham
have completed a £6.5m deal for
Coventry
captain
Ben Sheaf
.
He has agreed a three-year contract with the option of a further year.

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
"For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai?
"All of a sudden, Wirtz is in there, a £100m player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: 'Isak move will only work if chemistry is right'
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"I like him [Alexander Isak]. He’s a good player, but I don’t think it’s all over just because he’s signed. I don’t see it like that. The problem is Liverpool haven’t played well, yet they’ve beaten Newcastle and Arsenal. That’s the issue: they’ve not been at their best, but they’ve still got those results.
"It all depends on whether it works. You can have the best players in the world, but if it doesn’t gel, you don’t have the chemistry. When Liverpool were at their best, it was Mane, Salah and Firmino. Firmino would drop off, Salah would make those runs in, and Mane too, there was chemistry.
"For me, Firmino wasn’t a £125m player, but he made it all tick. Unless this new set-up gels, time will tell. What Slot has now is a lot of head-scratching, because he’s got big decisions to make with very good players."

live_updates.title: Sheff Wednesday in talks for Man Utd full-back
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vikash Varange and Dharmesh Sheth:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a season-long loan as the 18-year-old is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Enciso joins Strasbourg
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Julio Enciso
has completed his move to French club
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old has joined on a permanent deal for a fee understood to be £10m.
Brighton have a sell-on clause as part of the deal.
Enciso is the second player who has left the club today after
Tariq Lamptey
joined Fiorentina.

live_updates.title: PFA pre-season enters final week
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text: There is no deadline for clubs to sign free agents, but could any of these free agents be on the move today?

live_updates.title: Spurs to sell Gil to Girona
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have agreed a deal with Girona to sell
Bryan Gil
for around £8.65m.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wednesday agree loan for Man Utd full-back
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta:
Sheffield Wednesday
have agreed a loan deal with
Manchester United
for left-back
Harry Amass
.
The teenager's move to the Championship is pending EFL approval.
The season-long loan deal has no option to buy as the 18-year-old is still seen as one for the future at Man Utd.

live_updates.title: Spurs to sell Gil to Girona
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have agreed a deal with Girona to sell
Bryan Gil
for around £8.65m.
The forward spent last season on loan at the LaLiga side, scoring three times in 21 starts.

live_updates.title: Oxford sign Bulgaria international
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Oxford
have completed the signing of
Filip Krastev
on a season-long loan from
Lommel
.
The midfielder, 23, has 24 caps for Bulgaria and spent time on loan in the MLS at
LA FC
in 2023.
Oxford boss
Gary Rowett
said: “Filip is a player with wonderful ability who can add a lot of energy to the team.
“He will provide a creative spark, with a clear eye for goal and an ability to deliver moments of quality.
“We believe Filip will add something new and exciting to the group and we look forward to working with him over the international break to get him ready as soon as possible.”

live_updates.title: Oxford sign Bulgaria international
live_updates.author: Dan Long
live_updates.text:
Oxford
have completed the signing of
Filip Krastev
on a season-long loan from
Lommel
.
The midfielder, 23, has 24 caps for Bulgaria and spent time on loan in the MLS at
LA FC
in 2023.

live_updates.title: Spurs agree to sell Gil to Girona
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Tottenham
have agreed a deal with Girona to sell
Bryan Gil
for around £8.65m.
The forward spent last season on loan at the LaLiga side, scoring three times in 21 starts.

live_updates.title: Osula attracting attention before deadline
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie and Rob Jones:
Eintracht Frankfurt
have made a bid for Newcastle striker
William Osula
.
The package under discussion is £28.5m.
Aston Villa
have also enquired over Osula’s availability in the last 48 hours.
The 22-year-old scored on Monday against Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd despite asking to leave
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Kobbie Mainoo
is staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in Ruben Amorim's first team.
The club are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options, which include Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd despite asking to leave
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan:
Kobbie Mainoo
is staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in Ruben Amorim's first team.
The club are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options, which include Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Robinson joins Livingston
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
West Ham
have confirmed young defender
Junior Robinson
has joined
Livingston
on a season-long loan.

live_updates.title: Ajax hijacking Celtic move for Dolberg
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Ajax
are now pressing ahead in their bid to hijack
Kasper Dolberg’s
move to
Celtic
after seeking assurance from the player that he would prefer a return to the club.
Sky Sports News
revealed earlier today that the Eredivisie club made an enquiry this morning over a permanent deal, but were not satisfied with the conditions set out by
Anderlecht
.
Ajax came back in with a loan approach, but Anderlecht are not keen to loan their star striker – and are only open to selling for a significant fee.
It’s understood the Dutch club are now in talks again over a permanent deal after Dolberg confirmed that he would prefer to join them.
This could leave Celtic scrambling as they search for two strikers before tonight’s 11pm deadline.
Adam Idah
has already completed a medical and finalised the paperwork ahead of his £7m move to
Swansea City
, with the player and club waiting for Celtic to sign the documents at their end.

live_updates.title: Enciso joins Strasbourg
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Julio Enciso
has completed his move to French club
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old has joined on a permanent deal for a fee understood to be £10m.
Brighton have a sell-on clause as part of the deal.
Enciso is the second player who has left the club today after
Tariq Lamptey
joined Fiorentina.

live_updates.title: Kolo Muani in London for Spurs medical
live_updates.author: Laura Hunter
live_updates.text:
Randal Kolo Muani
is in London and set to undergo a medical at
Tottenham Hotspur
.
The agreement is a straight loan, with no option to buy the forward from PSG.

live_updates.title: Why have Newcastle left it so late on Isak?
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Former Aston Villa chief executive Christian Purslow:
"I can only look from the outside and apply my own experience. When you go into a summer window, you have your strategic plans – your outs and your ins.
"If Isak was a strategic plan out, it would have happened earlier and they would’ve identified the ins to replace him.
"By leaving it so late, it suggests to me that right up until recently that they might be able to persuade the player to stay, which is what I had to do with Jack Grealish.
"By leaving it this long, I think they missed out on their primary targets. They got a bit more out of Liverpool but the issue is the replacements.
"I’m not sure they’re at the level they really wanted."

live_updates.title: Merson: Guehi absolute bargain defender
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports Paul Merson:
“I think he’s a brilliant player. I really do think he’s a top centre-half - absolute class. It blows my mind that he’s still at Liverpool. He gets into everybody’s team, in my opinion.
"People might say he doesn’t get in at Arsenal at the moment because of their two centre-halves, but he’d be a great replacement. I know he’ll want to play, but in this day and age, when we’re throwing about money, £60m, £80m, £125m, he’s an absolute bargain for a top, top centre-half."

live_updates.title: Emery: We have to perform with the players we have
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Unai Emery
suggests
Aston Villa
may have to prepare to continue with their current defensive options as the transfer window draws to a close.
Villa were beaten 1-0 at
Brentford
on Saturday, with Ezri Konsa suspended after picking up a red card in their opening draw vs Newcastle.
Emery's side have been linked to signing a defender to bolster options at the back.
However, asked about Konsa's absence affecting the team, Emery said:
"We have to be ready to play with the centre-backs we have.
"We have to perform with the players we have. I think it’s enough players to get enough performances for this season.
“But this week is the last week for the transfer window and of course, we have some circumstances that are not helping us.”

live_updates.title: 'Villa make contact for Nkunku'
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
have made contact for
Chelsea
forward
Christopher Nkunku
, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
The 27-year-old is reportedly an option for Unai Emery's side before the end of the season.
Bayern Munich and RB Leipzig are also interested in Nkunku.
Sky Sports News
reported earlier in August that Chelsea rejected a loan move offer from Bayern, with both the player and club wanting a permanent exit.
Chelsea value Nkunku, who has four years remaining on his current deal, at £43m.

live_updates.title: 'Villa reject Stuttgart loan offer for Buendia'
live_updates.author: David Bowers
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa have rejected Stuttgart's initial loan offer for Emiliano Buendia, according to
The Athletic
.
The offer also included an option to buy the midfielder who, according to the report, is weighing up a potential departure from Villa Park.
The 28-year-old - who is contracted to Villa until 2027 - spent the second half of 2024-25 on loan at Bundesliga side Bayer Leverkusen, who had an option to make the move permanent.
Buendia made 14 appearances for Leverkusen, starting four matches and scoring twice.

live_updates.title: Villa in talks for Asensio return
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol, Lyall Thomas and Sky Germany:
Aston Villa
are understood to be in talks with
Paris Saint-Germain
for
Marco Asensio.
The French club want a permanent deal for the Spain international, who only has one year left on his contract.
He was on loan at Villa last season and
Sky Sports News
have already reported Villa have been interested in signing him again.
Nicolas Jackson
remains another player Villa have an interest in before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Emery: We are very busy
live_updates.author: Adam Bate
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Adam Bate at Aston Villa's training ground:
Unai Emery
acknowledged that
Aston Villa
’s start to the season has been “poor” and does not expect it to get easier against a Crystal Palace side that has proven a tricky match-up for his side under Oliver Glasner.
The Villa boss is hoping to get some help in the next few days before the transfer window closes, however. “We are very busy. We are working here, we are active,” he said.
Asked by
Sky Sports
about the possibility of
Marco Asensio
returning, he added: “I don't want to speak about some players because we have different options. Of course, you are asking me about Marco Asensio, I was so happy with him [last season] in general.”

live_updates.title: Villa in talks for Dons' Boyd
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph and Lyall Thomas:
Aston Villa
are in talks to sign
Aberdeen
attacker midfielder
Fletcher Boyd.
It’s understood the Dons are looking for a fee in the region of £1m, plus add-ons - including a significant sell-on clause.
Villa have been tracking the 17-year-old for some time and made initial contact in June.
Sky Sports News
has been told that all parties are hopeful of reaching a deal before Monday’s transfer deadline.

live_updates.title: 'Man Utd make new approach for Villa goalkeeper Martinez'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
have made a new approach for
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
It is claimed Man Utd have held fresh talks with Villa and the World Cup winners' camp.
Negotiations reportedly remain ongoing for
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens,
but Man Utd want to be ready if a deal collapses before the window shuts on Monday.

live_updates.title: West Ham do not want to sell Paqueta amid Aston Villa interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
West Ham
do not want to sell
Lucas Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
West Ham, however, want to keep Paqueta in their squad after a difficult start to the campaign.
West Ham play away at Nottingham Forest today, live on
Sky Sports
.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa agree £1m deal for Aberdeen teenager Boyd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Aston Villa
have agreed a £1m deal, plus add-ons, to sign
Aberdeen
attacking midfielder
Fletcher Boyd
.
It is understood that the deal includes a significant sell-on clause.
The 17-year-old is in Birmingham today and is due to undergo a medical before finalising the paperwork on a long-term contract.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa agree £1m deal for Aberdeen teenager Boyd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Anthony Joseph:
Aston Villa
have agreed a £1m deal, plus add-ons, to sign
Aberdeen
attacking midfielder
Fletcher Boyd
.
It is understood that the deal includes a significant sell-on clause.
The 17-year-old is in Birmingham today and is due to undergo a medical before finalising the paperwork on a long-term contract.

live_updates.title: Paqueta appears to silence talk over future
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Lucas Paqueta
appeared to end speculation over his future at West Ham with his goal celebration against Nottingham Forest on Sunday.
After scoring a penalty to make it 2-0, Paqueta mimicked throwing away a phone before pointing to and kissing the West Ham badge on his shirt.
Before the match,
Sky Sports News
reported that
West Ham
do not want to sell
Paqueta
to
Aston Villa
, or anyone else, before the deadline.
Villa have shown interest in an initial loan deal with an obligation to buy him worth a total package of around £50m.
Paqueta played the entire match against Forest.

live_updates.title: Martinez left out of Villa squad amid transfer speculation
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Goalkeeper
Emi Martínez
has been left out of
Aston Villa
's squad to take on
Crystal Palace
, live on Sky Sports Super Sunday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Sunday that the 32-year-old is keen on a move to Manchester United and is thought to be waiting on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez started Villa's last game in the Premier League, a 1-0 defeat to Brentford. Marco Bizot replaced Martinez in the starting line-up.
Aston Villa team in full:
Bizot, Cash, Konsa, Mings, Maatsen, McGinn, Tielemans, Malen, Guessand, Rogers, Watkins.
Subs:
Proctor, Digne, Buendia, Torres, Bogarde, Rowe, Jimoh-Aloba.
Follow live updates as Villa host Palace on
Super Sunday
.

live_updates.title: Martinez left out of Villa squad amid Man Utd transfer links
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Goalkeeper
Emi Martínez
has been left out of
Aston Villa
's squad to take on
Crystal Palace
, live on Sky Sports Super Sunday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Sunday that the 32-year-old is keen on a move to Manchester United and is thought to be waiting on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez started Villa's last game in the Premier League, a 1-0 defeat to Brentford. Marco Bizot replaced Martinez in the starting line-up.
Aston Villa team in full:
Bizot, Cash, Konsa, Mings, Maatsen, McGinn, Tielemans, Malen, Guessand, Rogers, Watkins.
Subs:
Proctor, Digne, Buendia, Torres, Bogarde, Rowe, Jimoh-Aloba.
Follow live updates as Villa host Palace on
Super Sunday
.

live_updates.title: Martinez left out of Villa squad amid Man Utd transfer links
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Goalkeeper
Emi Martínez
has been left out of
Aston Villa
's squad to take on
Crystal Palace
, live on Sky Sports Super Sunday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Sunday that the 32-year-old is keen on a move to Manchester United and is thought to be waiting on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez started Villa's last game in the Premier League, a 1-0 defeat to Brentford. Marco Bizot replaced Martinez in the starting line-up.
"Bizot. Marco Bizot," said Unai Emery when asked about the absence of Martinez from the match-day squad.
When pushed for an explanation on Martinez's absence, Emery added: "Marco Bizot. Marco Bizot."
Aston Villa team in full:
Bizot, Cash, Konsa, Mings, Maatsen, McGinn, Tielemans, Malen, Guessand, Rogers, Watkins.
Subs:
Proctor, Digne, Buendia, Torres, Bogarde, Rowe, Jimoh-Aloba.
Follow live updates as Villa host Palace on
Super Sunday
.

live_updates.title: Villa-linked Asensio expected to join Fenerbahce
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol:
PSG
's
Marco Asensio
is expected to join Turkish club
Fenerbahce
in a permanent deal.
Aston Villa
had held talks over re-signing the attacking midfielder after his loan spell last season.
However, they were unable to reach an agreement with the French champions.
Asensio has entered the final year of his deal at PSG.

live_updates.title: Villa turning stale - Emery needs reinforcements
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Patrick Rowe:
Starts to the season do not get much worse than this. One point from the opening three games without a goal scored. The first time in 28 years that this has happened at the club.
Emiliano Martinez's future was the main talking point ahead of kick-off, souring the mood at Villa Park, and the game did not help.
The situation at Villa seems to have turned stale. The transfer window has been a difficult one to navigate and now on the eve of it finally closing, the headlines are focused on key players leaving, rather than fresh faces arriving.
"We need some balance, we have to try get balance again." said Unai Emery to
Sky Sports
after the game. He is right.
Bringing on 17-year-old Bradley Burrowes with his side two-nil down at home seemed like a point being made by the Villa boss - regardless of how promising the young talent is.
Villa need reinforcements quickly or they are at major risk of being left behind in the Premier League.

live_updates.title: Emery: We have to 'fix' Martinez's situation at Villa
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
boss
Unai Emery
has said the club will need to "fix"
Emiliano Martinez's
situation on transfer Deadline Day tomorrow.
Martinez was not included in the match-day squad to face
Crystal Palace
on Sunday due to the player wanting to join Manchester United before the window closes at 7pm on Monday.
"It is one thing we have to fix," Emery told
Sky Sports
.
"Tomorrow is finishing the window and we are expecting something to improve our squad. Keep calm.
"One of the circumstances is Emi Martinez, we will see tomorrow and then we try get the balance and work after the break."

live_updates.title: Emery: I don't know if Martinez will stay
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
boss
Unai Emery
has said he does not know whether
Emiliano Martinez
will be at the club after Deadline Day on Monday.
Martinez was not included in the match-day squad for the 3-0 loss to Palace, with the Argentina international keen for a move to
Manchester United
.
Speaking in his post-match press conference, Emery said: "We will see tomorrow. I cannot tell anything more. I don't know, this is the reality. We will see tomorrow.
"It is not helping us. One of the circumstances not helping.
"Tomorrow we will see how we close the transfer window.  We have a lot of circumstances that are not helping us be mentally like we were last year.
On why Martinez was not involved against the Eagles, Emery added: "He was not available. Tomorrow is the deadline, we will see how we finish.
"We need the players focused and 100 per cent. He wasn't."
Marco Bizot started in place of Martinez, with Emery then confirming he would like Bizot, a young goalkeeper and Martinez or a replacement in the squad after the window closes.
He said: “I want [Marco] Bizot, young players and Emi [Martinez] - or another.”

live_updates.title: Lindelof would add experience, says Emery
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
boss
Unai Emery
has commented on the potential arrival of
Victor Lindelof
.
The former Manchester United defender is a free agent after leaving Old Trafford at the end of his contract in June.
"Experience and he is a good player. We will see tomorrow how we close the deadline," Emery said in his post-match press conference when asked about Lindelof.
"We are expecting to add some players."

live_updates.title: Villa exploring Sancho deal
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Vik Varange:
Aston Villa
are exploring a Deadline Day deal for
Manchester United
forward
Jadon Sancho
.
United would prefer a permanent deal, but
Sky Sports News
understands discussions are centred over a loan.
Sancho has entered the final year of his contract, with United holding the option to extend by a further year.

live_updates.title: Sancho can follow Rashford's blueprint at Villa
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Patrick Rowe:
"Marcus Rashford made the decision to leave Manchester United to work with Unai Emery - and he's now firmly back in the England picture and currently working alongside Lamine Yamal at Barcelona.
"Jadon Sancho's time in the Premier League has not gone to plan so far but Emery knows a player when he sees one.
"It could be the perfect move for both the player and a team currently lacking a spark in the final third.
"Three goals and four assists in 31 appearances while on loan at Chelsea last season was a modest return but it is difficult to carve a way into Enzo Maresca's bloated squad.
"At Villa, Sancho would have regular game time, European football and a manager who has regularly shown he can get the best out of players.
"A loan deal can help all parties. Sancho's long-term future, whether it is at Villa or another club, is a discussion for a later date."

live_updates.title: Getafe's Uche arrives in UK for Premier League move
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Getafe
forward
Christantus Uche
has arrived in the UK to secure a Premier League move.
Three Premier League clubs remain interested: they are understood to be
Aston Villa, Crystal Palace
and
Sunderland
.
Leeds
and
Wolves
were interested earlier in the window but moved onto other targets.
The 22-year-old Nigeria international has already scored and assisted in three LaLiga games this season.

live_updates.title: Villa in talks over Man Utd's Sancho
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of
Jadon Sancho
.
