Discussions are over a loan deal.
Villa are also in dialogue with Sancho's camp over personal terms.
There is no agreement yet on either but Villa working to get a deal struck before 7pm.

live_updates.title: Man Utd keeping Martinez deal warm
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
in talks over two goalkeepers on Deadline Day.
They are keeping potential deals with
Aston Villa’s Emiliano Martinez
and
Royal Antwerp’s Senne Lammens
warm before deciding which one to go for - if they end up signing one at all.
There is still a chance United will have the same goalkeeping department as they do now.
Both keepers want join United. But any deal would have to be right.
Both Martinez and Lammens were left out of their respective squads over the weekend.

live_updates.title: Villa agree deal to sign Man Utd's Sancho
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
have agreed a deal with
Manchester United
for
Jadon Sancho
.
The deal is a straight loan.
Sky Sports News
understands Villa will pay a loan fee and pay 80% of the wages. Bonuses inserted in the deal could cover full wage coverage.
Sancho’s entered the final year of his contract. United have the option to extend for a further 12 months.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa hold talks over Liverpool's Elliott
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Jonse and Vinny O'Connor:
Aston Villa
have had informal conversations with
Liverpool
over attacker
Harvey Elliott.
Everything is on the table at the moment in terms of loan or a permanent deal.
The arrival o
f Alexander Isak
at Liverpool has opened up a potential departure for Elliott.
Elliott has been linked with
RB Leipzig
this summer but they are way off on their valuation of the player.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal to sign Lammens - could Martinez stay?
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
Sky Sports News
understands deal is worth £18.2m.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.
United had been linked with a move for
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, who wanted the move to Old Trafford.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal to sign Lammens - could Martinez stay?
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
Sky Sports News
understands deal is worth £18.2m.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.
United had been in talks with
Aston Villa
for goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, who wanted the move to Old Trafford, but Ruben Amorim's side viewed Lammens as the right choice for them.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal to sign Lammens - could Martinez stay?
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with Royal Antwerp for goalkeeper
Senne Lammens.
Sky Sports News
understands deal is worth £18.2m.
He is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
The 23-year-old has agreed a five-year deal.
United had been in talks with
Aston Villa
for goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, who wanted the move to Old Trafford, but Ruben Amorim's side viewed Lammens as the right choice for them.

live_updates.title: 'Galatasaray emerge as option for Martinez after Man Utd agree Lammens deal'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
has emerged as a target for
Galatasaray
, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
Martinez had been of interest to
Manchester United
, but a move has not materialised after
they chose to sign
Senne Lammens
from
Royal Antwerp
.
The Turkish window shuts on September 11, giving Galatasaray time to potentially sort a deal for Martinez.
The 32-year-old, who wanted to join Man Utd, was left out of Villa's squad in yesterday's home defeat to Crystal Palace.
Villa boss Unai Emery admitted the club needed to "fix" the situation.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks to sign Liverpool's Elliott
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy.
The package under discussion is worth £35m for the 22-year-old forward.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
Elliott is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Villa in advanced talks to sign Liverpool's Elliott
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott
.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy.
The package under discussion is worth £35m for the 22-year-old forward.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs.
Elliott is still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa confirm Lindelof deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa have confirmed the signing of former Manchester United centre-back Victor Lindelof.
The Sweden international left Old Trafford in June after seven years at the club, making more than 250 appearances and winning both the Carabao Cup and Europa League.
Lindelof now links up with Unai Emery’s side as a free agent.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa confirm Lindelof deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
have confirmed the signing of former
Manchester
United
centre-back
Victor Lindelof
.
The Sweden international left Old Trafford in June after seven years at the club, making more than 250 appearances and winning both the Carabao Cup and Europa League.
Lindelof now links up with Unai Emery’s side as a free agent.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa confirm Lindelof deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Aston Villa
have confirmed the signing of former
Manchester
United
centre-back
Victor Lindelof
.
The Sweden international left Old Trafford in June after seven years at the club, making more than 250 appearances and winning both the Carabao Cup and Europa League.
Lindelof now links up with Unai Emery’s side as a free agent.
“It’s a massive club, and I was super excited when I heard that the club wanted me," Lindelof told the official club website after the signing was confirmed.
“I spoke to my wife, and we felt it was a good move for us as a family and for me as a player.
“I’ve been at the Premier League for many years, so I know what it’s all about.
“Hopefully, I can help the younger players with my experience, and also bring in the quality like I show on the pitch.
“I am super, super happy and thrilled to be part of this football club.”

live_updates.title: Villa enquire about Osula as Frankfurt launch bid
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
have enquired about Newcastle striker
William Osula
after E
intracht Frankfurt
launched a Deadline Day bid for the player.
The package under discussion between the Magpies and Frankfurt is around £28.5m.
The 22-year-old scored on Monday against
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Villa enquire about Osula as Frankfurt launch bid
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie and Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
have enquired about Newcastle striker
William Osula
after
Eintracht Frankfurt
launched a Deadline Day bid for the player.
The package under discussion between the Magpies and Frankfurt is around £28.5m.
The 22-year-old scored last Monday against
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Chelsea pulling out of Jackson's move to Bayern
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Chelsea are pulling out of the Nicolas Jackson loan deal to Bayern Munich.
Bayern have been informed that Chelsea will not be able to proceed with the proposed deal due to an injury to Liam Delap against Fulham.
The decision to cancel Jackson’s loan was taken after discussions this afternoon between Chelsea’s football leadership team and head coach Enzo Maresca.
The player is now expected to return to London. He will go straight back into the first-team squad.
He has been training with the first-team squad as there was always the possibility he would stay.
He signed an extension last September and his contract runs to 2033.

live_updates.title: Chelsea submit bid for Barca star
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Chelsea have sent Barcelona a £36.6m (€40m) written bid for Fermin Lopez.
They are now waiting for a response after submitting the offer today.
Sky Sports News
has been reporting that Chelsea would make an offer if they received any encouragement that a deal was possible.

live_updates.title: Chelsea sign Garnacho from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Chelsea have signed winger Alejandro Garnacho in a £40m transfer from Manchester United.
They have now spent nearly £300m on nine new arrivals this summer - but have a positive net spend as things stand after recouping more than £314m in sales.
Garnacho, 21, has signed a long-term deal at Chelsea and says he is happy to be joining "the best team in the world".
A compromise over Garnacho's valuation had to be reached as United valued him at £50m, which was more than Chelsea were prepared to pay.
United negotiated the fee up from an initial Chelsea offer of £25m and are understood to feel it is a good, pragmatic deal, delivering their largest sale fee for five years. They also believe it is a good solution for the player, who has been pushing strongly to leave.
The deal, which includes a 10 per cent sell-on fee, represents the fourth-largest sale in United's history after those of Cristiano Ronaldo, Romelu Lukaku and Angel Di Maria - and the club's largest sale of an academy graduate.

live_updates.title: Jackson to return to Chelsea
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Nicolas Jackson
has to come back to
Chelsea
.
Nothing was signed with
Bayern Munich
and there is no paperwork.
He was given permission to travel and have a medical and that permission has been revoked.
Chelsea   have a good working relationship with Bayern – this situation may have   been different if this was a permanent deal but Bayern insisted on a   loan.
This is a unique and awkward situation but the expectation is that everyone is going to act professionally.
If   this was a permanent deal, Chelsea would be able to use the fee   received to buy another forward – but it is not, and in any case, there   are very strikers available in the market at the moment.
Bayern   could try to change the deal to a permanent move, but time is running   out and potential replacements are scarce. Bayern have made it clear   they are only in the market for loans.
It’s  understandable the player is disappointed – he was hoping to become the  heir to
Harry Kane
, but he is a Chelsea player and is contracted until  2033.
Bayern   have been informed that Chelsea have no intention of loaning the  player  and he has been asked to return. The permission to have a  medical has  been revoked.
Meanwhile, Chelsea are waiting for a response from Barcelona about their €40m bid for
Fermin Lopez
.

live_updates.title: Bayern director speaks out on Jackson saga
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Bayern's sporting director Max Eberl speaking with Sky in Germany:
"Chelsea has informed us that they would like to have the player back – after we came to an agreement yesterday and we were given permission for the medical.
"Now the situation is that the boy is in Munich and we have to send him back. That is the current state of affairs; I cannot predict the future."

live_updates.title: Papers: Furious Jackson refusing to return to Chelsea after Bayern loan snub
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text: The top stories and transfer rumours from Sunday's newspapers...

live_updates.title: Jackson still in Munich with Chelsea striker not giving up on Bayern move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Chelsea
striker
Nicolas Jackson
is still in Munich on Sunday morning and has not given up hope of his move to
Bayern Munich
still going ahead.
Chelsea would have a decision to make if Bayern offered an obligation to buy or a permanent deal.
The German champions' current deal for Jackson would see them pay a £13m up-front loan fee with a £56.2m option to buy.
Chelsea are pulling out of the deal due to an injury picked up by
Liam Delap
in the win over Fulham.
The Blues have asked Jackson to return from Germany, where he was progressing a loan move to Bayern.
The decision to cancel Jackson’s loan was taken after discussions on Saturday afternoon between Chelsea’s football leadership team and head coach
Enzo Maresca
.
Bayern have been informed that Chelsea will not be able to proceed with the proposed deal.

live_updates.title: Chelsea in talks with Sporting over striker Harder as Jackson pushes for Bayern move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol and Zinny Boswell:
Chelsea
striker
Nicolas Jackson
is still in Munich this morning and has not given up hope of his move to Bayern still going ahead.
The situation would change if Bayern were prepared to buy Jackson or take him on loan, plus an obligation to buy instead of just an option.
That is a solution that Chelsea would consider, but they would need to bring in another striker, and time is running out with very few options available.
Chelsea are in talks with
Sporting
for striker
Conrad Harder
.
RB Leipzig
and
AC Milan
have been trying to sign the 20-year-old from the Portuguese club this summer.
Meanwhile, Jackson is in Munich and wants to sign for Bayern.
Chelsea have revoked the permission they gave for him to have a medical and have asked him to return.

live_updates.title: 'Chelsea not playing poker with Bayern over Jackson'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Talks are going on right now between
Chelsea
and
Bayern Munich
about
Nicolas Jackson
.
Chelsea’s position is clear: Jackson is a Chelsea player, so if you want him, then buy him.
This is not a bluff; Chelsea are not playing poker.
Even if Bayern were to agree to sign Jackson, Chelsea would still have to sign a replacement - but there are hardly any strikers available on loan anymore.
Chelsea believe the loan agreement has now been totally revoked.
If Bayern believe in Jackson, they have to buy him.

live_updates.title: Jackson in Munich as Chelsea consider alternative options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Chelsea
striker
Nicolas Jackson
is still in Munich this morning and has not given up hope of his move to Bayern still going ahead.
The situation would change if Bayern were prepared to buy Jackson or take him on loan, plus an obligation to buy instead of just an option.
That is a solution that Chelsea would consider, but they would need to bring in another striker, and time is running out with very few options available.
Chelsea have made contact with Sporting about Conrad Harder in case Jackson were to join Bayern permanently. However, he is just one of a number of options.
RB Leipzig
and
AC Milan
have been trying to sign the 20-year-old from the Portuguese club this summer.
Meanwhile, Jackson is in Munich and wants to sign for Bayern.
Chelsea have revoked the permission they gave for him to have a medical and have asked him to return.

live_updates.title: Chelsea relaxed about Jackson situation
live_updates.author: Zinny Boswell
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Chelsea are thought to be relaxed about the Nicolas Jackson situation. He is a Chelsea player and contracted until 2033.
Jackson does not have to return to London because Chelsea players have two days off and then it is the international break. Jackson has been called up to the Senegal squad for qualifiers against Sudan and DR Congo.
Chelsea have been linked with a move for Conrad Harder and recalling Marc Guiu from his loan at Sunderland even though they are not regarded as being comparable to Jackson yet in terms of experience. Chelsea are considering other options too - in case Jackson joins Bayern permanently.
Chelsea are expected to complete a deal soon to sign Facundo Buonanotte on loan from Brighton and they have also made a €40m bid for Barcelona attacking midfielder Fermin Lopez.
Raheem Sterling, Ben Chilwell, Axel Disasi and David Datro Fofana are expected to leave before tomorrow’s deadline.

live_updates.title: Guiu set to return early from Sunderland loan
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Marc Guiu
is set to return early from his loan at
Sunderland
to give
Enzo Maresca
more forward options while
Liam Delap
recovers from a hamstring injury.
Meanwhile
, Chelsea
target
Fermin Lopez
came on as a substitute for
Barcelona
this evening in their 1-1 draw at
Rayo Vallecano
.
The Blues have offered Barcelona €40m (£35m) for the attacking midfielder.

live_updates.title: Jackson Bayern deal off due to unwillingness to sign striker permanently
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayern Munich
are not willing to sign
Nicolas Jackson
permanently. This has been communicated to
Chelsea
and the player and his representatives.
Therefore, the deal is off, although it has been effectively off since yesterday evening, when Bayern were told they had to sign him permanently if they wanted him, a commitment they have always been unwilling to make.
No agreement was signed with Bayern and Chelsea's position is the same as it was yesterday - the deal is off and he remains a Chelsea player.
Sunday is the first of two days off for Chelsea players, and then it is the international break.
Jackson has been called up to the Senegal squad for their upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Sudan and DR Congo. He needs to report for duty in Senegal by Tuesday.

live_updates.title: Cardiff hopeful on Chelsea's Kellyman on loan
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Cardiff City
are hopeful of signing
Omari Kellyman
on a season-long loan from
Chelsea
.
The clubs are in talks over a Deadline Day deal for the 19-year-old.

live_updates.title: Cardiff sign Chelsea teenager Kellyman on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Cardiff City
have signed
Chelsea's
19-year-old
Omari Kellyman
on a season-long loan.

live_updates.title: Another twist in Jackson saga as Bayern back in talks with Chelsea for striker
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayern Munich
are back in talks with
Chelsea
to try and sign
Nicolas Jackson
.
The striker and his representatives are still in Munich, and the player has not given up on a move to Bayern.
Talks are understood to be ongoing between all parties over resurrecting the deal.
Jackson has his heart set on the move and his camp are doing all they can to make it happen.
The 24-year-old does not have to come back to the UK as things stand, as he is due to link up with Senegal this week for international duty.

live_updates.title: Bayern back in talks over Chelsea's Jackson
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol and Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayern Munich
are back in talks with
Chelsea
to try and sign
Nicolas Jackson
.
Jackson and his representatives are still in Munich and the player has not given up on a move to Bayern.
Talks are understood to be ongoing between all parties over resurrecting the deal.
Jackson has his heart set on the move and his camp are doing all they can to make it happen.
He does not have to come back to the UK as things stand as he is due to link up with Senegal this week for international duty.

live_updates.title: Bees in talks for Beier as potential Wissa replacement
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Brentford
are in talks with
Borussia Dortmund
over a deal for
Max Beier
as they seek a replacement for
Yoane
Wissa
.
Wissa still believes he will get his dream move to Newcastle before the window closes.
But the Beier deal is not an easy one to do - so there is still no guarantee Wissa will leave yet.
With so little time remaining,
Newcastle
are working on another move for Wissa behind the scenes.
They want to be ready to act, if and when they get the green light.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
the situation could go into the final hours of the window.
Wissa will not be involved again for Brentford this weekend, head coach Keith Andrews confirmed on Thursday.

live_updates.title: Brentford make £45m bid for Dortmund's Beier
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Exclusive from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have made a bid in the region of £45m for
Borussia Dortmund’s Max Beier.
It is on the table and now down to Dortmund to make a decision.

live_updates.title: Brentford moving on to other targets after Beier bid rejected
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have had a £45m bid rejected by
Borussia Dortmund
for forward
Max Beier.
As a result, Brentford are now moving on to other targets,
Sky Sports News
understands.
Meanwhile,
Newcastle
target
Yoane Wissa
is no closer to knowing what his future holds.

live_updates.title: Andrews: Schade is not to blame
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Keith Andrews
was quick to defend
Kevin Schade
after the
Brentford
attacker missed a penalty in their defeat to Sunderland.
Schade's decision to take the penalty raised questions after Igor Thiago, who scored a penalty last week, appeared to step aside.
"Bryan [Mbuemo] was the penalty taker since Ivan [Toney] left the building – it's something we’ve been conscious of for a while. We've worked on it a lot in training.
"I don’t put any blame on Kevin for missing the penalty – he's been outstanding since the start of pre-season."
Andrews was complimentary of his team despite the defeat, praising the squad's commitment despite upheaval at the club.
"The goal at the end was hard to swallow.
It’s been a difficult pre-season – the amount of changes has been tough, but everyone today has been absolutely committed."

live_updates.title: Brentford in talks for Veerman
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are in talks with
PSV
over the signing of
Joey Veerman.
He is a central midfielder, so unrelated to
Yoane Wissa's
predicament.
PSV are very reluctant to sell Veerman.

live_updates.title: Newcastle target Wissa demands Bees exit in bombshell statement
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
target
Yoane Wissa
has sensationally demanded to be sold by
Brentford
before the summer transfer window closes on Monday.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected for Wissa this summer, and the striker has taken to Instagram to reveal his frustrations at a move not materialising as he pushes for a switch to the Magpies before Monday's 7pm deadline.
Brentford are not commenting on Wissa's bombshell statement.
Sky Sports News
has also not seen evidence of the written assurances Wissa speaks of in his statement.

live_updates.title: Brentford set to end pursuit of PSV's Veerman
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are unlikely to continue their pursuit of
PSV Eindhoven
midfielder
Joey Veerman
.
The clubs have so far been unable to agree a valuation, and PSV want to keep him.
Brentford are still assessing targets, including left-wing, with less than 48 hours remaining.

live_updates.title: Newcastle must meet Wissa valuation and Bees need replacement for striker to move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have been willing to engage with
Newcastle
over
Yoane Wissa
, but his valuation must be met, and they want to replace him.
The Bees are yet to sign a replacement –
Dango Ouattara
was the replacement for
Bryan Mbeumo
.
They tried for
Max Beier
but were unable to agree a fee with
Borussia Dortmund
.
They will continue to work hard in the market and are assessing other targets with less than 48 hours to go.
Brentford have rejected two bids from Newcastle for Wissa so far this summer; one worth £25m and the second worth £40m.

live_updates.title: Newcastle remain in talks with Brentford over Wissa deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Newcastle
and
Brentford
over
Yoane Wissa
.
That has been the case for a number of weeks, but as it stands, the forward looks to be staying.
That is because Brentford have been adamant throughout this saga that they need to replace him before letting him go.
They have been unable to agree a deal with
Borussia Dortmund
for
Max Beier,
and the club are assessing other targets on Deadline Day.
The Bees also need his valuation to be met. Newcastle are aware of one, but Sky Sports News understands it is not the £65m reported elsewhere.
Wissa released a bullish statement yesterday demanding to leave.

live_updates.title: Newcastle growing optimistic on Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam, Pete Graves, Keith Downie and Lyall Thomas:
Newcastle
are growing increasingly optimistic of signing
Brentford
striker
Yoane Wissa
today.
Newcastle and Brentford are now locked in talks and getting closer to an agreement.
Discussions are around a fee in region of £50m, with the final details being discussed.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree £55m deal for Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a
£55m deal
with
Brentford
for
Yoane Wissa.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree £55m deal for Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a
£55m deal
with
Brentford
for
Yoane Wissa.
Wissa and his representatives in London awaiting final permission to travel to the North East for a medical after a deal agreed between the clubs.
Personal terms agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree £55m deal for Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a
£55m deal
with
Brentford
for
Yoane Wissa.
Wissa is already in Newcastle. He will have his medical this afternoon.
Personal terms have been agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree £55m deal for Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a
£55m deal
with
Brentford
for
Yoane Wissa.
Wissa is already in Newcastle. He will have his medical this afternoon.
Personal terms have been agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Brentford close to agreeing deal to sign Arsenal's Nelson
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are close to agreeing an initial loan deal with
Arsenal
for
Reiss Nelson
.
They are also discussing an option to buy him permanently as part of the deal.

live_updates.title: Palmeiras close to agreeing Pereira deal with Fulham
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Palmeiras
are close to agreeing a deal with
Fulham
over the signing of midfielder
Andreas Pereira
.
The deal is worth in the region of €10m (£8.6m)
Pereira had entered the final year of his Fulham contract - though the club did have the option to extend for a further year.

live_updates.title: Fulham making progress on Shakhtar's Kevin
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
are making progress towards an agreement for
Shakhtar’s Kevin.
There is still plenty of work to do to strike a deal - but Fulham are pushing hard in talks for the left-winger.
The club want to sign a right-winger as well and have interest in
Samuel Chukwueze
,
Raheem Sterling
and
Reiss Nelson
among others.
Fulham prefer to do permanent deals for younger players with potential but loans have not been ruled out.
Fulham also want to sign a new midfielder, with
Andreas Periera
increasingly likely to join Palmeiras.

live_updates.title: Silva frustrated as wait for signings goes on
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News' James Cole at the Fulham training ground:
"Marco Silva cut a frustrated figure at his press conference ahead of Saturday’s trip to Stamford Bridge.
"Fulham have still made just one signing in this transfer window: back-up keeper
Benjamin Lecomte
from Montpellier.
"That’s despite Silva’s repeated calls for reinforcements - specifically two wingers and a midfielder.
"Fulham are in talks to sign Shakhtar left winger
Kevin
, and are interested in AC Milan right winger,
Samuel Chukwueze
.
"However neither deal has yet materialised - and time is running out.
"Silva’s comments today sent a clear message to the club’s hierarchy: failure to deliver those three signings will make it impossible for the club to compete at the level they did last season.  The question is - are they listening?
"This feels like a crossroads moment for Silva and Fulham. He has just one season left on his contract, something which is making some fans very nervous about his long-term future at Craven Cottage."

live_updates.title: Roma make offer for Chelsea's George as Fulham eye move
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Adrian Kajumba:
Roma
have made an offer to sign
Chelsea
forward
Tyrique George
.
George has a number of options, including from
Fulham
and
Crystal Palace
, who are keeping an eye on his situation.
Bayern Munich
have also shown an interest, but they have explored a loan.
Chelsea's preference is to do a permanent deal.

live_updates.title: Palmeiras sign Pereira from Fulham
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Palmeiras
have announced the signing of
Andreas Pereira
from
Fulham
.
The deal for the midfielder is understood to be worth around £8.7m
The 29-year-old has signed a three-year contract with the Brazilian side.

live_updates.title: Silva slams 'unbelievable' decision to rule out King goal
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Marco Silva
has slammed the "unbelievable" decision to disallow
Josh King's
goal against
Chelsea
.
King thought he had opened the scoring in the 21st minute after racing into the box and tucking his effort past Robert Sanchez, only to see his celebrations cut short following a VAR review.
Rodrigo Muniz was deemed to have impeded Trevoh Chalobah with a "careless challenge" in the build-up to the goal, with the decision confirmed by referee Rob Jones to Stamford Bridge shortly after.
"Unbelievable decision, unbelievable. I am not in the best mood to [talk about it] but it was unbelievable how the goal was disallowed," Silva said in his post-match press conference.
"Harsh for him [King], a boy who was dreaming for this moment all of his career.
"Great moment for him and should not be disallowed.
"I would love to explain many things. The first goal - eight minutes extra time. After the first corner it was already nine minutes. It is time to stop the game. That is the rules.
"I asked the referee and he said because we lost time. But I checked the eight minutes. The game didn't stop.
"It's very difficult. I make mistakes, the referee makes mistakes, but when it is black or white, we cannot see something that is not there.
When asked if he had spoken to the match officials after the game, Silva added: "No, I did not speak with him. I spoke with him at half-time to try to understand why the goal was disallowed."
Silva also confirmed that he would not push for an official complaint to be sent to the PGMOL but did say they expect explanations.

live_updates.title: Fulham agree club-record deal to sign Kevin from Shakhtar Donetsk
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Fulham
agree club-record £34.6m (€40m) deal to sign
Kevin
from
Shakhtar Donetsk
.
The winger has arrived in London for a medical.
The deal will surpass the initial £27m paid by Fulham for Emile Smith-Rowe from Arsenal last summer.
The 22-year-old Brazilian could become just Fulham's second summer signing, with goalkeeper Benjamin Lecomte from Montpellier their only arrival so far.

live_updates.title: Fulham remain in talks for AC Milan winger Chukwueze
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
still want to sign a second winger after
Kevin
and remain in talks for AC Milan’s
Samuel Chukwueze
.
The 26-year-old is a long-term target, and Fulham made offers for the Nigeria international in January.
Fulham also admire
Dilane Bakwa
– a player
Nottingham Forest
are in talks for – but Chukwueze is thought to be the priority.
Fulham have also been interested in
Arsenal
winger
Reiss Nelson
, who also remains a target for
Crystal Palace
, and potentially
Chelsea
forward
Raheem Sterling
on loan.

live_updates.title: 'Fulham near agreement for Chukwueze' - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Fulham
are close to agreeing a loan deal with
AC Milan
for winger
Samuel Chukwueze
,according to
Sky in Italy.
Sky Sports News
have reported that the 26-year-old Nigeria international is a long-term target, and Fulham made offers for him in January.
Chukwueze scored five goals and registered three assists across 36 appearances last season.

live_updates.title: Howe: Hopefully Woltemade can score a load of goals for us
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Newcastle head coach Eddie Howe to Sky Sports on new signing Nick Woltemade:
"He's got a presence, that's for sure. A great guy, friendly and I'll think he'll add a lot to our changing room and on the pitch... hopefully he can score a load of goals for us.
On whether it can open the door for Isak's exit:
"I've got no idea on that. I'm totally separate from it an working on today."

live_updates.title: Howe clears up Schar confusion
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Newcastle head coach Eddie Howe to Sky Sports on Fabian Schar and whether he had concussion against Liverpool:
"Fabi was actually fine [he did not have concussion]. We made the decision to take him off because we couldn't risk going down to nine men.
"There was a little bit of confusion but he followed Premier League protocols and he was fine."

live_updates.title: Howe looking forward to 'clarity' on squad, but says group is stronger
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Eddie Howe
says he is looking forward to 'clarity' on what his squad looks like ahead of the transfer deadline, but adds his group is stronger than at this time last year.
There has been plenty of speculation around his team that remains unresolved, especially on the future of Alexander Isak.
Howe said he was not party to the talks on the striker so did not know how the situation would pan out.
Speaking about the deadline, Howe told
Sky Sports
: "We're really looking forward to that clarity in terms of what our squad looks like.
"Once we have that, we'll move forward and I'm sure we can do really well this year."
When asked if he was hoping for new arrivals, Howe added: "I'm not sure on that really. Being the manager, you're always hopeful.
"You think that you can add maybe one more that can make a difference, but there's no guarantee on that. We'll keep working to the end of the window.
"We're really pleased with what we've done so far. I genuinely feel we're a lot stronger squad-wise than we were last year.
"We've had an issue at the top end of the pitch [at the start of this season] so fingers crossed we might be able to do some more."
Newcastle announced new signing
Nick Woltemade
before Saturday's draw at Leeds, and Howe gave an insight into his new striker.
"He's a really good technician. His size will be a talking point because he's obviously a big presence, but he's not really a target man, although he can head the ball.
"It's his creativity around the box. It's his link play. He dribbles with the ball really well for someone so big and he's got real creativity around the box. He will find passes that not many other players can see.
"He can add a dimension that we currently don't have and it will lift confidence because when you feel you have goalscorers in your team,  the general level of your whole squad goes up.
"You've got to have lots of strings to your bow to be successful in England and he has them. I'm really looking forward to seeing him play in our team."

live_updates.title: Howe: Unlike us to be poor up front
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Newcastle head coach Eddie Howe to Sky Sports:
"I thought defensively, we were very strong. We've been really good in the three games so far in that respect, but we've got work to do at the other end of the pitch, which is really unlike us.
"We've historically been a really good attacking team, very free-scoring and very good at chance creation, but it hasn't quite been there. We're disappointed with that aspect of our play.
"I don't want to sit here and say that is the only reason [absent players]. We have to do better with what we have, but when you lose the quality of players that we have from last season to this, Anthony Gordon is a big miss and Joelinton. Alex [Isak] is a huge player for us. so take those three players away and you're going to suffer slightly.
"But I still think we've got really good players on the pitch and we need to do better."

live_updates.title: Strand Larsen missing in Wolves defeat
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
target
Jorgen Strand Larsen
was left out of Wolves' defeat to Everton on Saturday after the Magpies submitted bids for him earlier this week.
And Wolves boss Vitor Pereira did suggest the striker would still be at the club at the conclusion of the transfer window, reiterating that the reason for his omission for his game was the result of an inflamed Achilles tendon suffered against Bournemouth.

live_updates.title: Newcastle target Wissa demands Brentford exit in bombshell statement
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
target
Yoane Wissa
has sensationally demanded to be sold by
Brentford
before the summer transfer window closes on Monday.

live_updates.title: Newcastle must meet Wissa valuation and Bees need replacement for striker to move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have been willing to engage with
Newcastle
over
Yoane Wissa
, but his valuation must be met, and they want to replace him.
The Bees are yet to sign a replacement –
Dango Ouattara
was the replacement for
Bryan Mbeumo
.
They tried for
Max Beier
but were unable to agree a fee with
Borussia Dortmund
.
They will continue to work hard in the market and are assessing other targets with less than 48 hours to go.
Brentford have rejected two bids from Newcastle for Wissa so far this summer; one worth £25m and the second worth £40m.

live_updates.title: Newcastle must meet Wissa valuation and Bees need replacement for striker to move
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
have been willing to engage with
Newcastle
over
Yoane Wissa
, but his valuation must be met, and they want to replace him.
The Bees are yet to sign a replacement –
Dango Ouattara
was the replacement for
Bryan Mbeumo
.
They tried for
Max Beier
but were unable to agree a fee with
Borussia Dortmund
.
They will continue to work hard in the market and are assessing other targets with less than 48 hours to go.
Brentford have rejected two bids from Newcastle for Wissa so far this summer; one worth £25m and the second worth £40m.

live_updates.title: Newcastle accept Liverpool's £125m Isak bid
live_updates.author: Sahil Jaidka
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Liverpool
and
Newcastle
have agreed a British-record transfer for Alexander Isak.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay a fixed fee of £125m for the striker.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Anfield, with the 25-year-old set to start his Deadline Day medical this morning.

live_updates.title: What is the latest on Newcastle's Wissa chase?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas and Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Newcastle
and
Brentford
over
Yoane Wissa
.
That has been the case for a number of weeks – but as it stands the player looks to be staying.
That is because Brentford have been adamant throughout this saga that they need to replace him before letting him go.
They have been unable to agree a deal with Borussia Dortmund for
Max Beier
and the club are assessing other targets on Deadline Day.
Brentford also need his valuation to be met. Newcastle aware of what the valuation is – but Sky Sports News understands it is not the £65m reported elsewhere.
Wissa released a bullish statement on Sunday demanding to leave.

live_updates.title: Has Isak travelled for Sweden's World Cup Qualifiers?
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill in Stockholm:
"In this room, from 11am, the national coach of Sweden, Jon Dahl Tomasson, will give the latest on
Alexander Isak
from his point of view.
"Isak was a due to be with his Sweden team-mates in Stockholm today.
"Has he travelled? Will he travel?"

live_updates.title: Newcastle growing optimistic on Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam, Pete Graves, Keith Downie and Lyall Thomas:
Newcastle
growing increasingly optimistic of signing
Brentford
striker
Yoane Wissa
today.
Newcastle and Brentford are now locked in talks and getting closer to an agreement.
Discussions are around a fee in region of £50m, with the final details being discussed.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree £55m deal for Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a
£55m deal
with
Brentford
for
Yoane Wissa.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree £55m deal for Brentford's Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a
£55m deal
with
Brentford
for
Yoane Wissa.
Wissa released a bullish statement on Sunday demanding to leave Brentford.
Brentford have been adamant throughout this saga that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree deal with Brentford for Wissa
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
The agreement is understood to be an initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.
Brentford were adamant throughout this window that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected this summer, before Wissa released a
bombshell statement
on Sunday demanding to be sold before Monday's deadline.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree deal with Brentford for Wissa
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
The agreement is understood to be an initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.
Brentford were adamant throughout this window that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.

bombshell statement
on Sunday demanding to be sold before Monday's deadline.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree deal with Brentford for Wissa

live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
The agreement is understood to be an initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.
Brentford were adamant throughout this window that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected this summer, before Wissa released a
bombshell statement
on Sunday demanding to be sold before Monday's deadline.
Wissa and his representatives are in London awaiting final permission to travel to the North East for a medical.
Personal terms have been agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Isak arrives at Liverpool training ground for medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor:
Alexander Isak
has arrived at
Liverpool’s
training ground and a medical is underway.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay
Newcastle
a fixed fee of £125m for the striker - which is a British record.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Wissa in Newcastle ahead of medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie, Dharmesh Sheth, Mark McAdam, and Lyall Thomas:
Yoane Wissa
is already in the North East ahead of a £55m move to
Newcastle
.
The forward will have his medical this afternoon.
Personal terms have already been agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Newcastle close in on Wissa
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text: Brentford's Yoane Wissa edges closer to his much-desired move to Newcastle as the two clubs agree a deal of £55m for the striker.

live_updates.title: Tomasson: Isak to link up with Sweden squad on Monday
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill in Stockholm:
Sweden
head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed
Alexander Isak
is in the UK to complete his British-record transfer to
Liverpool,
but will link up with the national team later today, saying: "I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today.
"He is extremely professional and has a good mentality. He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries [his head is in right place to play]
"He’s not able to play for 90 minutes, but he can be a game changer.
Tomasson says Isak won’t arrive in time for training this afternoon, with the player likely to now arrive this evening.

live_updates.title: Tomasson: Isak to link up with Sweden squad on Monday
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz

Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill in Stockholm:
Sweden

has confirmed

is in the UK to complete his British-record transfer to

but will link up with the national team later today, saying: "I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today.
"He is extremely professional and has a good mentality. He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries [his head is in right place to play]
"He’s not able to play for 90 minutes, but he can be a game changer.
Tomasson says Isak won’t arrive in time for training this afternoon, with the player likely to now arrive this evening.

live_updates.title: Newcastle agree deal with Brentford for Wissa
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Newcastle
have agreed a deal worth up to £55m with
Brentford
for forward
Yoane Wissa
.
The agreement is understood to be an initial £50m plus £5m in add-ons.
Wissa has agreed to a four-year deal at the Magpies.
Brentford were adamant throughout this window that they need to replace Wissa before letting him go.
Newcastle have had multiple offers rejected this summer, before Wissa released a
bombshell statement
on Sunday demanding to be sold before Monday's deadline.
Wissa and his representatives are in London awaiting final permission to travel to the North East for a medical.
Personal terms have been agreed in principle.

live_updates.title: Eintracht make Deadline Day bid for Osula
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie and Rob Jones:
Eintracht Frankfurt
have made a Deadline Day bid for
Newcastle
striker
William Osula
.
Package under discussion is around £28.5m.
Aston Villa
have also enquired as to the Osula’s availability in the last 48 hours.
The 22-year-old scored on Monday against
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Eintracht Frankfurt make Deadline Day bid for Osula
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Keith Downie and Rob Jones:
Eintracht Frankfurt
have made a Deadline Day bid for
Newcastle
striker
William Osula
.
The package under discussion is around £28.5m.
Aston Villa
have also enquired about Osula’s availability in the last 48 hours.
The 22-year-old scored for the Magpies last Monday against
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Downie: Newcastle could cash in on Osula
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News' Keith Downie:
"We were told earlier that one may leave Newcastle today. They are in talks with Eintracht Frankfurt over the potential departure of striker William Osula.
"This is a player who has only been at the club for a season. Newcastle paid just £10m for him and has struggled for game time, but he did score against Liverpool last week on
Monday Night Football
.
"We’re told there’s a package worth £28m in discussion. There’s also been interest from Aston Villa over a loan move I the last 24 hours.
"You’d say Osula who has struggled for game time, has been pushed down the pecking order after the arrivals of Nick Woltemade and Yoane Wissa once it’s completed, he’ll probably be allowed to go on loan, or if a big package is agreed with Frankfurt, I think Newcastle will cash in."

live_updates.title: Why Szoboszlai is indispensible to Slot
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
The Radar
column breaks down the qualities that make
Dominik
Szoboszlai
indispensable to
Arne Slot
at
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Guehi's future remains up in the air
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' chief correspondent Kaveh Solhekol:
Marc Guehi’s
future is up in the air with 72 hours to go until the window closes.
There has been no movement so far today regarding any potential bids for the
Crystal Palace
captain.
Eagles boss
Oliver Glasner
said Guehi has to stay and would be impossible to replace.
Palace chairman
Steve Parish
has said they cannot let him leave as a free agent next summer.
Liverpool
were in talks about signing the defender earlier this month.
Palace and Liverpool are both preparing for games on Sunday.

live_updates.title: AC Milan considering Gomez move - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Liverpool
defender
Joe Gomez
is among the alternatives
AC Milan
are considering in case they are unable to sign
Manchester City
defender
Manuel Akanji
, according to
Sky in Italy.
Milan want a centre-back and are pushing to sign Akanji, with the Italian club willing to pay £13m for the 30-year-old.
However, they are considering alternatives with the Switzerland international thought to prefer staying in England.
Liverpool defender Gomez and Villarreal's
Juan Foyth,
formerly of Tottenham, are the names being evaluated.

live_updates.title: Liverpool's Champions League fixtures
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
September 17: Atletico Madrid (A), kick-off 8pm
September 30: Galatasaray (A), kick-off 8pm
October 22: Eintracht Frankfurt (A), kick-off 8pm

live_updates.title: Gakpo signs new long-term Liverpool deal
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Cody Gakpo
has signed a new long-term contract at
Liverpool.
The forward joined the club two-and-a-half-years ago and will now extend his stay with the Reds.
Gakpo told
Liverpoolfc.com
: “It feels amazing to extend the contract here at this beautiful club. I’m very grateful and hopefully I can give back many more beautiful moments.
“I feel at home, my family feels at home and that’s also a big decision always. They feel good. I’m very happy at the club, a good group, good teammates, so the life around the football itself is very good and I enjoy every moment of it. I’m very grateful that I can extend.”

live_updates.title: Liverpool make £35m Guehi bid
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam, Kaveh Solhekol, Lyall Thomas and Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
have made a £35m offer for
Crystal Palace
defender
Marc Guehi.
The bid is currently being considered by Palace.
However, the South London club do not want to sell the defender until they have a replacement.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool's
Joe Gomez
has become a part of discussions between the clubs.
Palace have an interest in Gomez - and it would be a separate deal - but how keen he is on the move to Selhurst Park at this stage is unknown.
Liverpool would not allow Gomez to leave on loan and they are also reluctant to sell a player who offers so much versatility in their backline.
Gomez is also on the lists at
AC Milan
and
Tottenham
, although
Thomas Frank
has appeared to cool his interest in signing a new centre-back.
Milan appear to be prioritising
Manchester City's Manuel Akanji
at the moment - another player of interest to Palace and on Spurs' radar.
Guehi's future could go right to the wire with Deadline Day approaching on September 1.
Palace boss Oliver Glasner has pleaded for the player to stay at the club until his contract expires next summer.
Palace could sign more than one new centre-back. Separately from the Guehi situation, they are progressing with a £22.5m deal for
Toulouse's
19-year-old
Jaydee Canvot
.

live_updates.title: AC Milan prioritising move for Gomez
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Italy's Gianluca Di Marzio:
AC Milan
are currently prioritising a move for
Liverpool
defender
Joe Gomez
, according to
Sky in Italy
.
The Serie A side appear to have moved on from
Manchester City
defender
Manuel Akanji
after receiving little encouragement that he is open to the move.
Gomez has been discussed in talks between Liverpool and
Crystal Palace
for
Marc Guehi
.
Palace have an interest in Gomez - and it would be a separate deal - but how keen he is on the move to Selhurst Park at this stage is unknown.
Liverpool would not allow Gomez to leave on loan, and they are also reluctant to sell a player who offers so much versatility in their backline.

live_updates.title: Konate off injured as Guehi starts for Palace
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Ibrahima Konate
limped off injured against Arsenal on Sunday as
Liverpool
transfer target
Marc Guehi
started for Crystal Palace at Aston Villa.

live_updates.title: Keane: Champions find a way to win when not at their best
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Roy Keane at Anfield:
"We talk about Liverpool’s problems in the last few games with their defending where they’ve given up chances, but you still have to beat them.
"It’s the sign of a good team that you win football matches when you’re not at your best. That’s what champions do and that’s what they’ve done.
"They’ll improve and they still might get a transfer in the next 48 hours.
"We said at half-time that Arsenal were comfortable and would there be a reaction from Liverpool? You bet your life there would be because that’s what champions too.
"They deserved it on their second half performance."

live_updates.title: Carra: Absolutely huge win for Liverpool
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Jamie Carragher at Anfield:
"Absolutely huge.
"Liverpool have nine points out of nine. They've played two really difficult games - Newcastle away and Arsenal at home. And they've been nowhere near their best. What a position they find themselves in. Get the transfer window out of the way and then come back after the international break and I'm sure we'll see a lot better from Liverpool in these next few months.
"Szoboszlai has been revitalised. Absolutely outstanding. It's almost like they've found a position for him now, playing at right-back. Outstanding in the last few games. We've heard so much about his ability to hit shots from a distance. We haven't seen it too much for Liverpool but, wow, what a goal."

live_updates.title: Will Liverpool be busy on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Liverpool
boss
Arne Slot
joked that while he will be flying home to the Netherlands on Deadline Day, the club will be looking to stregthen their squad.
The future of Reds target
Alexander Isak
remains unresolved after Liverpool made a bid for him earlier in the window.
Speaking to Sky Sports after beating Arsenal, Slot said: "Quite busy, because I have to take a flight at two o'clock to go back to Holland.
"On a serious note, let's wait and see. It was positive for me that I could bring a few good substitutions in, but I haven't spoken to Richard [Hughes] yet, so I don't think it's a surprise that we are trying to see if we can strengthen the squad.
"But if that is not possible, we are more than happy to do it with this team, because they have shown that they can compete."

live_updates.title: Tsimikas joins Roma
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Liverpool
left-back
Kostas Tsimikas
has joined
Roma
on a season-long loan.
Tsimikas has fallen down the pecking order at Anfield since the arrival of Milos Kerkez.
He has not featured in a single matchday squad for Arne Slot this season.

live_updates.title: Konate off injured as Guehi scores for Palace
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Ibrahima Konate
limped off injured against Arsenal on Sunday as
Liverpool
transfer target
Marc Guehi
started and then scored for Crystal Palace at Aston Villa.
Konate put in an impressive display against the Gunners after struggling in the opening games of this season.
With Liverpool linked with a deadline day move for Palace's Guehi, questions over whether they need to sign another central defender will ramp up after Konate's injury.
Joe Gomez
came on for Konate at Anfield, while
Florian Wirtz
was also forced off for Liverpool.
"I don't think it's a surprise that we are trying to see if we can strengthen the squad," said Arne Slot to
Sky Sports
when asked if it will be a busy deadline day.
"But if that is not possible, we are more than happy to do it with this team, because they have shown that they can compete."

live_updates.title: Isak set for medical after British-record deal agreed
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Liverpool
and
Newcastle
have agreed a British-record transfer for Alexander Isak.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay a fixed fee of £125m for the striker.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Liverpool and is set for a medical on Monday morning.
Read more here:

live_updates.title: Van Dijk on Gomez future: Let's see what happens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Liverpool
captain
Virgil van Dijk
says he wants his fellow defender
Joe Gomez
to stay at the club on Deadline Day.
Gomez has been linked with a move away from Anfield amid the Reds' interest in
Marc Guehi
, who will compete for a spot with Van Dijk and fellow centre-back
Ibrahima Konate
.
"Of course (I want him to stay), he’s my friend!" said Van Dijk about Gomez after the 1-0 win over Arsenal on Sunday.
"But it doesn’t work like that. I’m not the boss, this is not a friendly business. Let’s see what happens Of course I want him to stay, as a friend and as a player."

live_updates.title: Could Guehi remain at Crystal Palace?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News'
Mark McAdam analyses whether
Marc Guehi
could stay at
Crystal Palace
amid interest from
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Isak set for medical after British-record deal agreed
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Liverpool
and
Newcastle
have agreed a British-record transfer for Alexander Isak.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay a fixed fee of £125m for the striker.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Liverpool and is set for a medical on Monday morning.
Read more here:

live_updates.title: Isak set to feature in Sweden World Cup qualifiers
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Just a reminder folks that
Alexander Isak
, 25, has been named in
Sweden's
squad for their upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Slovenia and Kosovo.
"I am very happy that Alexander Isak wants to be in the squad," said Sweden coach Jon Dahl Tomasson. "He is a huge player. The situation he is in is not perfect, and he has not trained with the team.
"But he is a player who can decide matches, and he wants to be part of our squad. The World Cup is important for Alexander Isak."
Liverpool and Newcastle have agreed a British-record transfer for Isak.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay a fixed fee of £125m for the striker, who is now expected to complete his move to Anfield on Deadline Day.
Isak is set to sign a six-year deal with Liverpool and begin his medical on Monday morning.

live_updates.title: Has Isak travelled for Sweden's World Cup Qualifiers?
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill in Stockholm:
"In this room, from 11am, the national coach of Sweden, Jon Dahl Tomasson, will give the latest on
Alexander Isak
from his point of view.
"Isak was a due to be with his Sweden team-mates in Stockholm today.
"Has he travelled? Will he travel?"

live_updates.title: Isak arrives at Liverpool training ground for medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor:
Alexander Isak
has arrived at
Liverpool’s
training ground and a medical is underway.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay
Newcastle
a fixed fee of £125m for the striker - which is a British record.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Villa hold informal talks over Liverpool's Elliott
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Jones and Vinny O'Connor:
Aston Villa
have had informal conversations with
Liverpool
over attacker
Harvey Elliott.
Everything is on the table at the moment in terms of loan or a permanent deal.
The arrival o
f Alexander Isak
at Liverpool has opened up a potential departure for Elliott.
Elliott has been linked with
RB Leipzig
this summer but they are way off on their valuation of the player.

live_updates.title: EXCLUSIVE: Liverpool receive Milan offer for Gomez but deal unlikely
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Vinny O'Connor:
Liverpool
have received an offer from
AC Milan
for
Joe Gomez,
but it looks unlikely the deal can be completed in time before tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Liverpool will categorically not allow Gomez to leave, unless they have
Marc Guehi
or another top-level centre-back in. Arne Slot is keen to have both Guehi and Gomez in his squad.
Milan’s owners, Red Bird Capital, also have a stake in Fenway Sports Group, who own Liverpool, and the two sides talked late into Sunday night before thrashing out terms on Gomez moving to Italy.
Separately,
Sky Sports News
is told Milan held talks with Gomez’s representatives and were close to agreeing a deal before the plug was pulled.
The deal was entirely dependent on Liverpool completing a deal for Guehi to move to Anfield from Crystal Palace - and whilst that transfer is still active, both sides feel there isn’t enough time to complete the necessary logistics to do the Gomez move after Guehi.
Gomez was poised to fly to Italy, but Liverpool haven’t given him permission to do so.

live_updates.title: How can Liverpool afford Isak?
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Football finance expert Kieran Maguire on Sky Sports:
“Yes, the [Isak] deal is feasible for Liverpool. Part of the reason is that when you sign a player, you spread the cost over the length of the contract.
"The players coming in are usually on five-year contracts. So, if you take £500m and divide it by five, that works out at £100m per year in what we call amortisation in the accounts.
"Liverpool have also done really well this season in terms of outgoing transfers. Diaz and Nunez have been sold, along with some academy players, and that income counts as pure profit.
"Liverpool, who always operate a smart financial system and are never in danger of PSR issues, therefore have plenty of capacity to spend money this summer.”

live_updates.title: sak to join up with Sweden camp once Liverpool medical complete
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Gary Cotterill in Sweden:
Sweden head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed
Alexander Isak
is in the UK to complete his transfer to
Liverpool
, but will link up with the national team later today.
“I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today. He is extremely professional and has a good mentality."
Asked whether the forward's head is in the right place to play, he added: "He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries
“He’s not able to play for 90 minutes, but he can be a game-changer.”
Tomasson says Isak won’t arrive in time for training this afternoon.
It’s likely he will arrive this evening.

live_updates.title: Tomasson: Isak to link up with Sweden squad on Monday
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill in Stockholm:
Sweden
head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed

live_updates.title: Guehi's Palace future hanging in balance
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra:
Marc Guehi's
Crystal Palace
future hangs in the balance heading into the final hours of the window.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that it’s “50/50” whether the England defender moves to Liverpool or not.
The club are currently tying up deals to bring central defenders
Jaydee Canvot
and
Igor Jesus
on Deadline Day.
However, signing the pair does not mean that Guehi will definitely depart Palace today.
Palace are reluctant to sell their club captain but losing Guehi for free would be a bitter pill to swallow.
He has entered the final year of his deal at Selhurst Park.

live_updates.title: Liverpool target Guehi's Palace future hanging in balance
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:

live_updates.title: Aston Villa in advanced Elliott talks
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Vinny O'Connor & Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy.
The package under discussion is worth £35m for the 22-year-old forward.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs, with Elliott still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Liverpool preparing for Guehi medical
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Mark McAdam, Vinny O’Connor & Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
are preparing for
Marc Guehi
to have a medical in London knowing that any deal with
Crystal Palace
to sign him could go close to tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Any agreement between the two clubs will hinge on Palace being able to bolster their defensive ranks before they sign off a move for Guehi, but talks with Liverpool’s bosses remain very much alive.
To that end, the Brighton defender
Igor Julio
is currently undergoing a medical before sealing a move to Selhurst Park - although the Eagles have concerns that
West Ham
may make a late move to try to persuade Igor to join them.
Until Igor is confirmed, Palace are adamant they will not let Guehi leave.
Sky Sports News
has been told Liverpool want to make sure they have all the medical provisions in place and ready, should a deal be struck, and Guehi would then be given permission to travel to try to complete a move.
The Palace captain is understood to be “in the area” and awaiting  further developments.

live_updates.title: Liverpool preparing for Guehi medical

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai? All the sudden Writz is in there, a £100 million player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
"For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai?
"All the sudden Writz is in there, a £100 million player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: Merson: Not all over with Isak
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"Oh, I like him [Isak]. He’s a good player, but I don’t think it’s all over just because he’s signed. I don’t see it like that. The problem is Liverpool haven’t played well,  yet they’ve beaten Newcastle and Arsenal. That’s the issue: they’ve not been at their best, but they’ve still got those results.
"It all depends on whether it works. You can have the best players in the world, but if it doesn’t gel, you don’t have the chemistry. When Liverpool were at their best, it was Mane, Salah and Firmino. Firmino would drop off, Salah would make those runs in, and Mane too, there was chemistry.
"For me, Firmino wasn’t a £125 million player, but he made it all tick. Unless this new set-up gels, time will tell. What Slot has now is a lot of head-scratching, because he’s got big decisions to make with very good players."

live_updates.title: Arteta: Berta has done a fantastic job
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Mikel Arteta
has told
Sky Sports News
he is delighted with
Arsenal's
summer transfer business and says sporting director
Andrea Berta
has done a "fantastic job" during the window.
The Gunners made their seventh signing of the summer when they confirmed the £67.5m arrival of
Eberechi Eze
from Crystal Palace last weekend. They are in talks over a deal to add Bayer Leverkusen defender
Piero Hincapie
too.
"Very happy," Arteta said in an interview with
Sky Sports News
. "A lot has happened during the summer. Obviously, we were losing some big players as well. A few players were still injured for a long time.
"So, I really liked what we've done. The type of characters, personalities we have recruited, the way we have increased the quality and the depth of the squad at the same time, and the way especially they have connected and collaborated with the team.
"I think it was [a time to refresh]. I think as well the demands that we are putting on those players, the standards, and the demand that we have now as a football club, as a team.
"So, we required this and, as I said, we acted. The club was very aggressive, very determined. Andrea has done a fantastic job there with his team and I'm very, very glad with the outcome."

live_updates.title: Arteta delights at Dowman debut and salutes academy
live_updates.author: Nick Wright
live_updates.text:
Mikel Arteta
has talked up the importance of
Arsenal's
Hale End academy after handing a debut to 15-year-old
Max Dowman
in last weekend's 5-0 win over Leeds.
Dowman became the Premier League's second-youngest player and joins a list of Hale End graduates in the firs-team set-up which includes
Bukayo Saka
,
Ethan Nwaneri
and
Myles Lewis-Skelly
.
"It's one of the most satisfying things I think," Arteta said to
Sky Sports News
of using Dowman last weekend.
"There are no words to describe how you feel when you see a 15-year-old making his debut in the Premier League for our club.
"It was probably the highlight of the day and looking at his family, the people, his team-mates, how they reacted to that moment, our supporters, how they lifted the energy. It was a beautiful moment."
Asked about the pathway from the academy, Arteta said: "Very important. We are very lucky in recent years that we have a few very good examples of exactly what we want to produce and how they can respond and what they can create and the way they can impact the team as well.
"We have to continue to work on that and make sure that pathway is always open. It's the first thing that we look at when we need to improve the size of the squad, the qualities or many other options and hopefully they feel that here."

live_updates.title: Stuttgart remain in talks to sign Arsenal's Vieira
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Stuttgart
remain in talks with
Arsenal
for
Fabio Vieira
.
Vieira is into the final two years of his deal.
The attacking midfielder spent last season on loan at former club Porto.

live_updates.title: Arsenal agree deal to sign Leverkusen defender Hincapie
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Arsenal
have agreed a deal with
Bayer Leverkusen
to sign defender
Piero Hincapie
.
The deal is a season-long loan with an option to buy, with the package worth £45m.
The Ecuador international has been given permission to travel for a medical this weekend.
A five-year contract has been agreed with the 23-year-old if the option is triggered.
The Hincapie deal will accelerate
Porto's
move for
Jakub Kiwior
.
The deal for the Poland international is a loan with an obligation to buy and is worth £24m.
