live_updates.title: Leverkusen defender Hincapie travelling to London for Arsenal medical
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayer Leverkusen
defender
Piero Hincapie
is travelling to London ahead of undergoing a medical with
Arsenal
.
The two clubs have agreed a season-long loan deal which includes an option to buy.
Including the loan fee, the total package is worth £45m if Arsenal sign the 23-year-old permanently.
The Ecuador international has agreed a five-year contract at Arsenal if the option is triggered.

live_updates.title: Saliba limps off at Liverpool to add to Arsenal injury list
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
suffered another injury to a key player on Sunday, with
William Saliba
forced off in the fifth minute at Liverpool.
The centre-back appeared to injure himself while challenging Liverpool forward Hugo Ekitike for a high ball.
Saliba dropped to the turf and after a brief inspection was replaced by Cristhian Mosquera.
Saliba joins
Kai Havertz, Gabriel Jesus, Bukayo Saka, Christian Norgaard
and
Ben White
in the treatment room, while captain
Martin Odegaard
was only fit enough to begin the game on the bench at Anfield.

live_updates.title: Arteta: I am so proud, but we need to find a way
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Mikel Arteta speaking to Sky Sports:
"Very proud of my players, I think both teams elevated the game to a level that there was no margins between the two and very little happens, a lot of action in many areas, not that much in the boxes.
"It was going to be decided in two possible actions, an individual error or a magic moment and it was decided in a magic moment.
“You cannot dominate here for 95 minutes, it’s impossible and you're going to go through those moments and it was a moment when our keeper had the ball in their hands and then we didn't have any sequences of play afterwards but we navigated without concede anything but at the end you need to find a way to win these big matches.
"You have to put the ball in the back of the net when you have it, we were much better than last year when we drew the game, much, much better.
"Today when we have three, four or five situations inside the box, one vs one, when Eze is completely through just to finish the action. You have to put those balls in the back of the net if you want to win the game."

live_updates.title: Raya: Goalkeepers need to adapt to new PL ball
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
goalkeeper
David Raya
said he still has to "adapt" to the new Premier League ball after he was beaten by Dominik Szoboszlai's long-range free-kick.
Szoboszlai's stunner gave Liverpool a late 1-0 victory at Anfield and Raya suggested the ball, which is supplied by Puma this season rather than Nike, made his task of saving it harder.
Raya told
Sky Sports:
"I haven't seen it [the goal] back yet. Disappointed not to save it like every goal you concede. I think it's a hell of a strike.
"I remember the ball moving a lot and moving away from me. Hopefully, the next one I can save.
"It's a very good strike, especially with the new balls and everything. We still have to adapt. It's going away from me so it's harder to gauge and save it.
"It's different to the Nike ball so we have to adapt to it. The grip is different, the kick is different.
"We just have to adapt after playing with the Nike ball for many years. It's the same for everybody."

live_updates.title: Vieira and Lokonga likely to join Hamburg
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Green:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira
is now likely to join
Hamburg
on a season-long loan.
There have been talks involving Vieira with
Stuttgart
throughout the window, but they moved to a different target.
Negotiations between the two clubs continue today.
Albert Sambi Lokonga
also likely to head to Hamburg but on a permanent basis.

live_updates.title: What can happen at Arsenal on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
have had a very busy summer but their activity is not over yet.
The Gunners are set to announce
Piero Hincapie
as their eighth summer signing from
Bayer Leverkusen.
The rest of Arsenal's focus is set to be on outgoings.
Jakub Kiwior
will join
Porto
if the Hincapie deal is announced before the deadline.
Reiss Nelson
,
Oleksandr Zinchenko
,
Albert Sambi Lokonga
and
Fabio Vieira
could all leave Arsenal before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Saliba pulls out of France squad
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
The French Football Federation have confirmed that
William Saliba
has pulled out of their upcoming squad for their World Cup qualifiers.
The
Arsenal
defender limped out early on in his team’s defeat to Liverpool on Sunday. The FFF said Saliba has picked up an ankle sprain.
Benjamin Pavard has been called up to replace Saliba for their World Cup qualifiers against Ukraine and Iceland.

live_updates.title: Hincapie's Arsenal position
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News:
“Hincapie is left-footed and can also play at left-back. Arsenal are already well covered in those areas with Gabriel and Calafiori, so I’m not sure where he would fit in. It’s a lot of money to pay when you’ve already got those positions covered.”

live_updates.title: Brentford close to agreeing deal to sign Arsenal's Nelson
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are close to agreeing an initial loan deal with
Arsenal
for
Reiss Nelson
.
They are also discussing an option to buy him permanently as part of the deal.

live_updates.title: Vieira and Lokonga likely to join Hamburg
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Green:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira
is now likely to join
Hamburg
on a season-long loan.
Vieira's medical with Hamburg is under way, according to
Sky in Germany
.
There have been talks involving Vieira with
Stuttgart
throughout the window, but they moved to a different target.
Negotiations between the two clubs continue today.
Albert Sambi Lokonga
also likely to head to Hamburg but on a permanent basis.

live_updates.title: Guardiola refuses to speak on transfers
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Man City manager Pep Guardiola when asked about transfers:
"Monday is the finish of the transfer window. Next press conference, you can ask me.
"Don't ask me about rumours or potential rivals or potential flies."
On whether he is happy with his squad:
"I always have been."

live_updates.title: Guardiola on his No 1 choice: Everything clearer after internationals and transfers
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Man City manager Pep Guardiola on whether he has in his mind who is his No 1 goalkeeper:
"In this part of the season, before the internationals and before the transfer window is closed, everything is possible.
"After that, when we are going to play Man Utd, in the Champions League, Arsenal, then everything will be clearer and we will take the decisions.
"It depends on the performance and many reasons."

live_updates.title: Guardiola: I am happy if squad size stays as it is
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Man City manager Pep Guardiola on how he feels about his squad size after previously saying he would like to work with a smaller squad:
"I'm not a manager that has complained much here about the squad.
"It is what it is because I know the club is doing as best as possible in all terms.
"Even when I lose a game, the typical reaction of the manager is blame to the players and so on what has happened.
"I proved for many years and last year was the biggest example of that and I am very proud of that because I know my players tried desperately to do well.
"I said that I didn't like to have players at home but the reality has been like that for a long time and if it stays as it stays, then I will be more than pleased and I'll handle it day by day."

live_updates.title: Could there be an upset at the Amex as Man City face Brighton?
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala:
"The big question between me and all the other journalists here at Man City was, 'who is Pep's number one?'.
"I had asked the Man City manager about James Trafford and whether he would be starting against Spurs last week and Guardiola replied he'd decide at dinner that evening.
"This time around he'll make a call on Trafford versus Ederson - or Ortega or Bettinelli - tomorrow.
"Trafford is quite an unflappable personality. Sometimes he might come across as arrogant but it's purely the steely persona that a goalkeeper must develop and the City boss admitted that the England man had reflected on his difficult performance in their 2-0 defeat against Sours.
"City 'always' put their arms around their players shoulders, Guardiola told us.
"Trafford is in Thomas Tuchel's England squad and Rodri has been recalled for Spain, despite only just coming back from injury, but his club boss says he's happy for Luis de la Fuente to give his midfielder minutes, so long as he comes back in one piece.
"On transfers, I was given short shrift. The window closes at 7pm on Monday but it sounds like Savinho will be staying.
"Brighton provides another test on Sunday. I don't think we'll see City back to their best just yet and whilst they get up to speed, there's every chance of an upset at the Amex on the weekend."

live_updates.title: AC Milan working on Akanji deal - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky in Italy's Gianluca Di Marzio:
AC Milan
are working on a deal to sign
Manchester City
defender
Manuel Akanji
, according to
Sky in Italy
.
Milan are willing to pay Man City nearly £13m (€15m) for the 30-year-old.
Milan do not anticipate having any issues reaching an agreement with City, but will only make their move if they receive encouragement that he wants to join.
It is claimed Akanji would prefer to stay in England.
Crystal Palace
are also interested in the Switzerland international.
AC Milan sporting director
Igli Tare
says they have been trying to convince Akanji to join them.
Asked about Akanji, he told
Sky in Italy
: "We haven't convinced him yet.
"The change in formation has put us in a bit of difficulty, so we need to do our best in the last 72 hours to bring in an experienced player.
"Akanji has the profile, as well as the quality to play for Milan."

live_updates.title: Akanji and Ederson on Man City bench amid transfer interest
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manuel Akanji
is on the bench for
Manchester City
against Brighton, live on
Sky Sports
.
The defender has been the subject of interest from
Galatasaray
and
AC Milan
.
Sky in Italy
are reporting that Milan received little encouragement that he wanted to join and appear to have moved on.
The Switzerland international was not in the squad for the defeat to Spurs last weekend.
Goalkeeper
James Trafford
retains his starting spot ahead of
Ederson
, who is on the bench and is a
Galatasaray
target.

live_updates.title: Brighton super subs inflict another defeat on Man City
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text: Manchester City suffered their second defeat from their opening three Premier League games after collapsing to a late 2-1 loss at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Guardiola confirms two-month Cherki injury lay-off
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Pep Guardiola
has confirmed
Rayan Cherki
has suffered an injury that could see him miss both the upcomingManchester derby and a trip to
Arsenal
.
The £34m summer signing from Lyon was absent from City's squad as Guardiola's side suffered a 2-1 defeat at Brighton.
Asked about the 21-year-old's absence, Guardiola said the midfielder could be out for at least "two months".
The France international's injury lay-off could see Cherki miss  Manchester United's visit to the Etihad after the international break, a clash at the Emirates and the beginning of City's Champions League campaign, where they will take on former player Kevin de Bruyne's Napoli, Monaco and Villarreal.
Cherki has made two appearances for City so far, scoring off the bench on his debut at Wolves and starting his side's defeat to Tottenham.

live_updates.title: Guardiola confirms two-month Cherki injury lay-off
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Pep Guardiola
has confirmed
Rayan Cherki
has suffered an injury that could see him miss both the upcoming Manchester derby and a trip to
Arsenal
.
The £34m summer signing from Lyon was absent from City's squad as Guardiola's side suffered a 2-1 defeat at Brighton.
Asked about the 21-year-old's absence, Guardiola said the midfielder could be out for at least "two months".
The injury is likely to see Cherki miss
Manchester United
's visit to the Etihad after the international break, a clash at the Emirates and the beginning of City's Champions League campaign, where they will take on former player Kevin de Bruyne's
Napoli
,
Monaco
and
Villarreal
.
Cherki has made two appearances for City so far, scoring off the bench on his debut at Wolves and starting his side's defeat to Tottenham.

live_updates.title: Guardiola confirms two-month Cherki injury lay-off
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Pep Guardiola
has confirmed
Rayan Cherki
has suffered an injury that could see him miss both the upcoming Manchester derby and a trip to
Arsenal
.
The £34m summer signing from Lyon was absent from City's squad as Guardiola's side suffered a 2-1 defeat at Brighton.
Asked about the 21-year-old's absence, Guardiola said the midfielder could be out for at least "two months".
The injury is likely to see Cherki miss
Manchester United
's visit to the Etihad after the international break, a clash at the Emirates and the beginning of City's Champions League campaign, where they will take on former player Kevin de Bruyne's
Napoli
,
Monaco
and
Villarreal
.
Cherki has made two appearances for City so far, scoring off the bench on his debut at Wolves and starting his side's defeat to Tottenham.

live_updates.title: Man City's new 'reality'? Rodri slams 'kids' mistakes' in Brighton defeat
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text: Rodri says Manchester City's "reality" is that they're "not at the level" required and slammed his team's "kids' mistakes" in their defeat at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Neville: Man City's defence will give teams chances
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Gary Neville, speaking on his
Sky Sports
podcast, says Man City's backline gives up too many chances and is putting pressure on their attackers.
"I didn't think James Trafford was the problem today," he said, reflecting on City's 2-1 loss at Brighton.
"I thought that he looked a little bit in fear last week I thought he looked a little bit startled against Tottenham. In fact he made a world-class save [at Brighton].
"Before the game the teams came up and when I look at Matheus Nunes at right back, [Rayan] Ait-Nouri is too early to assess but he's a new left back, and I look at [Abdukodir] Khusanov at centre back, I think Brighton have got a chance.
"I actually thought in the first half [Erling Haaland] could have had two or three and the game could have been out of sight, so let's put it into context, but the fact that it's not out of sight and it's 1-0, I never felt City were going to keep a clean sheet.
"When City were 1-0 up two or three years ago you could almost write the game off. They keep the ball, pop it around, suffocate teams with possession and eventually the team would have to do something and they would either see out a 1-0 win or they'd go and win two and three.
"That's not this Manchester City now because that's not a clean sheet back four anymore and it's giving teams a chance it's giving teams encouragement which means it puts pressure on the midfield and the forwards to score two and three."

live_updates.title: Fenerbahce in Ederson talks
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Talks are ongoing this morning over
Manchester City
goalkeeper
Ederson
moving to
Fenerbahce
.
But the 32-year-old can only leave the club if Man City manage to complete a deal for
Paris Saint-Germain
shot
City have been lining up the 26-year-old as a potential replacement amid interest in Ederson for several weeks.
It means there are potentially big changes in goal for Pep Guardiola on Deadline Day.

live_updates.title: Man City reach agreement to sign Donnarumma - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Sky in Italy
are reporting that
Manchester City
have reached an agreement to sign
Paris Saint-Germain
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma
.
It is claimed all parties are now finalising a deal for the 26-year-old to join Pep Guardiola's side.

live_updates.title: Fenerbahce in Ederson talks as Donnarumma move opens up
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Talks are ongoing this morning over
Manchester City
goalkeeper
Ederson
moving to
Fenerbahce
.
But the 32-year-old can only leave the club if Man City manage to complete a deal for
Paris Saint-Germain
shot
City have been lining up the 26-year-old as a potential replacement amid interest in Ederson for several weeks.
It means there are potentially big changes in goal for Pep Guardiola on Deadline Day.

live_updates.title: Man City closing in on PSG's Donnarumma
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Manchester City
are closing in on the signing of
PSG
goalkeeper
Gianluigi Donnarumma.
City are increasingly confident of agreeing a deal with the player.
Sources have told
Sky Sports News
the framework of a deal between the clubs has been agreed in principle.
There is still work to do however, and anything can happen on
Deadline Day
.
In turn,
Fenerbahce
are getting closer to agreeing a deal to sign City keeper
Ederson
.
Only if City secure Donnarumma will they allow Ederson to leave.

live_updates.title: Neville: Man City's defence will give teams chances
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Gary Neville
, speaking on his
Sky Sports
podcast, says
Man City's
backline gives up too many chances and is putting pressure on their attackers.
"I didn't think
James Trafford
was the problem today," he said, reflecting on City's 2-1 loss at Brighton.
"I thought that he looked a little bit in fear last week I thought he looked a little bit startled against Tottenham. In fact he made a world-class save [at Brighton].
"Before the game the teams came up and when I look at Matheus Nunes at right back, [Rayan] Ait-Nouri is too early to assess but he's a new left back, and I look at [Abdukodir] Khusanov at centre back, I think Brighton have got a chance.
"I actually thought in the first half [Erling Haaland] could have had two or three and the game could have been out of sight, so let's put it into context, but the fact that it's not out of sight and it's 1-0, I never felt City were going to keep a clean sheet.
"When City were 1-0 up two or three years ago you could almost write the game off. They keep the ball, pop it around, suffocate teams with possession and eventually the team would have to do something and they would either see out a 1-0 win or they'd go and win two and three.
"That's not this Manchester City now because that's not a clean sheet back four anymore and it's giving teams a chance it's giving teams encouragement which means it puts pressure on the midfield and the forwards to score two and three."

live_updates.title: 'Donnarumma 100 per cent not the right GK for City'
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
French football expert Julien Laurens speaking on the Transfer Talk Podcast:
"Is he the right fit for Manchester City? The answer is: 100 per cent, he isn't.
"On saves - him and Thibaut Courtois, there are no goalkeepers better. Maybe that is enough for Guardiola to say he wants him.
"But to play for Guardiola you have to be good with your feet. If you're not good with the ball at your feet, you are not a Guardiola goalkeeper.
"His distribution is not good enough for a Guardiola team. And his other weakness is he does not come for the ball in the air, he doesn't like coming for crosses and corners.
"If there is one league in the world where you have to be brave like that, it's the Premier League. I cannot see how Guardiola thinks 'this is the perfect guy for me'."

live_updates.title: What is the PSG stance on Donnarumma's exit?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Kaveh Solhekol:
Paris Saint-Germain
are sticking to their word to make sure
Gianluigi Donnarumma
gets the move he wants to leave the club in a respectful way - even though they were unable to agree a new contract with him.
He is leaving with the best wishes of everyone at PSG and he recently had an emotional goodbye meeting with club president
Naser Al-Khelaifi
.
Manchester City
are the best option for him and it has just been a matter of negotiating a deal and waiting for
Ederson’
s future to be resolved.
Donnarumma’s departure will mark the end of the so-called Galactico era. PSG now have a policy of signing younger players on lower base wages.
Donnarumma, like
Milan Skriniar
and
Marco Asensio
arrived at PSG as free agents. PSG are making profit on all three this summer.

live_updates.title: Donnarumma In, Ederson Out?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala:
"Well, what a move this would be for Manchester City. On the surface, bringing in one of the best goalkeepers in the world would be a boost for any club.
"At City, though, it raises several questions. We understand it would allow Ederson to move on, with Fenerbahçe emerging as a strong possibility. But what would this mean for James Trafford?
"Learning from Donnarumma would benefit any goalkeeper. At just 26, the Italian already has a decade of first-team experience, and still has many years ahead of him.
"Trafford, who returned to City for £31m in the summer, could make his England debut during the international break. However, he has endured a mixed start, with costly mistakes in the defeat to Spurs and in the loss at Brighton on Sunday.
"Ederson, now in his ninth season at the club, looks likely to leave. But how would Donnarumma fit into Pep Guardiola’s system? We saw with Joe Hart’s replacement by Claudio Bravo that Guardiola prefers ball-playing goalkeepers. Donnarumma doesn’t quite fit that mould. He has also faced criticism for struggling with crosses and set pieces. On those fronts, could Trafford be the better option?
Still, it would be hard for City to turn down the chance to sign a Champions League winner, no matter what the repercussions might be."

live_updates.title: Wrexham close to signing Man City defender
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Sanny Rudravajhala and Anthony Joseph:
Wrexham
are close to agreeing a deal to sign
Manchester City
right-back
Issa Kabore.
It’s understood the clubs are discussing a season-long loan deal for the Burkina Faso international.
Kabore, 24, is undergoing a medical in preparation for the move being sanctioned.

live_updates.title: Leverkusen defender Hincapie travelling to London for Arsenal medical
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Bayer Leverkusen
defender
Piero Hincapie
is travelling to London ahead of undergoing a medical with
Arsenal
.
The two clubs have agreed a season-long loan deal which includes an option to buy.
Including the loan fee, the total package is worth £45m if Arsenal sign the 23-year-old permanently.
The Ecuador international has agreed a five-year contract at Arsenal if the option is triggered.

live_updates.title: Saliba limps off at Liverpool to add to Arsenal injury list
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
suffered another injury to a key player on Sunday, with
William Saliba
forced off in the fifth minute at Liverpool.
The centre-back appeared to injure himself while challenging Liverpool forward Hugo Ekitike for a high ball.
Saliba dropped to the turf and after a brief inspection was replaced by Cristhian Mosquera.
Saliba joins
Kai Havertz, Gabriel Jesus, Bukayo Saka, Christian Norgaard
and
Ben White
in the treatment room, while captain
Martin Odegaard
was only fit enough to begin the game on the bench at Anfield.

live_updates.title: Arteta: I am so proud, but we need to find a way
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Mikel Arteta speaking to Sky Sports:
"Very proud of my players, I think both teams elevated the game to a level that there was no margins between the two and very little happens, a lot of action in many areas, not that much in the boxes.
"It was going to be decided in two possible actions, an individual error or a magic moment and it was decided in a magic moment.
“You cannot dominate here for 95 minutes, it’s impossible and you're going to go through those moments and it was a moment when our keeper had the ball in their hands and then we didn't have any sequences of play afterwards but we navigated without concede anything but at the end you need to find a way to win these big matches.
"You have to put the ball in the back of the net when you have it, we were much better than last year when we drew the game, much, much better.
"Today when we have three, four or five situations inside the box, one vs one, when Eze is completely through just to finish the action. You have to put those balls in the back of the net if you want to win the game."

live_updates.title: Raya: Goalkeepers need to adapt to new PL ball
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
goalkeeper
David Raya
said he still has to "adapt" to the new Premier League ball after he was beaten by Dominik Szoboszlai's long-range free-kick.
Szoboszlai's stunner gave Liverpool a late 1-0 victory at Anfield and Raya suggested the ball, which is supplied by Puma this season rather than Nike, made his task of saving it harder.
Raya told
Sky Sports:
"I haven't seen it [the goal] back yet. Disappointed not to save it like every goal you concede. I think it's a hell of a strike.
"I remember the ball moving a lot and moving away from me. Hopefully, the next one I can save.
"It's a very good strike, especially with the new balls and everything. We still have to adapt. It's going away from me so it's harder to gauge and save it.
"It's different to the Nike ball so we have to adapt to it. The grip is different, the kick is different.
"We just have to adapt after playing with the Nike ball for many years. It's the same for everybody."

live_updates.title: Vieira and Lokonga likely to join Hamburg
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Green:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira
is now likely to join
Hamburg
on a season-long loan.
There have been talks involving Vieira with
Stuttgart
throughout the window, but they moved to a different target.
Negotiations between the two clubs continue today.
Albert Sambi Lokonga
also likely to head to Hamburg but on a permanent basis.

live_updates.title: What can happen at Arsenal on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Arsenal
have had a very busy summer but their activity is not over yet.
The Gunners are set to announce
Piero Hincapie
as their eighth summer signing from
Bayer Leverkusen.
The rest of Arsenal's focus is set to be on outgoings.
Jakub Kiwior
will join
Porto
if the Hincapie deal is announced before the deadline.
Reiss Nelson
,
Oleksandr Zinchenko
,
Albert Sambi Lokonga
and
Fabio Vieira
could all leave Arsenal before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Saliba pulls out of France squad
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
The French Football Federation have confirmed that
William Saliba
has pulled out of their upcoming squad for their World Cup qualifiers.
The
Arsenal
defender limped out early on in his team’s defeat to Liverpool on Sunday. The FFF said Saliba has picked up an ankle sprain.
Benjamin Pavard has been called up to replace Saliba for their World Cup qualifiers against Ukraine and Iceland.

live_updates.title: Hincapie's Arsenal position
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
South American football expert Tim Vickery on Sky Sports News:
“Hincapie is left-footed and can also play at left-back. Arsenal are already well covered in those areas with Gabriel and Calafiori, so I’m not sure where he would fit in. It’s a lot of money to pay when you’ve already got those positions covered.”

live_updates.title: Brentford close to agreeing deal to sign Arsenal's Nelson
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Lyall Thomas:
Brentford
are close to agreeing an initial loan deal with
Arsenal
for
Reiss Nelson
.
They are also discussing an option to buy him permanently as part of the deal.

live_updates.title: Vieira and Lokonga likely to join Hamburg
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Green:
Arsenal
midfielder
Fabio Vieira
is now likely to join
Hamburg
on a season-long loan.
Vieira's medical with Hamburg is under way, according to
Sky in Germany
.
There have been talks involving Vieira with
Stuttgart
throughout the window, but they moved to a different target.
Negotiations between the two clubs continue today.
Albert Sambi Lokonga
also likely to head to Hamburg but on a permanent basis.

live_updates.title: Fulham making progress on Shakhtar's Kevin
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
are making progress towards an agreement for
Shakhtar’s Kevin.
There is still plenty of work to do to strike a deal - but Fulham are pushing hard in talks for the left-winger.
The club want to sign a right-winger as well and have interest in
Samuel Chukwueze
,
Raheem Sterling
and
Reiss Nelson
among others.
Fulham prefer to do permanent deals for younger players with potential but loans have not been ruled out.
Fulham also want to sign a new midfielder, with
Andreas Periera
increasingly likely to join Palmeiras.

live_updates.title: Silva frustrated as wait for signings goes on
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News' James Cole at the Fulham training ground:
"Marco Silva cut a frustrated figure at his press conference ahead of Saturday’s trip to Stamford Bridge.
"Fulham have still made just one signing in this transfer window: back-up keeper
Benjamin Lecomte
from Montpellier.
"That’s despite Silva’s repeated calls for reinforcements - specifically two wingers and a midfielder.
"Fulham are in talks to sign Shakhtar left winger
Kevin
, and are interested in AC Milan right winger,
Samuel Chukwueze
.
"However neither deal has yet materialised - and time is running out.
"Silva’s comments today sent a clear message to the club’s hierarchy: failure to deliver those three signings will make it impossible for the club to compete at the level they did last season.  The question is - are they listening?
"This feels like a crossroads moment for Silva and Fulham. He has just one season left on his contract, something which is making some fans very nervous about his long-term future at Craven Cottage."

live_updates.title: Roma make offer for Chelsea's George as Fulham eye move
live_updates.author: joeshread
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Adrian Kajumba:
Roma
have made an offer to sign
Chelsea
forward
Tyrique George
.
George has a number of options, including from
Fulham
and
Crystal Palace
, who are keeping an eye on his situation.
Bayern Munich
have also shown an interest, but they have explored a loan.
Chelsea's preference is to do a permanent deal.

live_updates.title: Palmeiras sign Pereira from Fulham
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Palmeiras
have announced the signing of
Andreas Pereira
from
Fulham
.
The deal for the midfielder is understood to be worth around £8.7m
The 29-year-old has signed a three-year contract with the Brazilian side.

live_updates.title: Silva slams 'unbelievable' decision to rule out King goal
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Marco Silva
has slammed the "unbelievable" decision to disallow
Josh King's
goal against
Chelsea
.
King thought he had opened the scoring in the 21st minute after racing into the box and tucking his effort past Robert Sanchez, only to see his celebrations cut short following a VAR review.
Rodrigo Muniz was deemed to have impeded Trevoh Chalobah with a "careless challenge" in the build-up to the goal, with the decision confirmed by referee Rob Jones to Stamford Bridge shortly after.
"Unbelievable decision, unbelievable. I am not in the best mood to [talk about it] but it was unbelievable how the goal was disallowed," Silva said in his post-match press conference.
"Harsh for him [King], a boy who was dreaming for this moment all of his career.
"Great moment for him and should not be disallowed.
"I would love to explain many things. The first goal - eight minutes extra time. After the first corner it was already nine minutes. It is time to stop the game. That is the rules.
"I asked the referee and he said because we lost time. But I checked the eight minutes. The game didn't stop.
"It's very difficult. I make mistakes, the referee makes mistakes, but when it is black or white, we cannot see something that is not there.
When asked if he had spoken to the match officials after the game, Silva added: "No, I did not speak with him. I spoke with him at half-time to try to understand why the goal was disallowed."
Silva also confirmed that he would not push for an official complaint to be sent to the PGMOL but did say they expect explanations.

live_updates.title: Fulham agree club-record deal to sign Kevin from Shakhtar Donetsk
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Fulham
agree club-record £34.6m (€40m) deal to sign
Kevin
from
Shakhtar Donetsk
.
The winger has arrived in London for a medical.
The deal will surpass the initial £27m paid by Fulham for Emile Smith-Rowe from Arsenal last summer.
The 22-year-old Brazilian could become just Fulham's second summer signing, with goalkeeper Benjamin Lecomte from Montpellier their only arrival so far.

live_updates.title: Fulham remain in talks for AC Milan winger Chukwueze
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Fulham
still want to sign a second winger after
Kevin
and remain in talks for AC Milan’s
Samuel Chukwueze
.
The 26-year-old is a long-term target, and Fulham made offers for the Nigeria international in January.
Fulham also admire
Dilane Bakwa
– a player
Nottingham Forest
are in talks for – but Chukwueze is thought to be the priority.
Fulham have also been interested in
Arsenal
winger
Reiss Nelson
, who also remains a target for
Crystal Palace
, and potentially
Chelsea
forward
Raheem Sterling
on loan.

live_updates.title: 'Fulham near agreement for Chukwueze' - Sky in Italy
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Fulham
are close to agreeing a loan deal with
AC Milan
for winger
Samuel Chukwueze
,according to
Sky in Italy.
Sky Sports News
have reported that the 26-year-old Nigeria international is a long-term target, and Fulham made offers for him in January.
Chukwueze scored five goals and registered three assists across 36 appearances last season.

live_updates.title: Abdallah Sima joins Lens
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Brighton
striker
Abdallah Sima
has joined Ligue 1 club
Lens
in a deal worth £4m plus add-ons.
The forward, who never made a Premier League appearance for the Premier League side after joining in 2021, has had loan spells at Stoke, Angers, Rangers and Stade Brestois.
Brighton are working on trimming their squad ahead of Monday's deadline.
Facundo Buonanotte
could depart to Chelsea with talks ongoing between the west London club and Brighton.
Jeremy Sarmiento
may also leave while Tariq Lamptey is attracting interest.

live_updates.title: Brighton's Enciso edging closer to Strasbourg move
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook:
Chelsea's
owners BlueCo are edging closer to completing a deal with
Brighton
for
Julio Enciso
to join
Strasbourg
.
The 21-year-old is being offered a five-year contract.
It is expected the transfer will be completed before the window closes on Monday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Thursday that Enciso had returned to Brighton to continue his rehab on a knee injury.
The Paraguay international will initially move to BlueCo-owned Strasbourg.
Enciso is not part of Fabian Hurzeler's plans this season and spent the second half of last season on loan at Ipswich.

live_updates.title: Chelsea close to completing loan signing of Brighton's Buonanotte
live_updates.author: Dominic Ball
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Elliot Cook and Mark McAdam:
Chelsea
are close to completing the loan signing of
Brighton
attacking midfielder
Facundo Buonanotte
.
The deal under discussion does not include an option or an obligation to buy - it is a season-long loan.
There was interest in the 20-year-old from other Premier League clubs, including
Leeds United
.
Brighton only wanted to loan the Argentina international to a club in England.
Borussia Dortmund
had made a loan offer for the player with an option, while there was also interest from French outfit
Lyon
.

live_updates.title: Cremonese reach agreement for Sarmiento
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Cremonese
have reached an agreement with
Brighton
for the signing of winger
Jeremy Sarmiento
, according to
Sky in Italy.
The deal is for a loan with an option to buy, which could become an obligation if the Italian club avoid relegation from Serie A.
Sarmiento has two years left on his current deal at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Fiorentina agree Lamptey deal
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News'  Mark McAdam and Elliot Cook:
Fiorentina
have agreed a deal with
Brighton
for the signing of
Tariq Lamptey.
The transfer is worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Lamptey still needs to take a medical and finalise terms with the Italian club before the move goes through.

live_updates.title: Hurzeler: Football is not always about tactics
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Brighton
boss
Fabian Hurzeler
claimed "football is not always about tactics" after his side came back to beat Manchester City.
Hurzeler made a quadruple substitution in the 61st minute which saw James Milner cancel out Erling Haaland's opener before Brajan Gruda netted a late winner.
"Football is not always about tactics, it is sometimes about energy and the energy you put on the pitch. We showed it today. In the second half, we had this energy," he said.
"This can win you games. We didn't believe in ourselves [before the substitutes]. I decided to make the four changes. It is always a decision we make together."

live_updates.title: Brighton super subs inflict another defeat on Man City
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text: Manchester City suffered their second defeat from their opening three Premier League games after collapsing to a late 2-1 loss at Brighton.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set for Marseille medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Brighton
’s
Matt O’Riley
is understood to be travelling to France this morning for a medical with
Marseille
.
The midfielder is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to make the deal permanent.
O'Riley was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: Palace close to signing Brighton's Igor
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett:
Crystal Palace
are close to an agreement with
Brighton
over a loan deal for defender
Igor Julio
.
Sky Sports News
has been told the deal includes an option for Palace to buy him at the end of the season.
Plans are in place for Igor to travel to South London for a medical later today.
West Ham
held an interest in the player, but Palace now looks his more likely destination.

live_updates.title: Lamptey joins Fiorentina on permanent deal
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam and Elliot Cook:
Brighton
have announced right-back
Tariq Lamptey
has joined
Fiorentina
on a permanent deal.
The 24-year-old is moving to Serie A in a deal worth up to £6m including add-ons.
Sky Sports News
reported on Saturday that an agreement had been reached between the two clubs.
Lamptey signed a one-year contract extension at Brighton in June but selling the player now means the Premier League club will receive a fee, instead of losing him for nothing.

live_updates.title: Brighton's O'Riley set for Marseille medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Lyall Thomas:
Matt O'Riley
has arrived in
Marseille
ahead of his loan move from
Brighton
.
The Denmark international has been pictured with fans outside Marseille's training ground.
The midfielder is set to join them on a straight loan with no option to make the deal permanent.
O'Riley was left on the bench yesterday as Brighton beat Manchester City.
Marseille are managed by former Brighton head coach
Roberto de Zerbi
.

live_updates.title: More Brighton exits expected
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporter Chris Nightingale:
Brighton
have let a lot of players go this summer and that number is only going to increase throughout Deadline Day with updates on
Julio Enciso, Facundo Buonanotte, Jeremy Sarmiento
and
Matt O’Riley
still to come.
Manager Fabian Hurzeler has spoken about the need to trim his squad throughout this window, but it’s easy to see some areas could become light with injury.

live_updates.title: Hojlund arrives in Italy ahead of Napoli move
live_updates.author: Callum Bishop
live_updates.text:
Rasmus Hojlund
has arrived in Rome ahead of a loan move to
Napoli.
The Danish striker is expected to undergo a medical on Sunday.
Hojlund   is set to join on an initial loan with a conditional obligation that   will be triggered if Napoli qualify for the Champions League.
The total package is understood to be worth a potential £43m, including the loan fee.
Loan fee is more than £5m (€6m) and the obligation price is £38m (€44m).

live_updates.title: 'Man Utd make new approach for Villa goalkeeper Martinez'
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
have made a new approach for
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, according to
Fabrizio Romano
.
It is claimed Man Utd have held fresh talks with Villa and the World Cup winners' camp.
Negotiations reportedly remain ongoing for
Royal Antwerp
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens,
but Man Utd want to be ready if a deal collapses before the window shuts on Monday.

live_updates.title: Hojlund completes Napoli medical ahead of move from Man Utd
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Sky in Italy:
Rasmus Hojlund
has completed his medical ahead of his move from
Manchester United
to
Napoli
.
The deal is a loan plus a conditional obligation worth £43m (€50m).

live_updates.title: Talks still open between Betis and Man Utd over Antony deal
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Dialogue remains open between
Real Betis
and
Manchester United
over the signing of
Antony
.
A deal was agreed on Friday – only for Betis to pull out, stating they could not afford it on the current terms.
Willingness from all parties to complete the move and still a cautious optimism that a deal can be struck.
The impasse centres on how Antony’s compensation for the remaining two years of his contract is paid.
The move might also require Antony to compromise on his personal terms, something United feel he should be able to do given he has rebuffed a number of offers in favour of a return to Betis.

live_updates.title: Lammens and Martinez keen on joining Man Utd as club weigh up goalkeeper options
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News Dharmesh Sheth, Vik Varange and Rob Dorsett:
Internal discussions continue at
Manchester United
over their next steps regarding signing a goalkeeper.
It is understood
Royal Antwerp's
Senne Lammens
and
Aston Villa’s
Emiliano Martinez
are both keen on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez has had offers, but it is thought he is waiting on United.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that United have explored the conditions of a deal for the World Cup winner.
Talks continue with Royal Antwerp over Lammens.
Galatasaray are also pushing, and United will not get drawn into a bidding war.
Both potential deals are thought to be complicated given the time left in the window, and there is still a chance United will not sign a keeper before the deadline.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed in talks to sign Man Utd teenager Amass on loan
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vik Varange and Dharmesh Sheth:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with M
anchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a straight season-long loan as Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Martinez left out of Villa squad amid Man Utd transfer links
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Goalkeeper
Emi Martínez
has been left out of
Aston Villa
's squad to take on
Crystal Palace
, live on Sky Sports Super Sunday.
Sky Sports News
reported on Sunday that the 32-year-old is keen on a move to Manchester United and is thought to be waiting on a move to Old Trafford.
Martinez started Villa's last game in the Premier League, a 1-0 defeat to Brentford. Marco Bizot replaced Martinez in the starting line-up.
Aston Villa team in full:
Bizot, Cash, Konsa, Mings, Maatsen, McGinn, Tielemans, Malen, Guessand, Rogers, Watkins.
Subs:
Proctor, Digne, Buendia, Torres, Bogarde, Rowe, Jimoh-Aloba.
Follow live updates as Villa host Palace on
Super Sunday
.

live_updates.title: Neville: Goalkeeper a priority for United
live_updates.author: Peter Smith
live_updates.text:
Speaking on his
Sky Sports
podcast, Gary Neville says Man Utd need to sign a new goalkeeper.
United are linked with a deadline day move for Aston Villa's Emi Martinez, as well as Royal Antwerp’s Senne Lammens.
"It's just really clear that Manchester United need to bring a goalkeeper in," said Neville.
"They weren't brilliant yesterday night but I thought they should have been 2-0 or 3-0 up at half time. They missed some big chances. I thought they were far better than Burnley.
"But you know going in at 1-0 that Burnley are going to come and have a period and obviously then you end up with a nervy second half because there's just an anxiousness around United at this moment in time and you know late on it was a big relief.
"But a much-needed win doesn't clear the clouds completely. I think they'll come back in a couple of weeks, there are big games against City and against Chelsea coming up in the Premier League.
"[Saturday] was a good moment for [Ruben Amorim] in the end but it's bloody hard work winning football matches like that and if your goalkeeper is making mistakes it undermines everything that you do.
"That ground is the most unforgiving for goalkeepers. The fans get behind managers, the fans get behind all the players but I've said it before about the Manchester United goalkeeper spot and I'll say it again: the toughest position in English football bar none.
"If you give goals away at United and you're a goalkeeper you'll get scrutinized heavily. Centre forward is just behind it.
"You have to have a goalkeeper that's got a massive personality and character and it's not about the fact that they won't make a mistake. A Manchester United goalkeeper, a Liverpool goalkeeper, any goalkeeper will make mistakes. It's how you make mistakes, how you recover from them, how you look in your body language and how you look authoritative.
"I have to say the two that they've got are not going to feel that so they have to get a goalkeeper in my mind I thought it for a number of months. Every United fan thinks it.
"The midfield is equally as big a problem by the way but I think that that's going to be too much of an ask but that's a big problem in midfield as well. There's holes in there like you wouldn't believe."

live_updates.title: Villa exploring Sancho deal
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth and Vik Varange:
Aston Villa
are exploring a Deadline Day deal for
Manchester United
forward
Jadon Sancho
.
United would prefer a permanent deal, but
Sky Sports News
understands discussions are centred over a loan.
Sancho has entered the final year of his contract, with United holding the option to extend by a further year.

live_updates.title: Antony set to complete Real Betis move
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan and Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
forward
Antony
is expected to travel to Spain for a medical with
Real Betis.
An agreement has been reached between the clubs for his permanent sale for a total of £21.7m (€25m).
The figure is broken up into an initial £19m (€22m) payment pus £4.3m in add-ons. There is also a 50% net sell-on in the deal.
There are not expected to be any further issues regarding player compensation and personal terms.
On Friday, it is thought Real Betis wanted United to cover a £5.2m (€6m) shortfall for the remaining two years of his contract.
There is no player termination payment being made to Antony from United.
Antony is understood to be taking a pay cut to join Betis.
Antony cost Manchester United £86m from Ajax in 2022, with United making a £64.3m loss on the winger.

live_updates.title: Man Utd keeping Martinez deal warm
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
in talks over two goalkeepers on Deadline Day.
They are keeping potential deals with
Aston Villa’s Emiliano Martinez
and
Royal Antwerp’s Senne Lammens
warm before deciding which one to go for - if they end up signing one at all.
There is still a chance United will have the same goalkeeping department as they do now.
Both keepers want join United. But any deal would have to be right.
Both Martinez and Lammens were left out of their respective squads over the weekend.

live_updates.title: Man Utd's Malacia facing a race against time
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
left-back
Tyrell Malacia
faces a race against time to seal a Deadline Day move.
Elche
remain interested with United waiting for a suitable offer.
Other clubs are also interested in the left-back.

live_updates.title: Villa in talks over Man Utd's Sancho
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of
Jadon Sancho
.
Discussions are over a loan deal.
Villa are also in dialogue with Sancho's camp over personal terms.
There is no agreement yet on either but Villa working to get a deal struck before 7pm.

live_updates.title: Villa in talks over Man Utd's Sancho
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of
Jadon Sancho
.
The discussions are over a loan deal for the winger.
Villa are also in dialogue with Sancho's camp over personal terms.
There is no agreement yet on either, but Villa are working to get a deal struck before tonight's 7pm deadline.

live_updates.title: Man Utd's Malacia facing a race against time
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
left-back
Tyrell Malacia
faces a race against time to seal a Deadline Day move.
Elche
remain interested, with United waiting for a suitable offer from the LaLiga side.
Other clubs are interested in the 26-year-old.

live_updates.title: Neville: United must sign a goalkeeper
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Gary Neville:
"If your goalkeeper is making mistakes, it undermines everything that you do. And at Old Trafford, it’s the most unforgiving ground for goalkeepers.
"The Manchester United goalkeeper spot is the toughest position in English football, bar none. If you give goals away at United as a keeper, you’ll be scrutinised heavily.
"It’s not about never making mistakes - it’s about how you recover from them, your body language, and whether you look authoritative. The two they’ve got right now don’t fill that role.
"They have to get a goalkeeper in. I’ve thought it for months, and every United fan thinks the same.”

live_updates.title: Villa agree deal to sign Man Utd's Sancho
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Aston Villa
have agreed a deal with
Manchester United
for
Jadon Sancho
.
The deal is a straight loan.
Sky Sports News
understands Villa will pay a loan fee and pay 80% of the wages. Bonuses inserted in the deal could cover full wage coverage.
Sancho’s entered the final year of his contract. United have the option to extend for a further 12 months.

live_updates.title: Ten Hag sacked by Bayer Leverkusen
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Germany:
Bayer Leverkusen
have decided to part ways with
Erik ten Hag
after just two Bundesliga matches.
The ex-Manchester United boss was appointed to replace Xabi Alonso in April.
Training at Bayer Leverkusen was postponed this morning.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m.
The goalkeeper is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
Lammens has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m.
The goalkeeper is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
Lammens has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: Why Man Utd are signing Lammens over Martinez...
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m plus add-ons.
The club looked at other options, including
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, but after much deliberation and negotiation, they feel Lammens is the right choice for the club moving forward.
As it stands, United are expected to move forward with four goalkeepers, adding Lammens to their current group of
Altay Bayindir
,
Andre Onana
and
Tom Heaton
.
However, the windows in Turkey and Saudi Arabia are open until September 11 and 10, respectively.
It is understood that if a suitable offer were to come in for their other goalkeepers, it would be considered.

live_updates.title: Man Utd agree deal for Lammens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dharmesh Sheth:
Manchester United
have agreed a deal with
Royal Antwerp
for
Senne Lammens
for around £18.2m.
The goalkeeper is travelling to Manchester to finalise his move and undergo a medical.
Lammens has agreed a five-year deal.

live_updates.title: Former Utd defender on the move
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Former Manchester United defender
Victor Lindelof
could be on the move, with Aston Villa boss
Unai Emery
confirming interest in the free agent.
Emery: “Experience and he is a good player. We will see tomorrow how we close the deadline. We are expecting to add some players.”
Lindelof left United at the end of his contract in June after seven years at Old Trafford, making over 250 appearances for the club.

live_updates.title: Lammens arrives in UK and is on his way to Man Utd
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Manchester United
goalkeeper
Senne Lammens
has landed in England and on his way to Carrington to undergo his medical.
United
have agreed a deal for the Royal Antwerp goalkeeperfor around £18.2m plus add-ons.
The club looked at other options, including
Aston Villa
goalkeeper
Emiliano Martinez
, but after much deliberation and negotiation, they feel Lammens is the right choice for the club moving forward.
As it stands, United are expected to move forward with four goalkeepers, adding Lammens to their current group of
Altay Bayindir
,
Andre Onana
and
Tom Heaton
.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed in talks over Man Utd's Amass
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vik Varange:
Sheffield Wednesday
are in talks with
Manchester United
over the signing of left-back
Harry Amass
.
Discussions are over a straight season-long loan as Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Sheff Wed agree loan deal for Amass
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Amar Mehta:
Sheffield Wednesday
have agreed a season-long loan deal with
Manchester United
for left-back
Harry Amass.
The teenager's move to the Championship is pending EFL approval and contains no option or obligation to buy. Amass, 18, is still seen as one for the future at United.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dan Khan:
Kobbie Mainoo i
s staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game-time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in the first-team.
United are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options of
Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount
and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Mainoo staying at Man Utd
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Dan Khan:
Kobbie Mainoo
is staying at
Manchester United
and will not be leaving before the deadline.
The midfielder had asked to leave on loan late in the window to get more game time.
But United expect him to fight for his place in the first team.
United are not expecting any further incomings after
Senne Lammens
on Deadline Day.
Reinforcing the midfield was an area United looked at in this window, but they are happy with their options of
Manuel Ugarte, Casemiro, Bruno Fernandes, Mason Mount
and Mainoo.

live_updates.title: Keane: Champions find a way to win when not at their best
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Roy Keane at Anfield:
"We talk about Liverpool’s problems in the last few games with their defending where they’ve given up chances, but you still have to beat them.
"It’s the sign of a good team that you win football matches when you’re not at your best. That’s what champions do and that’s what they’ve done.
"They’ll improve and they still might get a transfer in the next 48 hours.
"We said at half-time that Arsenal were comfortable and would there be a reaction from Liverpool? You bet your life there would be because that’s what champions too.
"They deserved it on their second half performance."

live_updates.title: Carra: Absolutely huge win for Liverpool
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports' Jamie Carragher at Anfield:
"Absolutely huge.
"Liverpool have nine points out of nine. They've played two really difficult games - Newcastle away and Arsenal at home. And they've been nowhere near their best. What a position they find themselves in. Get the transfer window out of the way and then come back after the international break and I'm sure we'll see a lot better from Liverpool in these next few months.
"Szoboszlai has been revitalised. Absolutely outstanding. It's almost like they've found a position for him now, playing at right-back. Outstanding in the last few games. We've heard so much about his ability to hit shots from a distance. We haven't seen it too much for Liverpool but, wow, what a goal."

live_updates.title: Will Liverpool be busy on Deadline Day?
live_updates.author: Charlotte Marsh
live_updates.text:
Liverpool
boss
Arne Slot
joked that while he will be flying home to the Netherlands on Deadline Day, the club will be looking to stregthen their squad.
The future of Reds target
Alexander Isak
remains unresolved after Liverpool made a bid for him earlier in the window.
Speaking to Sky Sports after beating Arsenal, Slot said: "Quite busy, because I have to take a flight at two o'clock to go back to Holland.
"On a serious note, let's wait and see. It was positive for me that I could bring a few good substitutions in, but I haven't spoken to Richard [Hughes] yet, so I don't think it's a surprise that we are trying to see if we can strengthen the squad.
"But if that is not possible, we are more than happy to do it with this team, because they have shown that they can compete."

live_updates.title: Tsimikas joins Roma
live_updates.author: William Bitibiri
live_updates.text:
Liverpool
left-back
Kostas Tsimikas
has joined
Roma
on a season-long loan.
Tsimikas has fallen down the pecking order at Anfield since the arrival of Milos Kerkez.
He has not featured in a single matchday squad for Arne Slot this season.

live_updates.title: Konate off injured as Guehi scores for Palace
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Ibrahima Konate
limped off injured against Arsenal on Sunday as
Liverpool
transfer target
Marc Guehi
started and then scored for Crystal Palace at Aston Villa.
Konate put in an impressive display against the Gunners after struggling in the opening games of this season.
With Liverpool linked with a deadline day move for Palace's Guehi, questions over whether they need to sign another central defender will ramp up after Konate's injury.
Joe Gomez
came on for Konate at Anfield, while
Florian Wirtz
was also forced off for Liverpool.
"I don't think it's a surprise that we are trying to see if we can strengthen the squad," said Arne Slot to
Sky Sports
when asked if it will be a busy deadline day.
"But if that is not possible, we are more than happy to do it with this team, because they have shown that they can compete."

live_updates.title: Isak set for medical after British-record deal agreed
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Liverpool
and
Newcastle
have agreed a British-record transfer for Alexander Isak.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay a fixed fee of £125m for the striker.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Liverpool and is set for a medical on Monday morning.
Read more here:

live_updates.title: Van Dijk on Gomez future: Let's see what happens
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Liverpool
captain
Virgil van Dijk
says he wants his fellow defender
Joe Gomez
to stay at the club on Deadline Day.
Gomez has been linked with a move away from Anfield amid the Reds' interest in
Marc Guehi
, who will compete for a spot with Van Dijk and fellow centre-back
Ibrahima Konate
.
"Of course (I want him to stay), he’s my friend!" said Van Dijk about Gomez after the 1-0 win over Arsenal on Sunday.
"But it doesn’t work like that. I’m not the boss, this is not a friendly business. Let’s see what happens Of course I want him to stay, as a friend and as a player."

live_updates.title: Could Guehi remain at Crystal Palace?
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News'
Mark McAdam analyses whether
Marc Guehi
could stay at
Crystal Palace
amid interest from
Liverpool
.

live_updates.title: Isak set for medical after British-record deal agreed
live_updates.author: Patrick Rowe
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Mark McAdam:
Liverpool
and
Newcastle
have agreed a British-record transfer for Alexander Isak.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay a fixed fee of £125m for the striker.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Liverpool and is set for a medical on Monday morning.
Read more here:

live_updates.title: Isak set to feature in Sweden World Cup qualifiers
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Just a reminder folks that
Alexander Isak
, 25, has been named in
Sweden's
squad for their upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Slovenia and Kosovo.
"I am very happy that Alexander Isak wants to be in the squad," said Sweden coach Jon Dahl Tomasson. "He is a huge player. The situation he is in is not perfect, and he has not trained with the team.
"But he is a player who can decide matches, and he wants to be part of our squad. The World Cup is important for Alexander Isak."
Liverpool and Newcastle have agreed a British-record transfer for Isak.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay a fixed fee of £125m for the striker, who is now expected to complete his move to Anfield on Deadline Day.
Isak is set to sign a six-year deal with Liverpool and begin his medical on Monday morning.

live_updates.title: Has Isak travelled for Sweden's World Cup Qualifiers?
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill in Stockholm:
"In this room, from 11am, the national coach of Sweden, Jon Dahl Tomasson, will give the latest on
Alexander Isak
from his point of view.
"Isak was a due to be with his Sweden team-mates in Stockholm today.
"Has he travelled? Will he travel?"

live_updates.title: Isak arrives at Liverpool training ground for medical
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Vinny O'Connor:
Alexander Isak
has arrived at
Liverpool’s
training ground and a medical is underway.
Sky Sports News
understands Liverpool will pay
Newcastle
a fixed fee of £125m for the striker - which is a British record.
Isak will sign a six-year deal at Liverpool.

live_updates.title: Villa hold informal talks over Liverpool's Elliott
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Jones and Vinny O'Connor:
Aston Villa
have had informal conversations with
Liverpool
over attacker
Harvey Elliott.
Everything is on the table at the moment in terms of loan or a permanent deal.
The arrival o
f Alexander Isak
at Liverpool has opened up a potential departure for Elliott.
Elliott has been linked with
RB Leipzig
this summer but they are way off on their valuation of the player.

live_updates.title: EXCLUSIVE: Liverpool receive Milan offer for Gomez but deal unlikely
live_updates.author: David Richardson
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Vinny O'Connor:
Liverpool
have received an offer from
AC Milan
for
Joe Gomez,
but it looks unlikely the deal can be completed in time before tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Liverpool will categorically not allow Gomez to leave, unless they have
Marc Guehi
or another top-level centre-back in. Arne Slot is keen to have both Guehi and Gomez in his squad.
Milan’s owners, Red Bird Capital, also have a stake in Fenway Sports Group, who own Liverpool, and the two sides talked late into Sunday night before thrashing out terms on Gomez moving to Italy.
Separately,
Sky Sports News
is told Milan held talks with Gomez’s representatives and were close to agreeing a deal before the plug was pulled.
The deal was entirely dependent on Liverpool completing a deal for Guehi to move to Anfield from Crystal Palace - and whilst that transfer is still active, both sides feel there isn’t enough time to complete the necessary logistics to do the Gomez move after Guehi.
Gomez was poised to fly to Italy, but Liverpool haven’t given him permission to do so.

live_updates.title: How can Liverpool afford Isak?
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Football finance expert Kieran Maguire on Sky Sports:
“Yes, the [Isak] deal is feasible for Liverpool. Part of the reason is that when you sign a player, you spread the cost over the length of the contract.
"The players coming in are usually on five-year contracts. So, if you take £500m and divide it by five, that works out at £100m per year in what we call amortisation in the accounts.
"Liverpool have also done really well this season in terms of outgoing transfers. Diaz and Nunez have been sold, along with some academy players, and that income counts as pure profit.
"Liverpool, who always operate a smart financial system and are never in danger of PSR issues, therefore have plenty of capacity to spend money this summer.”

live_updates.title: sak to join up with Sweden camp once Liverpool medical complete
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Gary Cotterill in Sweden:
Sweden head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed
Alexander Isak
is in the UK to complete his transfer to
Liverpool
, but will link up with the national team later today.
“I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today. He is extremely professional and has a good mentality."
Asked whether the forward's head is in the right place to play, he added: "He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries
“He’s not able to play for 90 minutes, but he can be a game-changer.”
Tomasson says Isak won’t arrive in time for training this afternoon.
It’s likely he will arrive this evening.

live_updates.text:

Sweden
head coach
Jon Dahl Tomasson
has confirmed
Alexander Isak
is in the UK to complete his British-record transfer to
Liverpool,
but will link up with the national team later today, saying: "I spoke to Alex yesterday and this morning. We expect him here today.
"He is extremely professional and has a good mentality. He is very stable and controlled. We have no worries [his head is in right place to play]

live_updates.title: Guehi's Palace future hanging in balance
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' James Savundra:
Marc Guehi's
Crystal Palace
future hangs in the balance heading into the final hours of the window.
One source has told
Sky Sports News
that it’s “50/50” whether the England defender moves to Liverpool or not.
The club are currently tying up deals to bring central defenders
Jaydee Canvot
and
Igor Jesus
on Deadline Day.
However, signing the pair does not mean that Guehi will definitely depart Palace today.
Palace are reluctant to sell their club captain but losing Guehi for free would be a bitter pill to swallow.
He has entered the final year of his deal at Selhurst Park.

live_updates.title: EXCLUSIVE: Liverpool receive Milan offer for Gomez but deal unlikely
live_updates.author: Declan Olley
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News' Rob Dorsett and Vinny O'Connor:
Liverpool
have received an offer from
AC Milan
for
Joe Gomez,
but it looks unlikely the deal can be completed in time before tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Liverpool will categorically not allow Gomez to leave, unless they have
Marc Guehi
or another top-level centre-back in. Arne Slot is keen to have both Guehi and Gomez in his squad.
Milan’s owners, Red Bird Capital, also have a stake in Fenway Sports Group, who own Liverpool, and the two sides talked late into Sunday night before thrashing out terms on Gomez moving to Italy.
Separately,
Sky Sports News
has been told Milan held talks with Gomez’s representatives and were close to agreeing a deal before the plug was pulled.
The deal was entirely dependent on Liverpool completing a deal for Guehi to move to Anfield from Crystal Palace - and while that transfer is still active, both sides feel there is not enough time to complete the necessary logistics to do the Gomez move after Guehi.
Gomez was poised to fly to Italy, but Liverpool have not given him permission to do so.

live_updates.title: Aston Villa in advanced Elliott talks
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Vinny O'Connor & Rob Jones:
Aston Villa
are in advanced talks with
Liverpool
over the signing of
Harvey Elliott.
The deal is an initial loan with an obligation to buy.
The package under discussion is worth £35m for the 22-year-old forward.
Sky Sports News
understands there is a verbal agreement between the clubs, with Elliott still awaiting permission to travel for a medical.

live_updates.title: Liverpool preparing for Guehi medical
live_updates.author: Richard Morgan
live_updates.text:
Latest from Sky Sports News reporters Mark McAdam, Vinny O’Connor & Rob Dorsett:
Liverpool
are preparing for
Marc Guehi
to have a medical in London knowing that any deal with
Crystal Palace
to sign him could go close to tonight’s 7pm deadline.
Any agreement between the two clubs will hinge on Palace being able to bolster their defensive ranks before they sign off a move for Guehi, but talks with Liverpool’s bosses remain very much alive.
To that end, the Brighton defender
Igor Julio
is currently undergoing a medical before sealing a move to Selhurst Park - although the Eagles have concerns that
West Ham
may make a late move to try to persuade Igor to join them.
Until Igor is confirmed, Palace are adamant they will not let Guehi leave.
Sky Sports News
has been told Liverpool want to make sure they have all the medical provisions in place and ready, should a deal be struck, and Guehi would then be given permission to travel to try to complete a move.
The Palace captain is understood to be “in the area” and awaiting  further developments.

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai? All the sudden Writz is in there, a £100 million player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: Decisions loom for Slot
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"The problem now is Slot’s got decisions to make. If Ekitike comes in, Gakpo won’t play. If Gakpo goes out to the left, then Ekitike won’t play. He’s got a few problems coming up.
"For me, Szoboszlai plays. I know he’s filled in at right-back, but he’ll have to come back into midfield. Did they win the league last year because their midfield was outstanding with Gravenberch, Mac Allister and Szoboszlai?
"All the sudden Writz is in there, a £100 million player, and at the moment it isn’t working. So he’s got a lot of decisions to make. I just think, why don’t they sort it for early doors instead of waiting until the last minute? It’s ridiculous really."

live_updates.title: Merson: Not all over with Isak
live_updates.author: Sam Blitz
live_updates.text:
Analysis from Sky Sports' Paul Merson:
"Oh, I like him [Isak]. He’s a good player, but I don’t think it’s all over just because he’s signed. I don’t see it like that. The problem is Liverpool haven’t played well,  yet they’ve beaten Newcastle and Arsenal. That’s the issue: they’ve not been at their best, but they’ve still got those results.
"It all depends on whether it works. You can have the best players in the world, but if it doesn’t gel, you don’t have the chemistry. When Liverpool were at their best, it was Mane, Salah and Firmino. Firmino would drop off, Salah would make those runs in, and Mane too, there was chemistry.
"For me, Firmino wasn’t a £125 million player, but he made it all tick. Unless this new set-up gels, time will tell. What Slot has now is a lot of head-scratching, because he’s got big decisions to make with very good players."
